LsFXej0NEW9l8WC2eiX62A.text: Love this place! Delicious vegan and gluten free options that are different than your average restaurant. Everything is made fresh and very tasty. Clean eating you you will enjoy!

fNDsX0hEol5H7Id0TDLlKg.text: This was $14! I'm sure it will taste delicious but the price point seems a little high for what it is. Spaghetti squash with marinara and cheese, no meat, so pretty sure it cost less than $5 to make.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aSt2DYfu9Na0v5AwJHuNhg.text: Trendy spot, local ingredients & strong service   Location: True Food is in a bit of an upscale outdoor mall area; there's a bunch of valet parking (with validation) but also free parking in the north section as well. You may like this but I wasn't crazy about it.   Food: We came here for brunch and quickly exclaimed at all the interesting choices for vegetarians, vegans and people who are neither. The Sunrise Bowl was great: the egg was well cooked and the bowl had fresh ingredients in it. The portions weren't super large. The Garden Scramble was okay too, though the eggs a bit tasteless. The squash pie was a highlight of the meal: light and tasted a bit like pumpkin. The whipped cream was a good pair and not too heavy.   Environment: The decor was open and modernly decorated. They also had some heat lamps in their more outdoor area, which felt nice.   Service: Our server was attentive without being annoying. He seemed to appear at all the right times - pure efficiency.

it8FxBjRqHGUl160G4ugww.text: In my humble opinion, it's hard to go wrong with a Fox Concept, but True Food is top 3 for me.  The menu is ever changing, with seasonal items added frequently. As someone with Celiac Disease, I am very conscious of what I eat. For me, restaurants that have menus with healthy options are terrific, but True Food takes it to a whole new level! The ingredients are fresh, healthy, anti-inflammatory and they have so many Vegan, Vegetarian, and Gluten Fee options. Adding to that, the wait staff is very knowledgeable about ingredients and modifications.  True Food is on the higher end, price wise for a FRC, but the quality makes that understandable. Aside from that, my only complaint is the staff can seem inattentive or unavailable at times, to where you're flagging someone down just for water.

8TTvdlxeMZIKZRAcX96Ieg.text: This restaurant is a large spacious area for big or small parties. Their menu is True to their brand, being wholesome, healthy, and delicious! I had the ramen with tofu which was amazing. Everyone in my party got a different type of bowl from their menu and we loved them all. Also had a bottle of white wine which was good! There wasn't any wait to be sat, which is always nice. I do think it's a bit pricey, but that's to be expected at this type of restaurant in this area. I wish the portions were a bit bigger for the price to bring home some leftovers to make it more worth it. It was definitely fantastic overall and I would recommend this for dates and dinner events.

DRM62waTwZKeSh2TZnkdGA.text: Excellent food, service and environment! Great choice for vegetarians and vegans! A tad on the pricey side, this place will satisfy the trendy person inside who wants good food and great service. My server was knowledgeable about the menu and made some great recommendations. In short: eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RH11HBwFyT36DsHHQB8cYg.text: Very nice menu of seasonal items. Healthy options here, and decent variety. Apple carrot ginger tonic was outstanding. Sweet potato hash was fantastic. Nice stuff large outdoor patio, overall really nice place.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg sandwich on seed toast.
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch menu, apple carrot ginger tonic is solid.

42Jrp20__d4UGuIGyDbEUw.text: We haven't visit True Food in a few years but someone gave us a gift card so we ventured out.  They updated their menu and it is very very very small. One page with maybe 15 items on it....Not much of a selection, limited options for someone who is soy free and gluten free to less than a handful...  I  ordered the Lasagna which was way overpowering with spices it burned my tongue and very very spicy.  I ordered the ancient grain bowl with no miso and sunflower seeds rather than hemp seeds and it was very good and filling, would order it again.  Wish they had more vegan options and the menu was a little bigger.  My brother had the a bowl as well and we also ordered a coconut refresher.  Two bowls, one refresher drink it came out to about $25.per person....Wish they had GF pizza.  It was cool enough to sit outside but lots of flies, Good place for healthy food if you can find something on the menu but if you have allergies the choices are limited.  The Ancient Grain Bowl I would go back for plus they have Key Lime Pie Yummy

slrLmgcxxc7EYedYWvAPsQ.text: I sat for a quick healthy lunch by myself, ordered a Mediterranean quinoa salad. It was a smallish portion. I paid the extra $ to get the tofu added for protein and the four chunks of tofu were bland, tasteless. Overpriced salad. I had water to drink.  Bill was $17.

pD5zueBINRBQRYjIwhBluw.text: All our food was cold except the pizza. Been there probably 5 times and this was the worst ever. My wife and another couple went Sunday around 4pm. We all order something different and 3 out of 4 meals were cold except the pizza. Our meal was right at $70 not including tip. Even the kale salad that we always looked forward to was not the same. I don't mind spending the $$ as long as the service is good and also the food. Sorry guys but it will be a long time before we come back.

z1ysL1cxmrN5o6iXPzzpfQ.text: Superb food, service, and decor  I'm a fan of TFK.  Everyone in our family likes the food. It's a very nice setting for a meal and deserves some interior design awards. And I feel a tad better about myself after eating there-- as if the healthy menu someone cleanses me more than 30 Hail Marys and Our Fathers.  Our girls usually are stoked to have the Watermelon Lemonade with Almond Butter, Strawberry & Banana Sandwich.  I love the Kale Salad with chicken added.  And my wife tends to go for pretty much anything on the Pizza or Entrees menu that doesn't have mushrooms associated with it.  Service was the usual attentive standard we're used to.  The girl even had some hiragana tattooed behind her ear, allowing me to inconspicuously refresh my reading skills.  We'll be back, again.  I still need to try their juice bar options.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cFJ6WEz6Mh2tJKLcRaEDEA.text: Great menu that rotates seasonally. Good vegetarian options. Delicious cocktails. Everything is executed perfectly and food comes out quickly. Atmosphere is cute, although loud inside. Patio is a nice option.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu. August 2017.
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious watermelon heirloom tomato goat cheese salad. Excellent dressing!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red chili noodle bowl with chicken.

L3IjZ6caeBIl_7c44ALT8Q.text: Came in from out of town and found True Food Kitchen via Yelp - if you are looking for a fresh, healthy menu with abundant options this is a great place to go. Almost embarrassed to admit we came here 3 days in a row. The ancient grains bowl with chicken was by far the best dish we had - very filling and fresh! The kale-aid and lemonade with cucumber were both delicious and refreshing. Would love to have this restaurant in Charlotte, NC!!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ancient grains bowl with chicken - awesome!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna poke bowl
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemonade with cucumber - very refreshing

bnFJV0vHeQjXwexZjXvYgg.text: I really love this place. I was looking to take my mom out for her birthday and wanted to dine at a restaurant that gave us that going out for a fancy dinner feel, while still being healthy. My parents were slightly skeptical (it was a drive for us) but once we arrived they were pleased with every plate we ordered. My dad had the poke bowl and he was in heaven! It made me happy to see my parents enjoy such a good meal that was HEALTHY. The roasted veggies to start were also phenomenal. I don't live in AZ though and I was looking forward to being reunited with the edamame dumplings and they were out which really made me sad! Guess I'll have to wait another few years to have a bite of those!

16GCH0tn6BDqA6S7iUE-8A.text: I had held off on trying True Food for a long time because.....well.....  the food they serve here is like the food I cook at home but costs a lot more money. I came here with my book club for brunch. The food was.... fine. I had the huevos rancheros on our waiter's rec.... it was really bland. A friend had the quinoa burger, which I thought was pretty tasty. Overall, I feel like when I spend a decent amount of money, I really want something more delicious than what I make at home... but if you feel like something healthy ish and don't mind spending 15$ or so for said food, this place will do.

1vIxSFGYAyoySm0aW0dzPg.text: This restaurant is my absolute FAVORITE! The Hangover RX drink is a sip of heaven, we started with the herb hummus that came with cucumbers, onions, and feta inside and was delicious. I had the teriyaki quinoa bowl with chicken and my mom had the fish tacos, bowl were great. Service and atmosphere were great, we'll always return here when we're in town!

wOSojKDdUl0rxqVh5IwFow.text: I am not a fan of True Foods. I have eaten here twice, both times on the insistence of friends who love this place.   The restaurant is for me an awkward attempt at making something corporate more local and at making something more upscale more casual. The result is something in the middle that in my opinion doesn't really work. When our server tried to introduce us to the concept, when he first approached our table, it felt very corporate, forced, and fake.   The actual restaurant space is loud, so it is hard to have a conversation with anyone who isn't seated right next to you. On this last visit we had a table of six and it was very hard to hear everyone.   The first time I ate here I had the soup to start and a fish entree. The portions are small for the price.   On our most recent visit we started with the tofu lettuce wraps they have a very strong flavor. For dinner I had the bison burger, on the recommendation of our friends. It just wasn't for me. I didn't eat the top part of the bun. It was a little too dry and way too garlicky. The garlic might have also been in the sides. As a side I had half sweet potatoes and half kale. I usually like kale but this kale was really tough, hard to eat and hard to digest. There was nothing really wrong with the food I just didn't like it.   I order a glass-and-a-half of Rioja; I like that they serve the wine in this portion. It is a perfect amount to have with dinner. However, the wine itself wasn't something I would order again.    On both of our visits the service was slow. Be prepared for a drawn-out dinner.   Overall, True Foods isn't a place that I would personally recommend.

c5EPOxX7eBMpj8I8cnSvng.text: Amazing! Fresh, healthy and delicious! Loved everything!!! The bowls are in incredible. So happy to have found a place like this!

LCV3tdW_oYVfq-rViytv8w.text: True kitchen is my absoult favorite restaurant in Phoenix . The manager Ariana and her staff are incredible and very friendly ! I brought my from Portland in for lunch and we had a wonderful experience , the food was amazing as always , Arians stopped by our table and we had a fun conversation with her ,she is so friendly and welcoming  . we ordered the heirloom tomato pizza (recommended by our waiter I wish I could remember his name he was great , very  informative , funny and very friendly) charred cauliflower and the torched avacodo followed by the flourless chocolate cake and key lime pie ! The food is always so good and I'm always pleasantly surprised , I always try to have something new each visit . my friend and I both have dietary restrictions and finding restaurants we can go to can be very difficult which is one of the reasons I love True kitchen they meet my restricts and the food is always so good . big thank you to Ariana and her wonderful staff , thank you for giving my friend and I such a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. In Italy you end your meal with espresso True kitchens takes me back to Sicily and the fresh cubed sugar is a lovely touch
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flourless chocolate cake and key lime pie both gluten and dairy free ,you would not be able to tell! guit free dessert
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale aid and , bright eyes fresh pressed juice made with organic fruits and veggies this was  exactly what we needed

jgknFWJ42Qm9RHhY4AjMiQ.text: How do I even start?????? I am a meat, fries, and coke type gal. This place is clean eating. NO sodas! No fries! I order the grass fed burger, it was almost great, the bus was hard. I ordered the flourless chocolate cake, it was surprisingly very very good. My friends liked what they ordered. The inside is really nice looking and the staff was very friendly. They have outside seating. Our waiter was pretty amazing, he surprised me by going next door and getting me a coke! That's service my friends. Check out my photos!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our great waiter True food kitchen
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flourless chocolate cake True food kitchen
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sorbet True food kitchen

vnRx8wXtQdrTs5z-zqCELQ.text: Wonderful place, the food is healthy and presented so well, my only gripe is that's is expensive and portions are small. I'm the kind of person that if I'm eating an appetizer and an entree I will likely take some home to go, here I eat everything and I maybe hungry still.   The menu is has juices, and other health foods. Perfect place for health nuts or those who want a nutritious meal.  Unfortunately this place does attract hipster douchebags and people who like to show off their money.  Overall it's a well made restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taste as good as it looks!!!

YaCNw9qm3rWJhM-EvGM2zQ.text: Uhhhh - wow. Give me some time to write this up the right way. OMG. To start outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer good. Easy and on point.
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower charred is happy. Request hot.
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tofu Bowl out of control good.

3QeLR1dQupQkestYEeXFzA.text: I throughly enjoyed True Food! Our sever, Desiree provided excellent customer service. She answered all our questions, gave great recommendations and was all around engaging. We sat on the patio 'c parking can get a little hectic at the Biltmore area, so plan accordingly. I had the grass fed burger w/ raw onions and no mayo w/ sweet potato hash in the side, perfect burger. My friend had the sausage pizza, I tried a slice and it was just as good. I will definitely be back to try some other menu selections.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House - Made Chicken Sausage Pizza
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grass-Fed Burger w/ sweet potato hash
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Honey Lemonade &amp; Honey Lemonade w/ Cucumber

EZ2av2LflMTMh0bsmLxsgw.text: Very clean food! Fun atmosphere. We sat outside but if you are inside you can see the whole kitchen! Which I find to be pleasantly comforting. Our table ordered the kale salad, delicious, fresh, great portion size!  We also had the dumplings with creamy edamame inside. Heavenly! We ordered the carrots cooked to perfection! I also tried their chipotle Bloody Mary... it's intense but midway through my drink I was sold! Finally we ordered the chocolate vegan cake with coconut ice cream cake. It  was out of this world! Clean and delicious comes to mind with this restaurant. Also this is a fox restaurant chain so if you work for any of their other restaurants you are eligible for a discount. I would definitely return when visiting Scottsdale!

Cw5sAsOiW5jWMjUMwtEcvQ.text: Ok this place I can go to 5 days a week, just because I need to cook a couple of days at home. I call this place my "other kitchen". Yesterday I enjoyed their Citrus Skinny Mojito and just had to have another; which having just one at lunch (non-work) is an anomaly. Keep up the amazing work! And THANK YOU!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The amazingly light and fresh, Citrus Skinny Mojito
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Edamame dumplings, the unexpected dream!

MBkbee6Ii_N-Rcca-C36cQ.text: The ambience and look was terrific-- I admit, I had to touch what appeared to be the wheatgrass covered hostess podium.  Dined indoors, but their patio looked to be a comfortable option if not for the triple digit heat (to which I'm not acclimated.)  The kale salad was fantastic-- never had it served that way and really enjoyed it.  The entrees were tasty, fairly simple.   The service was attentive, when you add it up in the end, not particularly a deal, but good place to go.

XizwtV9Qoi83rRR5sd78bQ.text: My favorite place to go for health-conscious, fresh food. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the staff is so great. They're prompt, attentive, and helpful with the menu. The bison burger is a must do for the meat eaters, and the market salad for the vegetarians (or someone looking for a great green). Hummus and pitas are my go-to starter. You will NOT regret this. Worth the wait every time.

5OVcf7klXEcYgAhMV0teYw.text: Great service and great food. I do wish the portions were a little bigger though considering that this dishes aren't cheap....HUGE fan of their green tea horchata.

abGannCHX2FVXXk38thi4g.text: I heard from my friend, who heard from Phoenix Suns players, who heard from Steve Nash, that this place is one where you can get your grub on while eating healthy.  I had the ahi wheat pasta and new moon drink, both of which were good and delicious. Honestly, I had forgotten it was ahi and thought it was chicken until I remembered what I ordered! The new moon was a mixture of grapefruit juice, agave, and soda water, doesn't that sound good?

vqP6uEiLVz-aY7G-gFJAjg.text: I am not a vegetarian and the bison burger is outstanding. Kale salad is very good as well.

eFcJjQCkrm5E6DPZPoRDrQ.text: Been here several times.. Always good food and the dessert is delicious as well. Their cucumber refresher drink is my favorite. A little pricy but still worth it.

a-8NP5bjg-iTrExezAOLPw.text: Please indicate if the following points are True or False:  -   You and Matt were really excited to visit True Food Kitchen during Restaurant Week. TRUE  -   Upon arrival, the two of you were happy to be seated promptly without a reservation. TRUE  -   The cheerful restaurant decor infused you with organic, healthy, and sustainable vibes. TRUE  -  You and Matt really enjoyed sitting outdoors on the cozy patio that was artistically bordered with green grass. TRUE   -   The menu's variety of healthy and fresh options initially looked impressive and yummy. TRUE  -   It took your waiter about 10 minutes to acknowledge your existence after being seated, even though the restaurant wasn't very crowded. TRUE  -   When the waiter finally arrived, he didn't welcome you to the restaurant, introduce himself or even explain the concept behind the menu that Dr. Weil & Mr. Fox created. Instead he looked bored and just wanted to know your order. TRUE   -   Waiters at Applebee's have made a better first impression than he did. TRUE   -   The seasoned hummus appetizer, topped with a flavorful Mediterranean mix of Kalamata olives, cucumbers, feta and sliced pearl tomatoes impressed both of you. However the amount of time it took this dish to make its way to your table did not. TRUE  -  It seemed like the entire restaurant staff was playing a game of "Guess Who?" - waiters kept moronically walking around with food, stopping at different tables and trying to guess who ordered what. TRUE  -   At least 4 times (it occurred so frequently you stopped counting), a random waiter placed someone else's food in front of you, and you had to tell them that they guessed wrong. TRUE  -  You ordered a salad, tofu teriyaki bowl and frozen yogurt with berries. Matt ordered the smoked salmon, steak tacos and flourless chocolate cake. It was healthy, fresh and good but definitely NOT worth the $100+ bill including a bottle of wine. TRUE  -  You both felt robbed. A much more pleasant, faster and cheaper alternative would have been to buy the wine and ingredients from Trader Joes or Whole Foods and prepare this "simple" meal yourselves. TRUE  -  A snail could have cooked and served your "simple" meal faster then the 3 painstaking hours it took your waiter. TRUE  -  The restaurant's parking validation is only good for two free hours in the lot - but the wait staff decided to play that irritating game of "Guess Who?" and couldn't serve your "simple" meal in less than two hours - so to top it all off, you STILL had to pay for parking, which was beyond upsetting after so many other let downs. TRUE   -   Although you liked the decor and really wanted to love this restaurant, you don't recommend it to anyone since you have most certainly tasted MUCH better health food. TRUE  Thank you for your responses to these True Food Kitchen statements. We are excited for when you return to enjoy more of our overpriced food and overwhelmingly bad service. FALSE!!!

CkxBi-YbtNTYxfT_QJeAdw.text: I love love LOVE this place. My boss (who is into healthy eating) recommended this place. I went over with some highly skeptical friends and one dinner was enough to convert them into believers! The food here is so good! We had the Shrimp dumplings and the Onion tart as starters. We ordered the Shirataki noodles and street tacos as entrees. So also ordered the Kale-aid. All of the dishes were yummy.  I have gone back many times since then and have never been disappointed! I have gone after yoga to get some Kale salad or the chicken chopped salad. I always have to get the Kale aid.  Once, a guy at the next table, uprooted a whole plant by mistake (on the patio) and was highly embarrassed as was his date! Ever since, I have very careful not to throw my arms around as I can be quite clumsy sometimes! I do NOT want to be banned from my favorite place for my clumsiness! I don't think I can live without True Food!

WuvTbSbJP0q9X39cxURxCg.text: I am not a huge organic guy, nor do I have any dietary restrictions. So maybe I am not True Food's target audience. With that said, I have had organic and gluten-free fare that has been very tasty. Unfortunately, I cannot say the same about the food at TF. The dishes we ordered (chili shrimp and fish tacos) were bland and unimaginative. The setting inside was sleek and the open kitchen idea is novel. The service was slow and forgettable. And since it is organic and fresh ingredients, the prices are a bit higher. I would not refuse to go back to TF, but I certainly would not recommend it.

To3fc18QCC6DuPv4EFhRGw.text: Got the buffalo burger. Truly a good burger. A little pricey but nice cool atmosphere and great service.  Felt healthy after eating there although I doubt my burger was healthy at all

NMP5wgFDXIcKUu0CInKgwg.text: EVERYTHING here is delicious.  I have never been disappointed in any of it.  It also is really nice to be next to everyone preparing the fresh food for you.  The service is very friendly, and usually pretty quick for a sit-down restaurant.  There are options for vegetarians, vegans, and the omnivorous.  If you get a chance, try the Medicine Man- an amazing rush of antioxidants that will make you feel wonderful for the rest of the day!  I cannot say enough great things about this place.  Just GO.

mkRYFXb589Muj_T1Bk041g.text: The food was good and healthy but, the portion sizes are very skimpy for the high price you will pay.  Plus, you will pay a premium and might not get enough to eat and you might not receive great service.  Based on my experience, I received poor service from the moment I walked in the entrance of True Food Kitchen.  The hostess was very rude and had an unpleasant and ugly attitude.  It was shocking to encounter a hostess at a restaurant at Biltmore Fashion Park with a nasty attitude.  The hostess had clearly not been trained about how to provide good hospitality.  She set the pace for the rest of the unpleasant dining experience.  A host or hostess should be pleasant, friendly, courteous, respectful and polite.  None of these qualities were exhibited by the hostess at True Food Kitchen.  I expressed my concerns with the manager and he did not seem very concerned about the issues.  It is very disappointing to visit a restaurant that seems like it should provide great service with good food and to encounter poor service instead.  It is not acceptable for a restaurant to charge a premium price for food and to offer substandard service.  I am not satisfied with the type of service I received and I want to let others know about it.  There are many other great restaurants you should try instead of this one.

tsDBl50kRpBONCHVY9enaw.text: This is a natural junkie's paradise.  Everything fresh, organic, non-gmo & most importantly, TASTY!  A bit on the expensive side but when is healthy food not?  Our server was very knowledgeable and personable.  I wish we had a place like this where we live.

mYvxB6kCXwgRBxfxQtD58Q.text: Came here on a Tuesday night to catch up with an old friend. Ordered the Farmer Salad with Chicken - delicious! Love the atmosphere, the varied menu and the wine list is spot on. Can't wait to come back!

TJ1j1zqcNfM4ibqAhWACwg.text: Have been several Fox Concept gift cards so we will be trying all of his places. Last night we started with a Kale salad and a tomato and watermelon salad, sounds odd but really good. The we had the red chile shrimp, delicious and the sea bass which wife said was ok. Overall meal was fine and reasonable at $105 for food and drinks. Trying the Culinary Dropout tonight.

mEs8wKXi771PAtV3UtwW6A.text: Wow! Love this place and what it is about. Great tasting healthy food. They have meat options so you don't have to be a Vegan to like this place. I had the inside out quinoa burger with kale salad and sweet potato hash. I also ordered a side of hummus and pittas. Highly recommend both of them. I will definitely return.

HpA1ygnslueJ7n8DyqqhtA.text: Old Fashioned. This is awesome. A piece of Wisconsin in Phoenix at a health food restaurant. I was shocked. The old fashioned was wonderful. So good I had two. Let's say I am comfortable. I hope the nutritious food will counteract the whiskey.

Y5__cDWhdZFfuV304ep_fg.text: We went here while on a trip home to visit family.  Our foodie friends told us about this place so we made the drive from The QC to check it out.  We went on a Monday night and it wasn't too busy.  We waited about 10 minutes for a table for 4.  They have some unique refreshments and we opted for The Natural and the Hangover Rx.  Between the two, the Hangover Rx was better...tasty.  We had the Hummus for an appetizer and it was VERY good...some of the best I've had outside of Haji Baba.  The pita's didn't hold a cancle to hand-made ones from Haji Baba or other middle eastern places, but they were good and fresh.  For a salad we split the Chicken Chopped salad...fantastic. and portioned appropriately...everything was fresh.  My wife ordered the steak tacos and I had the Panang Curry for our entrees.  Both were delicious.  The panang was surprisingly spicy for a restaurant curry (without asking my desired heat level) but I like it like that so it was perfect for me.  I don't normally like brown rice, but couldn't tell the difference in my dish...it was very, very good.  The restaurant boasts about fresh, sustainable and organic foods and you can tell...all the other dishes I saw coming out of the kitchen appeared that way as well.  I would have given 5 stars, but the service was a little slow for what appeared like a normal night that wasn't too busy.  It took longer than normal for our entrees I felt, especially when appetizer and salad came out almost immediately.  If they could fine tune service, it would be an even better dining experience.  When we come back to AZ again and looking for a fresh place to go, I'd definitely consider True Food again...and would recommend it to anyone.  Sorry, no desserts on this trip to speak of...too full.

6C764IvsTmbYWqvJNsIltQ.text: On our mid-day adventures my friend and I ended up here.  I was hesitant but, she wanted to try it and upon the glowing recommendations of the shop owner we were at previously and yelp we went. So here it goes:  Service: We were seated promptly and the hostess was nice enough. Our waiter was obviously bored. As soon as we sat down he began hanging over us asking our drink orders...we did need more than 2 seconds to scan the menu. Its great he was attentive and tried to be helpful, it was just a little much.   Atmosphere: Trendy and the music was LOUD. It was very clean.   Food: Small portions and unimpressive. We split the hummus which for its price should have been enough to share, but really was a build for one plate. The vegetables were good and crisp, the hummus was decent but was nothing special.  Ravioli with Pesto - Weird and boring. Apparently they usually put Red pepper and corn on top, which I can't really fathom as being good. It was okay, again nothing special, also small and pricey.   Drinks: Hangover RX - I didn't like this at all, and I believe it was $4?  Medicine Man - It reminded me of a watered down cranberry juice.  It had some flavor but, very light. $6.   We ended up spending $50 bucks for lunch, so plan to pay. In my opinion, this place isn't anything special, and its basically just reaping the benefits of the ongoing health trend.

M7FPHmFtyfVPT4LGuLWnbw.text: NOMNOMNOM.  I have been here about 4 or 5 times and it never disappoints.  Yes it is a bit pricey, because, sadly, you do pay more n this country to eat healthy food.  But this place does it right with local fresh ingredients and sustainable items.  Their menu changes seasonally and I am happy to say that the summer menu is as good as the winter one was.    We started with a glass of Tangent Pinot Grigio, which was perfect and was served in an ice bucket at our table side.  My buddy and I shared the watermelon and heirloom tomato salad and WOW.  Best and most interesting salad I have had in Phoenix, and I go out every night I am in Phoenix, which means three nights a week for the last year and a half.  My bud ordered the salmon, which she liked alot but still prefers the preparation they do in the winter months.  That didn't stop her from scarfing the whole thing down, though.  I had the halibut with Asian mushroom and eggplant.  The halibut was perfectly prepared and worth the $26 price tag (I told you it is pricey).  I loved the eggplant, the squash, and the sauce, but am not a fan of the mushrooms, which were too tough to cut and a bit of a disappointment.  I am still a bigger fan of the pan seared trout that I had last time I was here, and that is what I will get next time.  I am usually not a fresh water fish eater, but the preparation here is divine and I still dream about that darn fish.    My partner in crime insisted on ordering the flourless chocolate cake for dessert and the one bite I allowed myself was to die for.  It was swimming in warm caramel and topped with very rich vanilla ice cream.  DO NOT MISS THIS PLACE.  Truly fabulous.

cx-JJk3WeHIGSK3LZHXvpQ.text: It's so incredibly rare to find a restaurant at the intersection of healthy and delicious. I give True Foods major kudos for executing on this combo really well. My husband had a really tasty Red Chili Shrimp dish, and my kids had healthy turkey burgers with (baked, not fried) sweet potato bits. They loved their homemade honey lemonade and grapefruit sodas. The hummus appetizer and gluten free pita were to die for. A must for gluten-free vegetarians!  I liked the open kitchen concept but the decor was a bit sterile and chain-y for my preferences (only reason I didn't give it a 5). I'd go back in a heartbeat.

GQ5qS7duPCWezDQDeG1vrg.text: This place is delicious, fresh and can be low fat and calorie if you're conscientious while ordering.  That said I have ordered multiple salads, the watermelon salad is definitely the highlight!  The bison burger is divine, I ordered it on the gluten free bun, they use udi's brand which are poor in texture and flavor but when I mentioned it to the server the manager swing by and offered us a complimentary dessert which was unexpected and much appreciated.  I'll go back but skip the gluten free bun next time.  Worth a trip just for the atmosphere and cool vibe.

ZMfqLgr91gue7KvLYeP2jg.text: Decided to come base on reviews. In the area on business. Very very friendly staff. I ordered the summer seafood soup and the hangover elixir drink. Both were good. I'm sure I will be back.

SsZNgc3Od9AhvFpji7EZOw.text: I love this place. The food is always so fresh, the environment is clean and spacious, and the service is wonderful. It is definitely one of my favorite spots to eat when I am near the Scottsdale Quarters or the Biltmore area!

axobZV5ikdzz_BNvuVvIUw.text: I can't even begin to tell you how TRULY underwhelming this was, and for the price you pay for it, you're probably better off loading up on junk at the Whole Foods salad bar.   The folks who run True Food (and a handful of other non-related "concept" restaurants) are the kind of people I have a hard time taking seriously. If you believe so much in a product or a concept, I expect it to shine through your food and service. Instead, this was a streamlined operation with a perma-stoned spacey staff and the results were abysmal.   It's a shame that such a beautifully converted space (I can't believe this was that old Coffee Plantation) houses such mediocrity. I started my meal with the Tuscan kale salad. At first, I was very excited for this because it had been well over a year since I had seen any place in Arizona eve serve kale. The salad was simple- served with lemon juice, Parmesan, and bread crumbs, yet the lemon was so overpowering, it made the entire salad entirely too sour and bitter. The sea bass street tacos were a joke. Entirely overcooked and tasted way too fishy. Even the salsa and pickled onions couldn't mask the fishiness of this dish. The wild ahi sliders were fair-- perfectly seared, but lacked any depth of flavor. Thankfully, those didn't taste like it had been sitting out too long. We also got the sweet potato hash on the side...which was burnt on the bottom and tasted of smoke all the way through...I don't quite think they were meant to be that way though.  Got conned into ordering two juice infusion type things...not memorable at all. Opted out of dessert for all the obvious reasons.   The waitress bugged me so much. I don't know what hippie food co-op they dragged her out of, but if you're going to be a good waitress you probably should a) forget that you have tables and b) not look disgusted when your non-vegetarian customers order meat. The look on her face was more insulting to me than the meal itself, which is why I brought it down to two stars.   Care about selling customers your "concept" of quality, healthy foods?  Then SERVE quality, healthy foods.

grvHS9iLZFaxRSsykGBQJQ.text: So disappointed!  I had been wanting to try this restaurant for a while, being on a very restrictive diet (low FODMAP).  I asked if the spaghetti squash casserole had any onions, garlic or sugar.  The waitress checked for me and said it had onions and garlic in the sauce, but they could omit the onions.  I asked how much garlic they used and she was unable to give me an answer.  I asked if I could have the sauce on the side and she said sure.  My friend ordered the same dish without the modifications and hers was a good portion with melted cheese on top.  Mine was a small bowl of the squash (probably about 1.5 cups) with sauce on the side.  No cheese.  We had a limited amount of time, so I started eating my squash.  I tried the sauce, but it had way too much garlic.  When I was about half way through my "meal", the waitress checked on us and I mentioned the forgotten cheese.  She left and when I was about two bites from finishing my squash, she presented a small bowl of shredded cheese.  So I paid $13 for a small bowl of squash.

NuQeAyKrZwGogUbA8B-ryA.text: Awesome place when you are trying to eat out and not feel bad about it. The menu is always changing to match what's in season. As much food as possible is locally grown. I usually always go with a meat dish when eating out, but today I decided to mix it up and try the spaghetti squash casserole, excellent choice very refreshing and filling. Also tried the medicine man juice, great flavor well prepared and a good change up from beer and soda. Make sure you give the edamame dumplings, they were wonderful and unique.

f_NF-6Lr0vOs_4UJGNUTGw.text: This place has an amazing selection for a plant-based diet.  I had a salad that was great.  I would highly recommend if you like fresh food and has many organic options.

jVqPr1S2ywl7NKfqumnMyQ.text: I wanted to love this place.  Really, I did.   I arrived early on a weekday, at 11 AM, to meet friends. The staff was busily preparing for the onslaught, and I was the first customer in the house. At that moment, it was peaceful and quiet. Then my friends arrived, along with a slew of other people, until there a pile of folks waited at the door.  I ordered a Medicine Man to drink, and it was yummy.  Once my friends arrived, we ordered an appetizer and our entrees. That's kind of where things went wrong.   The appetizer--edamame dumplings--was so fresh and organic, that it had a clump of somebody's dark hair tangled up in the daikon radish garnish. Yuck. Double yuck. That sort of put me off the dumplings, which I had already tasted and found delicious, but couldn't eat after discovering the hair. (I didn't mention the hair to my friends, as one wasn't eating the dumplings and the other had already eaten her share. I thought it reasonable that only one of us was thoroughly disgusted.)  I nervously awaited the entrees, wondering what surprises would be nestled inside my Mediterranean salad. Happily, the salad contained only fresh vegetables, nuts, and grilled chicken. No organic matter from another human being. I ate every bite, with no regrets. We even ordered dessert, and I inhaled a delicious, nutty banana-chocolate tart.  In the 1990s, while in graduate school, I ate once or twice a week at a Mexican restaurant in the Haight. They made a delicious veggie burrito that was to die for, and I was addicted until the day I tongued a very long dark hair that was rolled up inside my lunch. I never went back, and every so often, I think of that hair in the burrito and shudder a bit.  Would I eat at True Food again?  I'd like to say maybe, but there is the pesky  matter of The Hair. Just the thought of it grosses me out and sadly, eclipses the high points of the meal. I just don't recall Dr. Weil suggesting we eat human hair...

-z87MF-ZVrpKyEEnl2QNXQ.text: One of my favorites. Love, love the dumplings, Asian bowls, salads, pizza, and desserts! Very fresh and healthy. Kind of pricey but worth it.

FL7_XP__l3ErFUf5ee-u-w.text: Medicine man....here I come! Right at the center of the Biltmore Square, True Food Kitchen is delicious, fresh and healthy. Eating clean in every bite, can't say no to a delicious tasteful and healthy meal! Girls you won't regret it, boys don't be afraid. Just what the Dr. Ordered. Nice ambiance for a great book club discussion on a Sunday for brunch. Don't miss it!

3Vd7fhNpuDEkqOnVnTcMLQ.text: Great service at the bar! Omg, banana chocolate tart was orgasmic! And, I felt slightly less guilty since it was "healthy". Miso cod was excellent, too.

hPDbxBPbN6cTyHVegsrA7Q.text: If you want healthy food at fair prices look no further. Great service. The waiters are friendly and very helpful. No matter how crowded the food comes out fast and YUMMY !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

aK9hNRH1iPChefhhBSYhWQ.text: Been to the True Food in North Scottsdale and this one.  My choice for a last dinner would be a ribeye with everything else that goes with a great steak dinner so it's hard to believe I could give five stars to this place.  Had dinner with four others and we all shared.  I didn't try anything I didn't like.  Both restaurants had a great layout but we especially enjoyed the n. Scottsdale location.  Left satisfied but still felt like you could hike Camelback.

KFayFhmOVcB4708Uyc2HIA.text: This place was surprisingly cheap for Biltmore area. Lunch is less than $10 and the plates are hearty. I ordered one of their salads and their full size was worth it. Their curry soup was awesome. The ginger drink was really refreshing.The ambiance is nice too. Prep cooks are prepping veggies, pastas and othe items in plain sight. Everything is cooked in an open kitchen. Very clean and organic environment/food. I am going back!

oFt6wBLNLMjNp3ENio_kNg.text: I was really excited to try this place out and I'm so glad I did. I went with a few people so we all had different items and shared them. Everything was incredible. Each dish was flavorful and my fish was cooked to perfection., Who knew bok choy and kale could taste so good! They have a good variety of food on their menu so there is something to suit every taste. I'm always a supporter of using local produce and wholesome organic ingredients. Also they have really unique and delicious mixed drinks both alcoholic and nonalcoholic. Will definitely be going back.

lgaJh4NFNEtOTZTmISDnOg.text: I absolutely love the food and atmosphere but in the 3 times I have been to this location, the service has been terrible. I waited 45 minutes for a salad and another 20 minutes to get my credit card back after I paid as I watched my waiter serve other guests.

8PZDKw7G3B5NffwLECzbEg.text: Loved it, wish I had one close to my home. The service was excellent, the food was incredible. We went on Valentines Day at lunch. The restaurant was full but we were seated and serviced quickly. No question this is high quality food prepared with care.  I've been telling all my friends, go please go! We had the Sashimi Salad, Hummus appetizer, Red Chili Shrimp, a drink called the Red Moon and finally a apple cobbler dessert.

e9Ktm5PI80wH2BBsVVh0gQ.text: I'm having a hard time squelching my inner cynic here. Every single menu item comes with a side of karma, or guilt, whichever you prefer...  I think this place is having an identity crisis: they tout local vegetables and wild-caught Alaskan salmon on the same page...it seems they are more concerned with promoting the appearance of soul rather than actually making good on the barely-unspoken claim to be "good for you." They know exactly which keywords to highlight to draw in the suckers who think Organic=Virtuous.  The food was good. I had the hummus appetizer (very garlicky and I cleaned the plate) and the squash ravioli (too "squashy" for my taste). Nothing to write home about, and nothing to draw me back for a second time.

YnRWznvtIm5z7IHPXgKJPg.text: Great Service.    Food is pretty good as well. Don't recommend it for a a romantic dinner/date night.  Seating tables are too close...

DpWE1U4PScDNol9wf3dMfg.text: Yummy!  The pizzas are delicious, especially the Roasted Eggplant, which I swear has bacon on it, but apparently it doesn't.  I feel so healthy eating here.  The Tuscan Kale Salad is delicious and incredibly good for you.  A glass of white wine (the 6-dollar one is good) works well with the food I've had here.  Some may find it a little pricey, but I think the prices are very reasonable for what you are getting.  Organic, fresh food always is a little more expensive, but well worth it for taste, your health, and supporting local agriculture.

gVFXu_0TnjMEQk3obMVbgw.text: This place is very interesting and there is nothing else like it in the Phoenix area.  Though I am not some health nut, vegan, vegetarian, or allergic to gluten; I found this restaurant to be very good.  The decor is very unique and trendy with an open kitchen and prep stations so you can see just how "fresh" your food is.  The hostess was friendly and it took about 10 minutes for our party of 3 to be seated on this busy Thursday night.  All 3 of us shared the Harvest Chopped Salad.  It was very tasty and served all of us quite nicely.  I would definitely order this salad again.  Our entrees (natural half chicken, sustainable salmon, and spaghetti squash spaghetti) were all very tasty and reasonably priced.  I would order any of the 3 again.  We did not order dessert this visit, but I would recommend the maple ice cream thing.  I had that last time and it was very good.  I think they make all the desserts from scratch because it took forever.  Anyway, the waiter was friendly and the food, drinks and refills were delivered rather quickly.  I would definitely dine here again because the food is excellent, reasonably priced, friendly service, and most importantly....makes me feel hip, trendy and healthy!

BUc3WFCv6iddsseAHHNevg.text: My sister and I are obsessed with True Food.  The staff is always on par & occasionally serve up some free drinks or appetizers (which are all so tasty). Our favorites are: the kale salad with chicken, a side of the butternut squash w/ ketchup & that onion/garlic cheese tart as an appetizer.  The vegetable krudite and the hummus are both great ways to start your meal.  We ordered the butternut squash ravioli by accident, and loved this dish! The spaghetti squash casserole is also amazing.  Make sure you order their housemade lemonade and also try their desserts.  True Food is simply amazing :)

vDwUMlOECf74tgB6NT_XLQ.text: I used to go to this True Food at Biltmore before a second restuarant was opened at Scottsdale Quarter. Both are excellent in terms of food and service. I prefer the ambiance in Scottsdale, but I would not hesitate to eat at this one regularly if it was a more convenient location. You just cant go back to chemical foods after eating here. My wish is that the chefs will extend their range of greens here beyond brussel sprouts. There are so many great Asian greens, chards, etc.in the world. Bring it on. Maybe go wild with Vietnamese Pho!

iq20EO4OX3Gznm1x1CEpKg.text: This restaurant is an Interior Designer's dream.... Beautifully designed down to the blades of grass. If only I was rating the design...  Oh right the food - I didn't think it was all that good. I had the Wild Ahi Sliders with wasabi, radishes, cucumber on sesame brioche. While the presentation was breathtaking the flavors were so so. I'm hoping it was just what I ordered but my friends didn't enjoy their lunch much either. We were all in agreement the Green Armie drink was probably one of the best green tea drinks we've had aside from my beloved boba tea.  The service was great and our waitress, cute as a button, was very helpful. I just wish I would have enjoyed the food a little more. I guess I may have to go back and try another dish just to make sure I'm not missing out.

AKQLOTiFjL3i4Z8GnHxQfw.text: I ordered the tuna salad which was a very small portion and lacked all of the greens this place raves about.  My wife's dish was a curry with the rice already mixed in that was like more of a soup.  The service and ambiance was the reason this place received a 3 star rating from me.  I did like the high ceilings and clean lively scene.

QhLeCVtBCmuFAFCsQ2x5ew.text: This is absolutely one of my Favorite healthy restaurants. They offer so many different foods that most restaurants don't offer. From the Bison Burger, to the Spaghetti Squash casserole and even the Kale salad. It is so simple yet o good. They offer fresh squeezed juices and great cocktails. The environment is very laid back and has a good vibe of healthy and happy people.

tsfx9grXcMk_8qp5_qqgDw.text: I like the way this place is set up.  I like the super open kitchen.  The interior is lovely.  I appreciate concept.  I've been twice and both times I wasn't really thrilled with the value.  Really good hummus though.  And I loved the "cucumber cooler" just wish there were refills.   Small portions, high prices, high concept.  Good service although a little on the overzealous side.  Good place to take a vegetarian.  I might be back.

lJKEPNzrIYcM9_8dPr48QA.text: My wife wanted to go here a few weeks back for her birthday so we went on a Saturday afternoon.  Parking was easy to find and there was no wait to get a table.  Wish it had been a touch cooler, but it wasn't so we decided to eat indoors.    Had a little snafu with our servers where someone who was not our waiter took our drink orders, but it was straightened out pretty quickly.  We each ordered one of the signature drinks, the wife got cucumber lemonade (I think) and I got a green arnold palmer.  I liked the g.a.p.  For the meal, don't remember what the wife had, I got the chicken sausage pizza.  It was fine, nothing out of the ordinary.    Basically, that's how the whole meal was, okay, but didn't blow me away (not that I'm a huge healthy/organic foodie kind of guy though).  I guess I'd go here again, but I probably wouldn't suggest it.  (I did think the music was a little loud...)

4w654XTaWUmAZoY0umyIRw.text: Good stuff. Great atmosphere. Unique menu with plenty of great options for herbivores or carnivores.

kUe3G4730d9rgmXDRAJg-g.text: What a great new dining place! The food & drinks have a locally grown, fresh, organic theme. Our party of 8 sampled a little of everything. They have a nice selection of refreshing beverages, particularly liked the Medicine Man with Pomegranate juice, blueberries & black tea. Everything had a satisfying taste,  yet you didn't feel uncomfortably full. We were seated at a long wooden dining table, with unique extras - like the dish towel napkins and fun chairs. The decor is terrific - high ceilings, great wall colors, over sized unique light fixtures.  The dinner team from hostesses, to wait staff and kitchen support all have great complimentary outfits - working as a one unit, which translates to quick, efficient customer service. The acoustics do not allow for a intimate conversations, the atmosphere is open and has a good energy buzz. Another nice showing for the Fox restaurant group.

PirBJX378siX1GJEs5WdlA.text: This is a great lunch place.  I loved the food.  I ordered the Turkey Pita Sandwich and it was phenomenal, the sweet potato side was awesome as well.  I could not believe how huge the portions were.  I will definitely be back when I'm in town again.

yQR9bTtTuaQJCCOPfTrkqQ.text: Cool place. Okay food. The chef needs to learn how to cut sashimi as we could barely find it on our plate because it was so thin, so I would skip that and stick with the bison burger. Location and restaurant layout was good. Everything else was nothing to write home about.

dUhoeJaibDiY-asrmHbA3w.text: Initially I came here expecting a lot of healthy organic relatively tasteless and expensive food, but I was very surprised and boy was I wrong. The drinks/elixirs may sound like medicine but they were very tasty, especially the ginger one (and I LOVE ginger!). We had the onion tart for the appetizer and it was a wonderful taste explosion in my mouth. For dinner we ordered the squash casserole and the bison burger. With the 2 drinks, we got out of there for about $60 which is a bit pricey but so worth it considering the taste, quality and service.

VUmvzk3_isBRdCKbLNk7Zw.text: What a refreshing and gorgeous place to enjoy a meal you know is good for you! I eat 110% organic and it is very hard to find restaurants that cater to organic eaters like myself. The menu is vast and to my knowledge a bad dish has never been created here. Tru Food makes eating out fun! Friendly staff and amazing flavors!

PvHayJOUiAhyJ5qneI_E6w.text: I want to live this place but it's hard.  The food is fresh and nutritionally smart.  The service is nice.  But the portions are so small.  I ordered the lentil soup and it was almost all water with a teaspoon of lentils.  Mentioned it to the server and no action.  $5 for carrot juice but the glass was full of ice.  Really?  Strawberry salad was good if you like lettuce but had a total of three cut up strawberries.  So, Fox restaurants, stop being so cheap on your food cost!!

YJPmK8Y3s3_u1q_AUO9agg.text: I've only been once but the food was fantastic and service was above average. A bit pricey but worth it. Try the Kale Salad, it's a unique and tasty side or starter.

ZqNJhSp1o0FxlUTJFv_-Og.text: Loved the Kale salad. Kale is popular where I am from, but the person I brought along was staring at the dish, initially. When she ate it, she actually liked it. Love the presentation. Had a great sandwich as well, good  enough to share. Nice location as well

Xoh7vIglTRgtuyQlR8cwIQ.text: We tried this place for the first time this week after hearing about from several folks...   The lunch was $35 for two with only one drink inclusive of tip and you should not expect gargantuan portions...  What I liked: - Excellent, fresh food served in a healthy fashion - Reasonable portions - Great service even during the lunch rush  We tried the Ahi Sliders - nice wasabi and good crunch, the roasted asparagus - just rights and perfectly seasoned, The "TLT" - good sized sandwich, I recommend it with the avocado, and the Kale Salad - OK but it needed a little more zip  What I did not like:  - Really noisy, I can't recommned this place for a quiet lunch... it is pretty hard to carry on a conversation even when seated side by side

5fAzgcHQtbtL723btgDkTQ.text: This is as close as I can get to a "favorite" restaurant.  It's fresh, delightfully flavorful, and the service is above average.  "It's ALL good".

6lb-yha00n9BG4app7myYw.text: If it weren't for the higher-than-they-should-be prices, the food is great. The kale is out of this world. If True Food has done anything, it has encouraged me to cook and eat at home more :)

0e58QS4NUe5jzYa79SDeng.text: Hey, the food wasn't bad. Like a lot of people here, definitely felt like we paid a lot for what we got (but maybe that's the "natural" or "True" food mentality). Our server Tyler didn't really pay attention to us (lots of awkward eye contact, like oh shit I forgot about you guys), and no offers to refill drinks. The close proximity of tables can make one feel claustrophobic. My girl friend ordered the curry and commented that she felt something was missing afterwards. Come to find the rice was missing. When we informed our waiter, his reply was simply "sorry about that I will let the kitchen know." $14 for an incomplete meal!!!! Not to mention the vegetables were semi-raw still (but maybe that's a "True" thing).

f79hXGti10CKLcxdmmiBUQ.text: Excellent service, delicious food. Great vegan options and the kale-aid was amazing!

2niQOTUAR1dfug3JSjHjAA.text: Loved it!  I had the Farmers salad and they were very accommodating to my requests to change the salad a bit.  Nice choices of organic wines as well.  I had the Chardonnay and it was yummy.  I went by myself to read a book and the server was respectful of the alone time I was there for.  I will definitely go back again to try something else.

ZrfiVb8opnHJAUxiAGL45A.text: I must say I loved the food. Just didn't like the after effects. went with a group of 4. all samples the shrimp dumplins, Edamame dumplins, tasted the sashimi salad, I ordered the Sea Bass Street tacos. All was tasty - Sea bass slightly over cooked. Service was weak at the start and ok at the end. The highlight was the Edamame dumplings...but I've got to tell you...I have paid for it ever since. 3 of the 4 people had stomach issues and it isn't pretty if you know what I mean. Now 24 hours after and I still am on the pot...healthy food certainly cleans you out.

rA976n7DrWKc5f61TMem_w.text: I had been dying to try True Food Kitchen for a while now, after seeing reviews on it on various people's "Vegetarian" lists. I was even more psyched to see that it not only is close to where I live, but also took the place of that awful Coffee Plantation spot in the Biltmore! Yay!  I went with my somewhat reluctant meat-eating boyfriend, but he was quickly won over with their expansive alcohol menu and their plethora of meat dishes- all either local or organic. A place we can both agree on!  I ordered the honey lemonade ($3) which was the perfect balance between tart and sweet-- honey is a great sweetener! I was brought a refill just when my glass became less than half full-- bonus!  We also ordered the hummus appetizer (~$8), which we both enjoyed immensely. My boyfriend liked the tart olives and feta cheese, whereas I loved the cucumbers! There was more hummus left over as our pita bread slices dwindled, but that just means we loaded up our pieces!  For my main course, I had the TLT (Tempeh, Lettuce, and Tomato) ($9), which I really enjoyed. The tempeh was pretty crunchy, but it was balanced by the smooth avocado slices. The boyfriend ordered the Organic Ravioli with Ricotta cheese and kale pesto (~$13), which was super good! It came with 6 pieces of ravioli, which he thought was not enough at first, but after he cleaned his plate he said he was "stuffed." Good sign!! The plate also comes with a ton of meaty mushrooms, which made it even better in my opinion.   We definitely did not have room for dessert, but I've heard mixed reviews of the desserts so I'm not sure if that's something we'll end up trying. Our server was extremely attentive to us, did not pressure us into ordering anything extra, and was prompt in refilling water glasses, answering questions, and bringing the check.  The atmosphere is interesting- a mix of well-dressed business and retired people (think: khaki pants, button up shirts, sweater vests (in the winter); nurses just off work; people coming in for happy hour (jeans and nice shirts); and people just in off the street (shorts, casual shirts, even hats). I really liked this ambiance, because it doesn't make it too stuffy and turn people "off" of this locally grown, organic restaurant concept.  We would definitely be back in a heartbeat, but the only reason I marked it down was because we were sitting underneath their funky lights, and a spider fell out of the light on to my boyfriend's arm. He wasn't terribly bothered by it (other than 'wtf, why is there a spider on my arm?') but I would have freaked out. So... don't sit under the lights, if you can help it!

qpU3U_CQAIimAaaVBIK6bA.text: I eat here atleast twice per week.  The staff is friendly and the food is great.  For lunch, try the shaved turkey and at dinner go for the steak teriyaki.

gf-7ID26XIlh-nJ-64GkFA.text: Went for Easter dinner.  Great atmosphere, super service, fun drinks and yummy healthy eats.  Explore the drink menu...both alcoholic and non.  Two patio areas to dine al fresco.  Sweet potato hash was awesome as was spiced chicken.  A new favorite for me!

nroqkuauPlQnY4yCX39RMQ.text: So we visited this place, against my husbands wishes, since I had heard pretty good things about it. To sum it up, it seems a little over priced for what you get and even though it is healthy and organic we were left hungry and unimpressed. I would say the food is average and $16 for a bison burger is a bit ridiculous unless it tastes amazing.  Drinks were fresh but also expensive and I just feel like there are much better restaurants out there in that price range.

_ejCvtnEgOKDt6dnXOUXKQ.text: Kale salad is big and delicious and server even remembered to ask if I was ok with Parmesan and bread crumbs, which I am not, so great service. Also enjoy the ice tea, out door patio, light music, and every dish I have tried is great. The environment is relaxing outside, but a little load inside.

jbzsndHcaEfo0aLm-XsAMA.text: The wife and I made it over to True Food the other morning for brunch and had a nice experience. Looks like Yelp! needs to revise the hours of operation because my app said they were closed, but we called and sure enough, they do serve brunch.   Our server was very helpful and explained the philosophy behind the True Food experience for us. We started off with some tasty fruity beverages that were refreshing, if not a little weird.   We ordered the Greek frittata and the chicken hash. The frittata was OK, and the hash was very good. Maybe too much squash in the hash...   We finished off our brunch with a single blueberry johnnie cake that was pretty awesome and was only 2 bucks forth single cake. Very tasty.   Overall a nice place to enjoy meal, albeit a little on the pricey side. Also, a tasty and healthy alternative to breakfast (no slab bacon here) that is a nice change of pace. I may not be rushing back here anytime soon, but I would certainly eat here again.

an-c8NORXKNwxjTW4wgJjw.text: Great dinner!  I have several food allergies but was easily able to accommodate here.  The salmon and quinoa was delicious and the flourless chocolate cake was decadent with homemade caramel. (reservations accepted only for larger groups)

NQHI9-PD12IJfkycLsSGIw.text: I have often thought maybe I should move to Scottsdale just so I can eat True Food. I could eat olive oil almond cake everyday!!  It is very very good and I've had really good service everytime I've come so not sure what the other comments about bad service are about.

yEYzDqOt-ju3TST0ZpWpOg.text: Every time I eat here it gets better! My favorite is the edamame dumplings as a appetizer! I wish it was a full course meal! The chicken chopped salad is really good too and the staff are wonderfully nice.

GotLBkeHh2BxKOQ9irOcjA.text: Ok.. you hummus people.... its awesome here.  Also the Kale salad was great...  Not a fan of the Turkey burger, came out cold but everything else was Great!

ovVgSY0d48NkMnGMbPJO9w.text: Visited with a friend to catch up on some long overdue girl talk.  This is NOT the place to do it - could hardly hear her across the table, but heard the conversation next to me all too clear - the aucostics in this place are awful and honestly even though the meals were great (overpriced but tasty) I will not be returning until it's warm enough to eat outdoors so you are not competing with the ceiling - odd to not return to restaurant due to noise level but it really was that bad.

M3jKs9qAu2OuuaOufmBZ-Q.text: Let me preface this review by saying that I really, really wanted to love this place. I mean, it's green, organic, environmentally friendly, they use local ingredients, organic and sustainable liquors, ... who couldn't love such a responsible corporate citizen. However, this visit fell short of my expectations.   My friend and I came here to enjoy dinner together. Seating was prompt. Drinks were ordered and arrived swiftly, at which point we ordered the entire meal (including an appetizer). We ordered the shrimp dumplings as our appetizer, I ordered the salmon open-faced sandwich, and he ordered a curry dish with shrimp. Much to our surprise, 10 minutes later, our entrees arrive. I asked the server where our appetizer was, he said he would go check. A minute later, our waitress shows up and says she FORGOT to put in the order for the dumplings. She had a pad and pen with which she was writing down the order, was she not listening? We still wanted them, and they were ordered. The manager promptly came to apologize for the error and corrected it. Other than this incident, service was pretty good.   My food was good, but not something that merits an "excellent" rating. I reserve "rave reviews" for food that is creative and tasty. The salmon was cooked well (under-seasoned, but nonetheless well done). My kale salad and sweet potato hash were de-lish! My friend said that he enjoyed the curry. Booze wise, I had the Fudo Myoo Sake which was quite tasty, and my friend had a cocktail with strawberry juice in it which was delicious. We were offered a dessert menu, but both of us were full. Price points were decent here with most entrees falling in the $13 - 14 range and appetizers in the $8-10 range. Wines and cocktails are also priced at a variety of points.   Overall TFK is a good mid-range restaurant with a good corporate social responsibility stance, and I liked it, but again, it's not something that I would rate "excellent".   And (drumroll) Grades:  Overall:    C   (the actual average would be a C+, however, I am                         doubling the impact of the service grade. Otherwise,                         no demerits taken)  Service:   C-   (the fact that the server forgot to write down our order                          is a major problem. Hopefully it's a once-in-a-great-while                         kind of incident. The only thing that salvaged the service                         grade to above a failure was the manager's quick action)  Food:       B-  (it's good, but nothing to write home about. Plus points                        for a well-executed sweet potato hash and kale salad)  Drinks:     B   (Tasty strawberry cocktail - which tasted a bit watery to                        me, but otherwise good. Sake was pretty good too)

QrsnocsWdX85R8PwtXC8qw.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat! It is healthy, local and seasonal! Based off a True Food cookbook which is found on Amazon. I have eaten at the restaurant a few times when I am in town. I have also bought the cookbook which every dish I have made is fantastic! These people know what they are doing with healthy, gourmet food!!!

Wll2b1N6EcjOaratgatSsA.text: Very limited menu. A bit to "greenie" for me. Too much emphasis on sustainable and local, not enough on flavor and presentation.

WvPb3y87cpdYq6RBX-DwQA.text: This place has a great atmosphere and I like the healthy living menu theme - especially the fresh made drinks.  The food was enjoyable - though, nothing that can't be easily replicated at home after a quick stop at Whole Foods.  My biggest issue is that True Foods is way, way, way OVERRPRICED for what you are getting.  There is nothing truly special here to merit the cost of the meal - you'll likely enjoy whatever you order, but you will also leave with a nagging feeling that you got fleeced...

lfzaLNosKPkKERKMzy3dOQ.text: Still one of my favorites places to eat!  I can't help but get the inside out Quinoa burger.  Love the textures and all the different tastes.    Even though they were slammed today.... the wait staff was attentive and friendly.  I hear they have sold to another company.  Advice to them.  If it ain't broke.... don't fix it!

yAOU8emHGdUYXpBsXTUgkA.text: Food is really good here, trendy decor, friendly staffs. Variety of healthy dishes, fresh ingredients. Love the wrap and taco Hangover Rx is also amazing. Will be back!!

6Dly9ap0EyQSpOQHmafueQ.text: Looking for a great dining experience come here!  It's not you're normal staple and the ingredients used are fresh and inviting.  I tried things I was a little hesitant to try but so glad I did!  All the food we ordered was fabulous!  Our waitress was very informative and extremely pleasant.  I would come here again if I'm traveling through.

vh3q-5RX33VgauMxWAem4g.text: This is a great healthy option that is so very tasty you won't miss eating like a greasy glutton (which is what I usually do). A highlight was the hangover drink. It was so very good. We had the edamame dumplings with had a smooth texture on the inside and was in a nice broth with some savory smoky flavors. I recommend them for sure to start. We also had the kale guacamole which was delicious and will satisfy even those who hate kale. The chips they come with are nice and crunchy with a good sturdiness to pick up a lot of guacamole in one go. Jqm8XvUbq_HVufS3wZn5Sg.text: BACKGROUND True Food Kitchen is one of the greatest success stories in the history of the food and restaurant industry. TRUE FOOD KITCHEN: THE HISTORY The history of True Food Kitchen started in Tucson in the late 1990's, when Dr. Andrew Weil met with Phoenix restaurateur Sam Fox. Dr. Weil was adamant about making restaurants available that not only adhered to his anti-inflammatory diet, but would demonstrate how delicious healthy food can be, as well as having an environmental awareness, all in an inviting atmosphere. Dr. Weil's anti-inflammatory diet is not a "diet" per se, but is based on the staggering evidence that chronic inflammation is the root cause of many chronic illnesses, including heart disease, many cancers and Alzheimer's disease. This is also the concept behind anti-aging medicine. If you are unfamiliar with this concept, definitely check out drweil.com for more information, and for the anti-inflammatory diet specifically: drweil.com/drw/u/ART0201... True Food is currently in 9 states: AZ, CA, CO, GA, IL, NY, TN, TX, VA There are two locations in Phoenix: Biltmore Kierland Commons Although there are now many locations, True Food Kitchen has a commitment to the community and will never become a "chain" type restaurant. THE MENU The menu is a work of art. Dishes are influenced by Mediterranean, Asian, and Californian cuisine, and include breakfast, soups, appetizers, salads, pastas, rice and noodle dishes, wood grilled dishes, sandwiches, burgers, brick oven pizzas and desserts. CONCLUSION I recently ate at the Biltmore location for brunch. I had the huevos rancheros with fresh corn tortillas and bottomless mimosas. The food was scrumptious and the staff was delightful. (see pic) 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *True Food Kitchen always uses local, organic sources when possible. *True Food Kitchen is also decidedly "green" with many environmentally friendly accoutrements. *Hours: Mon - Thurs: 11am - 9pm Fri: 11am - 10pm Sat: 10am - 10pm Sun: 10am - 9pm *Valet parking is available. If you self park, be sure to ask for ticket validation. *For more information: Truefoodkitchen.com

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huevos rancheros and mimosas at True Food Biltmore

eqGS9ck1J8Q3Ug6BXeXLpg.text: The True food at the Biltmore is my absolute favorite restaurant in the Phoenix. Xmi2MeaJhZm8noedWisfdQ.text: No more than two weeks after my virginal visit to True Food Kitchen in Walnut Creek, I found myself looking for a healthy dinner in the Biltmore Fashion Park shopping center in Phoenix, and lo and behold, here was another True Food Kitchen. Little did I know this was the original one founded by alternative medicine guru Andrew Weil who based the menu on an "anti-inflammatory food pyramid'. I don't know what the hell that means but that high-falutin' approach translates into a heavily vegetarian/vegan menu which was fine by me. I played it safe the first time by ordering Heirloom Tomatoes & Watermelon and Spaghetti Squash Casserole (no cheese please) and was quite satisfied (review: bit.ly/2zOmRJs). This time I felt a bit more audacious and first ordered the $9 Edamame Dumplings, which were surprisingly savory since they contained just dashi, white truffle oil, and Asian herbs to go along with the smashed soybeans. The meltably tasty wrappers helped add to the satisfaction of the rather soupy dish (photo: bit.ly/2yQGY9H). To complete my dinner, I went with the $10 Shiitake Lettuce Cups. The filling was, well, filling as it combined tofu, jicama, sambal, Thai basil, and cashew into a substantial mound of flavor easily scoopable (photo: bit.ly/2hiRds1). I just thought it rather odd that they presented long Romaine lettuce leaves as the wrappers as they aren't naturally grabble and cuppable like good ol' deconstructed iceberg wedges (photo: bit.ly/2AzWKmt). It was still tasty, but I misjudged the ratio of filling to lettuce leaf and had too much filling left. Not a bad problem because it was good all by itself, almost like a moo shu pork without the pork. Frankly all the dishes sound good here. Healthy too with a bit of an Asian accent on a lot of them like Teriyaki Quinoa and Spicy Panang Curry. The salads looked appetizing as they passed by, especially the $14 one that featured seasonal ingredients like asparagus and broccolini. The place was pretty packed for a weeknight with fit and aspiring-to-be-fit Phoenicians. No matter what end of the food pyramid I was eating, I just like what Dr. Weil has attempted to do here since the menu combines healthy and tasty in a refreshing way. FOOD - 4 stars...tasty and healthy on the same plate is always a good thing AMBIANCE - 4 stars...spacious if a bit loud, even the counter allows for elbow room SERVICE - 3.5 stars...pretty attentive considering the flow of diners coming in and out TOTAL - 4 stars...truly True food indeed

rx3skPSflC-VXFr_JPBJ7A.text: Love love love the new spring menu! The Asparagus Toast is to die for!! Very sad to hear this chain is no longer a part of FRC. vef4C5ThjdCJdwurfhMacA.text: I'm glad there are places I can take my vegan friends. It's nice that there's a chain restaurant that's doing well and surviving by serving healthy fare. I don't frequent this place and you should definitely check out the menu before heading there just to be sure there's something you will eat. The portions are smaller and the dishes are priced high but you get quality ingredients and it's nice to know not every place needs to sell the same steak and cheeseburgers.

4zABlsd9GxTTvU-P3MBUdQ.text: Amazing! My boyfriend and I stopped here on our way back home to CA, and we weren't expecting much since it was late but we were blown away by the quality of the food and service! Honestly, I've never liked brussel sprouts but THESE brussel sprouts changed my mind! Our food was amazing. This was our favorite place in all of Arizona! The staff was nice too, and we were seated asap. Theres lots of vegan, vegetarian, and normal options which is great.

BtPkiWZZduQkO-IrzrRniQ.text: I love coming to True food and I often purchase the TLT and love it as a veg option. I've had friends get the ancient grains and love it as well. I typically have a good experience service wise.   ATTN: Manager- This is just rude and disrespectful. We were sat in the outside "heated" patio. We were a little bit chilly so we asked our hostess if she could turn on one of the overhead heaters. She replied telling us that they are on a timer with the Biltmore being in charge of that said timer. We shrugged it off and were just going to deal with it. Until another customer asked a different hostess if she could do this same task and she happily obliged. We then asked our server the hostesses name, Jane, and then asked if what she had told us is True which it's not. And then as we were leaving Jane proceeded to laugh at us. Truly unprofessional, immature, and lazy. Bad for business.     Once again aside from this I've had pretty good experiences.

aqNslj4DhYC9J5HFnAwXcw.text: I love this place (no matter the location) and my stomach is always so happy with my choice to go there.  Everything is healthy, flavorful, and perfectly portioned so that you feel full but not too full.    Get the roasted cauliflower appetizer.  Tasty and fabulous - a hint of tahini and peanut with fresh mint and dill sprinkled on - yum!  I had the poke bowl (minus rice).  I asked for greens to replace the rice but I just got a huge portion of ginger.  Not ideal but the food was great even without and filler.  Interesting combo of mushrooms, avocado, cucumber, tuna, and some radish/beet type veggie.  Interesting but tasty.  My friend ordered the pad Thai and it was delish!  It was spicy, hot, and very flavorful.  For drinks - she got the Bloody Mary (she said good, unique, and not a normal/average one but tasty), and I got the honeydew sparkler which was refreshing, mildly sweet, and a little spicy from the ginger.  A must try!

hyTMCKtSmJNBBrOAqR0iZQ.text: I love this restaurant. Their burgers and salmon are perfect and even though I am not a vegetarian or vegan, their options for these categories make me realize if I was - i'd eat here in a heartbeat. Couldn't recommend this location more and have only had stellar experiences with the kitchen and front of house staff. Keep it up!

s_Pm2A68AvNaZM1ohibMaA.text: One of my favorite places to eat in the valley! There pizzas are amazing as well as their bowls, apps and drinks. They change they're menu seasonally to give the freshest ingredients!

Y2FN2LSZRGL8rLnJL_wKOA.text: Good portions of healthy options.  There's a lot of good food in Arizona, but there's only a limit as to how much one can indulge in enormous, hearty meals. This place is a good change of pace. Definitely felt refreshed rather than lethargic after having some healthy food here.  Kale Quacamole ($10) Big, crispy, and thin pita chips with a refreshing blend of quac.  Seasonal Ingredient Salad ($14 w/o add-ons) The roasted brussels sprouts and butternut squash had a good bite to them, added with some cauliflowers, and flavored with a citrous-flavored vinaigrette. Even without the extra protein, this was enough to fill me up for lunch.  Hangover Rx ($5): While this drink was refreshing, I wish I could taste more of the coconut water..  Overall, refreshing food and drinks.
