3W1Hlbu7s8Xu7XE4-A9yOg.text: After being stuck in my office all day and eating unhealthy snacks, I really wanted a dinner place that was healthy and True Foods was a good choice.  The menu had lots of yummy healthy options such as quinoa bowls, and vegetable heavy dishes.  I had the strip bass that cake on a bed of faro along with snow peas, bok choy, and broccolini.  The flavors were tasty and light which was exactly what I wanted.  I'd definitely come back and try other items on the menu especially their ancient grains bowl which is a best seller here.

hvmOMU5x2uUvyS2p8lWLqw.text: There's something amazing and beautiful about a place where you can go and know the food is not processed, frozen, or pesticide/GMO laden - a place where the food is not just good, it's amazing.  This place is True Food. Thank you for giving us this choice!!!

R1WnonNtQ19aDcMk4FZ-mA.text: The food was tasty, but the service was lacking. I understand that a Friday night can be busy, but we were in need of a flare to get our waitress to come to our table to take our order. The hostess was very nice. Our waitress was pleasant, but it took forever to place our order, get food and dessert, and finally get our check. I will return but most likely to get takeout. For the prices you pay here, the service has room for improvement.

4IOLYVyx2TCsIBI7kYd8Jg.text: This place was great, with super atmosphere and service.  We really enjoyed our meal and was super healthy.

Ks1ea5hgDN8inpQIJ-u41w.text: If I had 6 stars to give to one single restaurant, I would definitely give them to True Food! By far my ultimate favorite restaurant. Healthy but great tasting food, excellent customer service and great atmosphere.   I have gone there several times and loved every dish I have ordered. My friends options were excellent as well! Their Kale salad is really good, but the shrimp & goat cheese pizza is to die for!!! I am also a big fan of their turkey burger. The sea bass melts away in your mouth. Yummy!   There is nothing I dislike about this restaurant (with exception of sometimes having to wait to be seated during lunch hours)! I love the concept. Ingredients used are organic, hormone and anti-biotic free, and locally grown. Plenty of gluten free, vegan and vegeterian dishes.   Highly recommend this restaurant!

-KIGQxlt0LG-CheDiQ-TUw.text: Had a great meal here while on spring break. Excellent menu, including options for some very picky kids. I am not always healthy when eating out, so I thoroughly enjoyed eating well and healthy at the same time.

eWHdrrET56jFnfLOvRRR6Q.text: I have been here twice, and the food is exceptional!  It is healthy, and tasty! I will be back! Plus, super friendly service!

akKjS32PZ7IQ-9Q0fLjFPA.text: My wife had the sea bass and I had the Moroccan chicken. Both very tasty and the serving sizes were reasonable, not obscenely large. Service was good, as was the wine. We will likely go back.

rbApSF9IJU4Iun6_qE6Vgw.text: I ordered the winter ingredient salad and even tho there were no greens it still was delish. I loved the natural flavors and the subtle vinaigrette drizzled. Fun menu and loved that most everything is local and organic. Def would recommend and return.

6TO-x7m0hhNes4012ydgow.text: says they are open at 9am on Sunday well we just got here and they aren't opening until 10 soooooo .... um weird

kpUF190P_eafD_Bt-S-6mA.text: I went to True Food Kitchen in the Scottsdale Quarter with Business Associates last Saturday.  I had an absolutely horrible experience.    The servers were not friendly, in fact, they were "pushy".  It appeared that they wanted to rush us out of the place when we had a large party.  If anything they should have been over accomodating to our party.  The staff was already rushing our dishes out to us and we had not even finished our salads and appetizers.  When the food did arrive it was not hot.  I ordered the trout which included brocolli and califlower.  I should have immediately sent my dish back but instead I "caved in" to the staff's desire to rush our table.    As it turns out this was a huge mistake.   I became violently ill by the time that I got home.   My Doctor indicated that I had contracted a severe bacterial infection which my Doctor thought in all likelihood was from "undercooked" fish or the brocolli or califlower not being properly handled.  My Doctor indicated from blood tests that the bacterial infection was definitely the result of food poisoning.  It is now Wednesday, 4 days after I was at True Food Kitchen and the bacterial infection is just now starting to clear.  True Food Kitchen has lost a customer for life.  Dr. Weill, you have a lot of work to do if you expect your trendy, upscale, organic restaurants to survive.  John

y4YC0mcb9o0Ic1wLjpHK-A.text: Went to this location for lunch this past weekend.   I don't like the restaurant quite as well as the Scottsdale location, but it was still nice.  Our server was very friendly and we didn't have a problem getting seated at all. The hummus I ordered was delicious and the vegetables that I ordered on the side were beautiful.  My friend had the quinoa  burger and also really enjoyed it.  I will be returning soon.

dxWkSHVldjFFMT7Dmv6PYQ.text: The presentation of my street tacos was very nice. They tasted very good and the request for the beef to be cooked medium was accomplished. However, I had a large chunk of an avacado pit left in one of my tacos which I bit down on. It was super hard, and could have been an issue if I swallowed it. We brought it to the waitresses attention and she spoke with her manager. They confirmed that it was part of the avacado pit, but they didn't say anything past that. I was dissappointed they did not at least discount the price of the tacos. Other than that, we enjoyed our food and the atmosphere was kind of cool.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street tacos. Very good!

j0qgwjqSKw6vf6r3vCloDQ.text: I was a little concerned at first as multiple wait staff wizzed by me as I sat at the bar for lunch but I was greeted within a few minutes and my nice waitperson asked me for my drink order and then took my lunch order I had the quinoa burger with a delicious kale salad  both were fab

QLy1r4UvqyAcDwpJ9iur0w.text: On rare occasion there is a restaurant that goes far beyond your expectations. This is one of them.  From the moment we entered, the waitstaff gave us their full attention.  We were seated right away, waited on promptly, and served a dinner that was absolutely delicious.  Everything presented was visually appealing, healthy and had well composed flavors and ingredients. The service was as good as one would expect at four star restaurant.  Who knew that health food could be so inspired!

sfDJtwuHb3m-6ZesSwYl7w.text: This is one of the best restaurants I've ever been to- hands down!  I went with a party of six and here is what was ordered:  Normally we don't order appetizers, but we were starving so we started with the local vegetable crudites.  This was so beautiful!  It was a HUGE bowl of just gorgeous raw veggies (bright green lettuce, purple carrots, large slices of crispy cucumbers, etc.) and two dips- tzatziki (not vegan) and black olive (vegan and the most delicious dip I have ever had).  Here are the entrees:   Me: I wanted to order the curry, but was disappointed to find out that the sauce had shrimp paste in it so I couldn't have it :(  So instead I ordered the Teriyaki brown rice bowl with tofu.  It was simple, yet delicious.  I would have liked to order something a little more exotic/adventurous, but when you are vegan sometimes your choices are limited.   Husband/Sister-in-law/Her boyfriend: It was highly recommended that the Spaghetti squash casserole be ordered, so three members of our party did just that.  My husband veganized his by excluding the mozzarella.  I stole a bite and it was wonderful!  Everyone who ordered this was very satisfied.    Father-in-law:  Shaved turkey sandwich with sweet potato hash.    Mother-in-law: Turkey bolognese.  Everyone raved about their meal and there was a lot of shared bites going around.  However, I had looked at the dessert menu previously and couldn't get my mind off the Strawberry rhubarb crisp with a side of ice cream.  This was the only vegan dessert on the menu, and if you've read any of my other posts you know that if there is vegan dessert offered, it's bound to be in my belly!    We ALL ordered this dessert and OMG I seriously can't stop raving/thinking about it.  I could eat this everyday.  It was so unbelievably delicious.  When I get home from Scottsdale (to Southern California) I am going back to just have this dessert.    This restaurant is a MUST TRY for herbivores and omnivores alike.  A great place to go with a large group!

wCW5PcKHCoCzrYf8lnAEMw.text: Contemporary, healthy restaurant. They serve fresh juices/sodas with fruits and vegetables and have a variety of salads, sandwiches and main entrees. Had brought a friend that is a vegan and eats gluten-free so I was worried about her options but she had quite a few to choose from. Everything was fresh and delicious. I've had the curry with tofu and the turkey lasagna - both great!

XjVBnO_ic0vla21_oFRcaw.text: I used to live in Phoenix and True Food Kitchen was across the street from my apartment. I went all the time and it is a fabulous restaurant! Now, whenever I come to visit, I make an effort to stop by and meet friends for dinner and drinks. Great food and booze options! In addition, I have a food allergy and every waiter I have interacted with has been knowledgeable about the menu and kitchen operations. Greatly appreciated!

Jsa1nlTWupO8OVIKXzThTw.text: This is not my type of restaurant; one that touts a medically proven diet and has a funky new decor. I was afraid this was a big box restaurant and I'm still not sure that it isn't. The drink I got was very good, a cucumber lemonade that wasn't too sweet. The turkey burger was OK, not much flavor, but the sweet potato hash was really tasty. I had a bite of my friend's kale salad which surprisingly masked the bitter taste of kale. The price was what I expected, but I would be reluctant to return in the near future.

RiqetysXs90rAkhQ4CJgqA.text: Friendly staff! Fresh, healthy, yummy food! I love the Quinoa tabouleh with roasted beets! A perfect lunch spot!

dUqApDWKTCd3EdpPXRbudg.text: I went here for the first time yesterday. We beat the lunch rush by getting there at 11:30. By 12, there was a wait for a table. I was kinda scared of the menu because I typically eat 'bland with bland and a side of bland'. I ordered the turkey pita (not sure the official name) with a side kale salad. I skipped out of the provolone, which made the sandwich a little dry, but it was still really yummy. The kale salad was a big surprise....I liked it alot and had never tried kale before! My sister ordered the terriaki tofu. Her only complaint was that there wasn't enough actual tofu in her dish. I will definitely go back. Next time, I want to try one of their yummy drinks!

IHUcTXDSr0-ffIowaEN1YQ.text: I always love going to hippy-dippy places that use organic ingredients and choose to fry free range animals.  (If you grew up in Boulder, Colorado, you might likely feel similarly.)  This is essentially the story behind True Food, though I don't believe anything is fried, per se.  Quite a few people at about 6 p.m. on a Sunday evening -- waited 20 minutes.  Ate the green tea soba noodles, quite satisfactory; my mom had the turkey burger and sweet potato hash, which she liked, while my aunt had a wild shrimp, onion and goat cheese pizza which apparently was okay.  Couple notes: the tables in the restaurant are situated quite closely together, which makes it prone to traffic jams (however I did see one guest in a wheelchair navigate relatively easily), and the space is a bit loud and according to my mother, "the chairs don't accommodate one with an ample behind very well."  Oh Mom, that's the media telling you your behind is ample.  But perhaps places like this restaurant are trying to combat that.  True Food was pretty alright -- I loved that the hostess' station was covered in fake grass.

NLFX9lZh_Kgp2LffQ6pXLA.text: Huge increase in vegetarian/vegan foods here over the past year. Very nice staff, great atmosphere, tasty food, what else could you want!

og36XaCppu4z6NalBhR-hw.text: True Food was the most recent of my new lunch spots to try.  Very cool environment inside with kind of the "green" concept.  Everything, or atleast I think everything, is locally grown, organic type food.  You kinda have a healthy feeling in there.  I ordered the Sashimi Tuna salad which was fantastic.  They are very generous on the tuna as you get some with every bite until the end.  It is also filled with cucumbers, edamames, tomato, avacado, and ginger dressing.  I'm not sure if it was healthy but it felt healthy for some reason.     The staff was very friendly and the decor is pretty neat.  Its a very open space and I think they even have some community seating in the front.  I happen to sit at the bar where you could watch them make fresh "Natural Refreshments" as they call them.  As nice as everyone was they do have some kinks to work out as all new establishments do.  I ordered a hot green tea and the server was very excited to take my order.  About 3 minutes later she came back and said she didnt forget about the tea she was just waiting on a tea pot?  I was a lil confused?  Did they not order enough tea pots when they opened?  Couldnt she just make it and put it in some other glass?  I mean tea is just a tea bag and some hot water right?  I didnt suggest these ideas to her so i just patiently waited.  About 20 minutes later after i had finished my salad I said "Do you have the tea?" She was still waiting for a tea pot and replied with a smile, "I didn't forget about you Im still waiting for the tea pots.  They are going through storage in the back and getting some cleaned up for you."  I thought to myself, "okkkk".  In the end, I did get my green tea.  However, I never got it in the pot.  She put it in a to go cup for me in which the lid didnt really fit.  Why she didnt do that to begin with so i could enjoy the tea with my meal was beyond me.  HAAA!!  Bottom line- Good food!  Everything i saw go by smelled and looked very good.  Just ask if they have tea pots BEFORE you order your hot tea.  Cool decor!  Oh! and definitly go to the bathroom.  Cool waterless urinals which they tell you saves 40,000 gallons of water a year and cool powerful eco-friendly hand dryers!

rnT5JF4W4jF6dBhQV3ZQvQ.text: As a registered dietitian, I am constantly searching for restaurants that offer wholesome, healthy and delicious options. We started off with the elixirs which were all uniquely tasty and refreshing. We followed the drinks with the hummus which was as good as it gets. I got the curry dish but substituted chicken with tofu. I never wanted my plate to end! The flavors were exceptional but not overpowering. Our waiter was knowledgeable, curteous, and pleasant. Dessert was the blood orange cake. One bite was enough to satisfy the obligatory after dinner sweet craving. I recommend this restaurant to ANYONE! YUM!!

KKHRRVlwQQJSyThweiCJtg.text: Even my steak loving brother in law liked the place. It had a cool eco-friendly look very helpful staff and very fresh. I'll be back.

RNco6pXuK1N-uM4aQccc2g.text: I will continue to give this place five stars for so many reasons.  First, the menu is very creative, and offers a great variety of healthy food, with an Asian twist.  This time I had the shrimp curry, which had lots of fresh vegetables, and instead of a heavy cream curry, it was a much healthier broth curry.  We had the edamame dumplings again, which were as good as I remembered.  It was kind of cool to see Dr. Weil eating there last night.  It's good to know that he likes the place enough to dine there.

lUIB4P4CDCgDTI-XbhxmoQ.text: Though I was sad to learn Coffee Plantation was gone, Fox has done a great job with this new restaurant. Clean, fantastic foods with veg, began, and gluten free options that are great on taste! Service was outstanding and our first visit was memorable. Will be back on our next visit to Phoenix.

t2MtQysprNa8X6pYlv9ulw.text: I love it. We come at a busy night but the staff still enough for us not to wait long. We are seated and given a couple of water. The waitress is really nice. Since it is my first time, my friend order foods for us. Yes, the idea of organic food kind of but me in a mood "Healthy food - not taste good." But it amazing how the food taste. You can taste the texture and sweetness of the veges. I like the pizza the best. Taste different than normal pizza but still have the flavor in it. I definitely come back for this. (Already ask for few business card)

AfSBI66p_OxmJFKgmCUTWg.text: I'll start by saying I absolutely love this place and their food. However, I witnessed something yesterday during my late lunch with a friend that I found repulsive. I walked into the men's room as one of the cooks (shorter guy with a beard) was finishing at the urinal, when he finished, he walked out without washing his hands! Out of the corner of my eye a second cook who was in the stall walked out of the stall and also did not wash his hands! Gross! I pointed it out to our waiter and he said he would say something to the one person whom I was able to recognize and I opted to not have him say anything (for obvious reasons). The waiter offered that they have a hand washing station near the kitchen and the gentlemen probably washed their hands there....I'm not buying it. I know I may be somewhat of a germaphobe but that is inexcusable for a chef who is making salads and things which are not cooked to do something like this...furthermore, it is a major health code violation! Lavese sus manos amigos!!!

Eeh7Ml55y40m3_R4rHCocQ.text: I have been to True Food 3 times now and i am very impressed. first of all the decor is bright, airy, and environmentally responsible with reclaimed wood floors and those awesome dyson hand dryers in the bathrooms. filtered water is brought to the table in reusable glass bottles.  why people have written that they dont like to watch the food being prepped on the open table confuses me. some of the best kitchens in the world have an open kitchen and watching chefs prep beautiful fruits and vegetables shows me how much they care about the quality of their produce. Now to the food- the only time i have ever heard of olivelo juice and it was delicious. so was the green ice tea and the cucumber refresher. i have had over half the menu and even the tempeh tlt which i thought  might be too healthy turned out to be Delicious. the soba noodles , shrimp dumplings and local vegetables were really fresh and tasty. loved the kale salad and the green tea soba noodles. turkey burger was very nice and i didnt miss not having beef. Overall i like the eclectic mix on the menu and i can always find something i am in the mood for. I highly recommend giving this place a try. I will be eating here every week.

J19TUe8CMm2j0sNyXwPlIQ.text: I've traveled to Phoenix several times for business trips and stayed at the Ritz. True Foods was my go to spot in Phoenix because it was right across the street from the hotel. I love this restaurant for the casual vibe and healthy food. My favorite dishes are the Edamame Dumplings and the Miso Glazed Black Cod. It was often hard to get out of work for lunch, so coming to True Foods at the end of the day was always a treat.   I only wish they had one in San Francisco!

tIW0uoOXQqkYKIU2wryexA.text: Went here on my Birthday. Well isn't this an odd little place that will make your health food kick diet smile. Positives- the hummus- I love hummus and this is the best I have had so far. Now that is saying a lot because I love the hummus at Pita Jungle and I never thought I would ever dethrone their dish, but alas I have. Be forewarned it is very garlicky!( Probably why I love it so much!)  I had the shrimp dumplings and shaved turkey sandwich with Sweet Potato Hash( bland) . It was good but nothing to write home about. They have funny non alcoholic drinks with cute names that my friends say are great though I did not have one.( NOjito for no alcohol Mojito-funny!) I would say check it out but be forewarned it is a bit BILTMORE STUFFY for an average Joe or Josephine and it is very expensive. The service was outstanding. At one point I had 5 servers waiting on me at once. Some people do not like that, but I sure do!!

kQUfnySixod5rwntTRvijQ.text: Went here for my friend's birthday on a Friday night. The wait was only 10-15 min and the staff was very nice in putting the cake I brought in the fridge and bringing it out with candles. A little expensive but the food is good and the stmosphere is nice. I just wish it were brighter so I could see my food and I wish they would have warned that the sweet potato hash isn't very good. Overall it was a nice experience but i wouldn't travel the 20 min and pay 20 bucks to eat here often

WnMjl8J0wxGtoLF3okmckA.text: Good healthy eats where everything is organic.  But if eating organic food is not totally up your alley then it may seem a bit more expensive.  I got the tuna sashimi salad which was really to die for.  It was a nice size for me because Im not a heavy eater.  Boyfriend got some steak tacos which were really good but you pay about $15 for only 2 small tacos.

RyQPlgSUt8uGF41Esr6fUg.text: This place was recommended to us by some friends, so we decided to try it on a whim one night.  The decor was very modern and earthy.  Our server was very knowledgable about the items on the menu, and gave my husband the advice of trying to "half portions" of the asian dishes he was debating between.  Turns out the half portions are HUGE.  He took almost a whole one home.  The teriyaki was a little bit too salty for my taste, but I thought the curry dish was excellent.  I had the steak tacos adn I thought they were also very well done.  The men at the table next to us ordered some hot sauce to go along with theirs, and I think I'll do that next time too.  I'll definitely be coming back here, especially when my sister is in town because they have a variety of gluten free menu items.

sb_BIkbz_P7K3gWG2FeswQ.text: what can i say...we are fans!!! i am addicted to the Cucumber Refresher, i think it is honey lemonade with cucumber (& possibly crack, the way you will crave it!!). it is truly refreshing & reminds me of the fruity refreshing afternoon drinks that are served in SE asia & indonesia (bali, thailand, vietnam...) i am a sucker for the kale salad:simple, filling, tangy, delish!! but the best item i think they have is the bison burger!!! WOW!! hands down the BEST burger in phoenix, juicy, always cooked to perfection, the flavors dance together in your mouth and you will want more!  initially i thought it would be kind of gamey, and never measure up to the likes of delux, the grind, maizie's, rocket burger, chelsea's kitchen and others, but amazingly i was blown away & it is a weekly staple for my man! desserts are also fresh, innovative & tantalizing. i have been eyeballing their brunch menu & am looking forward to trying it soon - overall - GO you will love it!

UuuYvF3XIDQ9cqGxbmOawA.text: I had very high expectations for this place since I had heard so many good things about it before coming so I was pretty disappointed since my experiences definitely were nothing to get overly excited about.   I went the first time with a friend who had the ahi sliders which I have to say were quite good. I had ordered one of their pizzas which was OK but pretty average. I just chalked this up to this restaurant not really being the best place to order pizza.   The next time I went, I thought, I'll get the ahi sliders since they were so tasty last time. Well, this time was completely the opposite. The tuna had a much fishier smell this time and the bun was all soggy. It seemed like the sandwich had been sitting out for awhile before I even got it. It was so bad I could only manage to eat half a slider. I was considering sending my order back but no one ever asked me if I liked my food. By the time someone had come by to check up on us, I had already resigned myself to the fact that I was going to have to eat a snack once I got home.  On a side note, the sliders came with sweet potato hash as a side. When I asked if I could substitute the side, I was told that I could only have the kale salad. This didn't really make sense to me since even though there were several other sides that were the same price as the sweet potato hash, I was told that these weren't available as substitutions. The worst part about it was I ended up getting the kale salad and it was so garlicky that I could hardly eat that either.  Too bad... I like the idea of healthy, fresh food but not at the expense of flavor and mediocre service.

-4OuAp9pN_0gU5NpOGhApg.text: What I wouldn't give to live near a True Food. My PHX friends have often told me of this place but I finally skipped my other regular places and headed to Dr. Wiels place. I was on a gluten free food trial and saw the mushroom pizza on the menu which can be made gluten free.  I sat at the bar even though the patio was very inviting. The bar was awesome and I felt like it was my mother ship! I could see all the fresh fruit, veggies and juices. The bartender was sending out all sorts of things from beer and wine to delicious looking cocktails.  I ordered a gluten free cider and the pizza and it might just be the best pizza I've ever had. I made myself only eat half so I could finish it on the drive back to Tucson- that didn't pan out so well. I think I made it to chandler bf I had to finish it! Generally the prices are high but you're getting delicious great quality good for you food!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gluten free mushroom pizza

F0GzGX2jU6IyCxfDmxai4Q.text: True Food Kitchen indeed serves the most True and delicious foods in their beautiful open kitchen.   The restaurant is simply picturesque and is how I would love my future kitchen to look like. It's new country chic, first page worthy of a True food recipe book, and perfectly complements their healthy menu items.   We started off with a couple of cocktails: "Acai & Apricot" and "Cherry Bourbon Sour". The thing about their fresh juices and cocktails is that you won't regret it with whatever you decide on. They're all amazing! However, this time we visited, the Cherry Bourbon Sour was a bit too sour without any tint of cherry bourbon so we told the server and the restaurant manager personally remade the drink himself and also brought the "Ginger Margarita" for us to try as if he read my mind! Needless to say, their service is excellent and they try their utmost best to serve high quality food and drinks.   My husband ordered the "Grass-Fed Bison Burger", which was the size of the moon and very tasty. It comes with a side of kale or sweet potatoes or you could ask for a little bit of both! Then I ordered the Panang Curry with chicken and I must say, ever since I tried their Panang Curry, I can't get it anywhere else. Their Panang Curry is very well-balanced with fresh vegetables and filled with so much flavor that will rock. your. world.   I haven't tried their brunch so I'll be visiting again soon for that!!

4nWizir9sA0Vyl5A2cfjqA.text: Ture food is just so so good. There is nothing quite as great as food that tastes delicious and you feel good after eating. I need to stay away from food that inflame and True food is just the place for that. I love the crudite which is basically just blanched veggies with yummy dipping sauces. It was a little disappointing that the sauces that now come with it are oh so small where as they used to be much bigger. We also had the quinoia bowl with steak and it had some sort of delicious glazed sweet potatoes, and yes I will now crave that and need to drive to phoenix. Overall True food is  very yummy but in all reality is a bit overpriced for what it is but thats expected with sam fox restaurants right? You're mostly paying for the uber hipster staff and trendy environment?!

-aTKIfQ0aZZ88eLIFm6zeQ.text: I've really become fond of the quirkiness of the Fox Concepts restaurants. True Foods is probably my favorite with Blanco a close second. I love the vegetarian options here and it doesn't make me feel like I'm cheating on my healthy eating habits. It isn't a perfect whole foods menu (they have things like pasta and bread and pizza) but lots of the menu items are vegetable centered and many things can be made GF.   Service was phenomenal. The waiter was attentive, food was out quickly, and a manager stopped by to ask how our meal was. You always get an A in service from me if a manager is going around checking on customers!  I got the quinoa burger (still on my quest for the best veggie burger in PHX) and the flavor combinations were amazing. The burger was definitely a messy, eat-with-a-fork-not-your-hands sort of thing, but it was so good I didn't care. It came with a side of sweet potato hash, which was sort of cold, and a kale salad, which was also sort of cold, but tasted much better.   The place got busier as we ate, so the earlier you go the better if you don't want a wait. I think next time I'll try eating at the bar and get something off the drink menu, lots of interesting alcoholic options!

88U3N40ZkJdXj-kT7Z1OXQ.text: This is by far my favorite lunch spot. It is a great way to go out for lunch and still stay healthy. The vegetables and fruits are all extremely fresh. I usually start out with the Vegetable Crudites with tzaziki sauce. For the main course I get the Bison Burger protein style with no cheese and a side of fruit.   The staff are super friendly and attentive. I recommend this place to all my friends and make sure to take visitors from out of town.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh herbs!

MLd-8NnkoIsjxzvz27MBCw.text: The healthiest brunch restaurant I've been to! Atmosphere: pretty place with an open indoor space & outdoor seating. It was a bit pretentious & took too long to be seated, especially since it wasn't busy. Food: I had a coffee, banana bread, & breakfast sandwhich with sweet potatoes hash. Most made with organic ingredients. Flavorful. Fresh. Tasty. Pleased. Price: more than fair, especially for organic ingredients & large portions.  Service: good. Prompt. Most were young servers with decent enough attitudes :/

l7r_F6zl4A2Xl0hx5lpdwA.text: Just had to update my review after another great lunch. The service was amazing as always and the pizza was out of this world.   You should also try the spicy chicken soup if it's on the menu and order the kale dip for an appetizer.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pizza nom nom
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lCWbmU8L4NnWNTMocuOMyA.text: Central location. Loved sitting outside under the heat lamps. Attentive servers that clearly stand behind the vision of the seasonal food the serve. I got lasagna - so good and a treat to find it gf.

u2jhs-LqZgknjc8nePKaYg.text: Excellent place to go if you want an extremely healthy meal. I love the concept of eating according to the food pyramid. We were greeted right away and sat immediately.  My companion had dietary restrictions and our Waitress was so sweet about it and understanding. When the food was brought out her order was wrong. It was handled so professionally. They apologized and immediately corrected the mistake. She even got a little snack while she was waiting.  The steelhead trout was amazing. The bison burger was a tad dry but very tasty. We both enjoyed our Juby fresh juices. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roots radical

ny4IRUOdqfOr4pd7fso3BA.text: I love this place! The atmosphere and the food is delicious. They make sure to serve the best quality food that is raised in a humane and sustainable way. I really dig it.

hgOFQfYfar-6Mimkcj9sHg.text: This place was awesome. We got the raw veggie crudite and charred cauliflower to start. So delicious, I could have been satisfied with just this as a meal. Then we shared a ancient grain bowl with steak. It was really really good and just hit the spot. Chia seed coconut flan for dessert was pretty good and was a good finish to the meal. This is now one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix, we will definitely be back with friends.

7zYujYyke-R5noDeDpMiaw.text: Another typical Fox concept that is completely self serving the fox the empire.  Yes- the food and concept is good. However the service as in the hostess department is abysmal.  It's like they send all these early 20 year olds to a school where they learn that they're time is more important than yours.  Every single fox concept I've gone to is like this- it's pathetic

BC7VpyuT8JIguzlPZb4pEw.text: I love this restaurant and go here frequently, but I can't give it 5 stars only because too many times service has been painfully slow.  We are usually okay with the slow service because it gives me time to enjoy my two favorite things. But, sometimes it will test my patience.  On to my favorites: First, the appetizer, which in my case is always the Crudites.  It is basically a massive bowl of raw vegetables served over ice.  It does not sound exciting but it is the most gorgeous bowl of raw vegetables that you will ever see!  The veggies are seasonal, so they vary, and often they will include something unrecognizable, yet vibrantly purple, and it's just not often enough in life that I get to think, "Hmm, what is this purple thing I am putting in my mouth?"  My second favorite thing is some fabulous drink called the Skinny Cucumber Citrus Margarita. Since it is "skinny" and since there is plenty of time before the food arrives, you can drink two of these drinks. Or three, if you are a little crazy and not driving.  It is muddled cucumber, oranges and mint (heck, this makes it almost healthy!) and topped with a little carbonation.  It is just so good, I wish I was drinking one right now. My husband always gets a beer, feels a little disappointed when it comes out of a can, but then likes it and orders a second, too.  The food is good  and the menu is seasonal.  The kids' pizza is HUGE but all the adult servings are normal.  The kale salad that comes with the burgers is best if it is taken in the same bite as the sweet potato hash (that also comes on the side). The sweetness helps cut the bitterness.  The waiters are cute and I recommend sitting outside!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the best drink (cucumber citrus margarita) and IPA in the background

F-cTxJExb2in21f3f-OZ3Q.text: I feel similarly about True Food as I do about Seasons 52.  When I was a healthy eater, I cared a lot more about going there than I do now. Their food is healthy but if you're not a vegetarian or counting your calories, it can be a challenge to find something that you actually WANT I do go here with friends but I can't say that I leave here feeling satisfied or  like I had a meal I can't forget.

IsYTzplnwl3XWbIp2wxQTg.text: Visited in 2013....this review got lost until now! Yikes & Yelp! I ordered the mushroom pizza on a GF crust. After the bounty of crudites we shared at the table.....3 out of 8 slices was plenty for a light meal! Lunch leftovers = score!  Waiter was very knowledgeable and excited about the menu, which was a nice change from the norm. Great, earthy iced tea but over-priced for something that costs about 26 cents to produce  :P

ZlD52UQjhy38EG5KjsLY7A.text: As a vegan, I was extremely pleased with this restaurant. I ordered the lettuce cups which were spicy and flavorful as an appetizer and then a pizza with vegan ricotta, truffle, and tomatoes as a main. The vegan ricotta with bits of truffle was incredible. I absolutely loved it and I would highly recommend.

hlSp4Nwvx3Bo0XZsvswVfQ.text: I was forever waiting at the Apple Store, so I decided to eat here.  Amazing food, great experience!!  Everyone of the employees had a smile on their face.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just right!

UZVKIRlJiaInQTVc4e-c-Q.text: I come into True foods at least twice a week. I keep coming back for the energy of the restaurant and the friendly nature of the employees. It feels good to be acknowledged by first name whenever I walk in. No matter how busy or who's working I know the service will always be outstanding and I can count on the food being of the highest quality. If you happen to be working while Ari one of the managers is there or can grab a seat the bar with Nate or Chris be prepared for an exceptional experience.

gibZ93rw9avYQ3UeRfTR4A.text: Healthy options for both vegetarians and meat eaters. I love their non alcoholic drinks.

s7JEfReCf7Kdyep71sfwEQ.text: We were a group of four. The food was very good we weren't terribly hungry but it hit the spot. One person's food was not hot and it should've been. Edamame dumplings were delicious a grilled chicken salad was also delicious. The staff was excellent and the atmosphere very comfortable we recommend it.

tZ-O1KahcM66V8ylnSJtHw.text: True Food is my go to place - brunch is excellent and so is dinner. True foods is a healthy fast place in the middle of the mall.   For brunch - the quinoa cakes are AMAZING!!! And the avocado egg sandwich pairs really well with that :).   For dinner - I love the chicken teriyaki!   Always get a drink, sometimes seem pricey but they're great and super light!

Qvc1SYuRm6j2uwePxzEPRA.text: I have eaten here 3 times, and I feel that I can paint you a (not so) pretty picture of the place.  Let me start by applauding their separation from Sam Fox, the Chef Boyardee of overpriced cardboard.  Maybe they will find genuine inspiration and give the audience something more original and exciting.  I've had the grass fed burger, which is pretty good - served with parmesan, mushroom and caramelized onions.  But so is anything with parmesan, mushroom and caramelized onions.  I may be willing to eat tree bark covered in that.  So it's not exciting.  Neither is the Inside Out Burger, which is in no relation to the movie Inside Out nor a distant cousin of In N Out Burger.  No - this is high-falutin, grade A health movement swill.  Come to think of it, I was a little depressed after eating it, so maybe there is a hint of Pixar in it.  The Poke bowls, again, are Yardhouse quality re-branded as the latest Keto/Paleo/Rowan Atkinson/Richard Simmons catering health food.  They are good, but even better because the health nuts have a Mecca to pray at while they eat the Yardhouse food.  True Food Kitchen is the leader of the Dadaist movement on health food.  They have taken the artistic works of so many great restaurants and put a mustache across them, hoping you will eat mustache "because, you know, it's healthy for you."  But don't look for originality.

kypStOl8Lu1Ex3oHzyCp5w.text: Good food! Very fresh. A little overpriced. Teriyaki bowl was really good. Average Service.

XM7rwieufskttjaxswJiUQ.text: Solid place to eat at, especially if you're looking for a vegetarian or vegan dish. The service is also good, my server gave recommendations after asking but was still very helpful. The only negative thing I can say is that it's more on the pricey side. You won't find something that you will really want to eat under $14 including salads. If you want to add any meat/tofu/fish it costs extra. Nothing comes with the standard salads so you would have to add something if you want but the quality of the food is great so you get what you pay for.

mrHzLo_fOysSKG9k_Tyyfw.text: I love love love True foods! However I'm giving them 4 stars only because every time I've had a to go order something is always missing from the order. This time chicken from salad.. which I normally wouldn't make a big deal about but it is 4$ extra! In the past I've had this happen before as well as not getting dressing for the salad. They always have great service and friendly front of house! But need some work on those to go orders...

y_Tf-2JsAhzUZC1J0Y4nRg.text: We love True Food we used to go a lot and just went back this year for my birthday for the first time in quite awhile and the food options were right up my alley I eat very specific as well as one of the people that we went with she is a vegetarian so it worked out perfect for us !  I had forgotten how flavorful the food was and I was impressed that I was able to have dessert the way I would have it at home simple just cut up fruit !!!!  We will definitely be going back again very soon !!! And my stomach thanked me

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3rgixrC0a3Ar3WqTB8gPEg.text: Hands down one of the best meals so far while traveling in Phoenix! It's definitely a healthy option for those looking for that type of food. And I must say everything we tasted was super delicious!   The atmosphere was a nice site to see; open concept with lots of seating inside and out. I was told there a smaller room near the pack for small parties. But I just loved how open the space was with high ceilings. And the place always is busy! Luckily our dinner around 8 PM was too busy and got a seat right away. You can see into the kitchen and work area of the workers, which made it seem like a place you can learn cooking or you're on a cooking show!  For starters, a friend recommended the shiitake lettuce cups, and it was amazing! There was some spice to it, but we devoured the bowls. The mix was Shiitake mushrooms, jicama, sambal, cashews, and Thai basil -- served with an unlimited bowl of lettuce cups/leaves.  I ordered the lasagna bolognese -- fennel chicken sausage, mushrooms, spinach, lemon ricotta, herbs, and accompanied by marinara sauce. My food was gone in a flash -- another amazing dish. My friend ordered the Inside Out Quinoa burger which, instead of buns, used two dense quinoa patties.   It's a must try and see restaurant! Definitely worth the price and atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shiitake Lettuce Cups
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pomegranate Chia Limeade and Pomegranate Mojito
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QAeG5sS_lLna6bSt1SLjkQ.text: It's difficult to rate this place because I truly do factor in value when I rate a location and I have a hard time justifying the prices here. I know it's in a prime spot on Camelback but I just don't like spending $5 on hot tea or $10 on a small portion of guacamole.   I know, I know... The ingredients are seasonal! And if that's what you value in a restaurant then this place gets 5 stars all day. Tasty food - delicious, really. Friendly staff, cool ambiance - you're fine in a t-shirt or sports jacket. I get the vegan pizza every time, and as far as vegan pizzas go, this is one of the best. Great, memorable flavors ensure this is always part of my order. Everything else is good but can be a little underwhelming.   If you're vegan you need to order the vegan key lime pie. It's stupid good

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing keylime pie
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegan pizza
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seasonal citrus guac

5K0W0gK8trTLccjQd7iZvw.text: Pleasantly surprised by this well-priced, quality restaurant that focuses on clean and healthy food choices. Roomy eating area. Plenty if parking. August (server) was terrific, knowledgeable, professional, knew the menu, and did a great job. Enjoyed my edamame appetizer, and loved my teriyaki quinoa bowl selection, which was prepared Prefecture and was a generous sized meal. Menu offers pizzas, bowls, sandwiches, and entrees, and so many things sounded good. Moderately priced. Will definitely return.

7TGttmJtkKtBAqGq-Yo-9Q.text: This place ranges from a one star to a 5 star rating depending on the day. The manager Adam does a great job with what I can tell he has to work with. The food can be really great and the restaurant has so much potential, but I feel the frequent turnover with the kitchen staff and the changes coming from the corporate office really hinder the logistics of the restaurant. Most of the servers are very friendly and place food orders right, unfortunately the execution on the kitchen side often falls short.

5RcXxMk42VyLtzyHCm6VbQ.text: Good food but the hostess was clueless and lacked common customer interaction skills.

H9W2l9JIA--ygyEFm5aZhg.text: I come here about every other month, and it's always simply perfect.  Presentation, food quality, and the cooking itself are all simply perfect.  I've never had a meal that's less than awesome.  They have some really creative combinations that give you unexpected tastes along with a very well balanced meal.  Service is always good, and the patio is great for most of the years since it's well shaded.  It's far from cheap, but worth it.

z9cUhuuuX-eLSzE1ONHj8w.text: Second time eating at True Food while visiting Scottsdale. They do a nice job. Ancient grain bowl and turkey burger were both good. Would definitely return.

XMmhKsGDEuQZ7H6xOGdrBg.text: I love how accommodating their menu is for dietary restrictions. We are vegan, and members of our family are nut and gluten free. True Food usually has something everyone can enjoy!  I was so happy to see they put the vegan butternut squash pizza back on the fall menu. It is quite possibly my favorite pizza in town (aside from Bianco's). The vegan ricotta is amazing and the squash crisps up like bacon. It is so good!  The problems we usually have here are seating and service. You have the choice of eating inside, where it is just too loud (especially for my 80 year old mother-in-law) or outside on the patio where it is too hot for 90% of the year. This visit, we tried the patio since it was under 100 degrees out. But, the sun was blazing on our table and the sunshade didn't help much. Our server was very slow in getting to us so I had to find the host to ask for water and to adjust the shade. When the water arrived, there was no ice and we had to ask for it twice before getting it. The server wasn't familiar enough with the menu to answer some of our questions with confidence so some folks at our table got frustrated. She did comp us two deserts though (I had a coupon for one). The food was great, but the overall experience left room for improvement. It's a shame they can't muffle the noise more inside!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Leftover slice of the vegan butternut squash pizza

hrPPZR2d7DkWWGJOMGx1mg.text: I just love to come here.  The place is so warm and welcoming.  Their signature drinks hot and cold are delicious.  The entrees are always fulfilling and delicious.

MQrp90rI_9FHB8gAtxmcmw.text: Struggled between giving 2 and 3 stars. My east coast friends suggested 2. Overpriced for a small piece of mediocre fish with a tablespoon of couscous underneath. And this coming from someone who thinks school cafeteria fish is tasty. The service was good, especially drink refills, but it's just not worth the money. Seems like quality has declined.

g2hfhuT4BgOzOTFmSImdsQ.text: Absolutely delicious. Came here for a late lunch/early dinner. Started out with a kale juice which was super tasty!!!! Then, we did the beet bruschetta as an appetizer. It was so flavorful!!!! The perfect mix of sweetness and crunch with the bruschetta and arugula.  Next, I had the grilled chicken salad. Finally a salad with a hearty portion of chicken!!!! Amazing blend of apples, manchego, and crunch!   My partner had the grass fed burger with the sweet potato hash. The sweet potato was just the right amount of savory and I tried a bite of the burger- my oh my!!!! Highly recommend!  I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TLT with turkey

Eue5h52bf-jGahhRN1eH7w.text: True Foods is probably one of my favorite spots in terms of variety and overall food quality. The drinks are a bit expensive but quite unique to them. I've had a number of the dishes from their bowls, panang curry, salads and even their pizzas. I don't think I've ever been disappointed. Everything is usually very consistent and the service is good too. The foods are supposedly healthy and really align with what I stand for. I guess by expectations have been changed and I now hold restaurants to a higher standard. The most recent time I went some of my veggies were a little too charred and it left a bitter taste in my mouth. On some occasions I have felt the food just wasn't to my taste. I guess I've become much pickier because I probably would have given it 5 stars if it were last year, however I would prefer continuous consistency to give that rating now. The experience here is overall quite nice, though I would suggest sitting outside since the inside is quite loud. I think it's a safe bet to eat here and I enjoy it as long as it's not too busy.

-dOgAked3yGPXRWmBpbwSw.text: So been here 5 years ago, and maybe it was just us, but back then we loved the food and the quality. This time around not so much..., it definitely lives up to its ethos. Fresh food, service is spot on, but for the price..., I think you should rethink your choice. If all you ate was a salad and water, definitely 5 stars, but if you are bringing a family of 4 and get a glass of wine, you better be prepared for the shock on the sticker price! Margarita pizza is nice, but nothing to write home about. Size matters, and again wish they offered more for the money! The sweet point of value for money has passed, and perhaps they need to get back to analyzing their cost/customer satisfaction model.

cJ8c6wO-cEXbmA0Scbd0EQ.text: I travel to AZ from the East Coast twice a year. After the long flight, we stop for bite to eat. We selected True Food Kitchen for both visits in 2017.  A True Food Kitchen opened in King of Prussia, PA (KOP) just this past month.  I visited it recently as well.    It was lunch time and they were very busy. We were warmly greeted and seated quickly.  The server was welcoming. The service was good. The food is always wonderful.  Although there are many wonderful selections on the menu, Mom always gets the spaghetti squash casserole.  She loves it! I ordered the Inside Out Quinoa Burger. It's wonderful with a side of their amazing kale salad. Seriously, it's very very good. Dad ordered the burger and enjoyed every bite.    What I thought was remarkable, was the difference between my Quinoa Burger in King of Prussia, Pa and that of the one in Phoenix, AZ.  The Phoenix Burger was 2-3 times the size of the KOP burger. Kudos to Phoenix.  Clearly, KOP's location has to match up to the True Kitchen standards of Phoenix.    We've appreciated Dr. Andrew Weil for years. We're thrilled to know we can go out for a bite and know we're truly getting food that is good for us! Beverages too!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside Out Quinoa Burger.

CrNReWV-lD7KRme_7Za53g.text: The food was awesome.  Chopped chicken salad with jicama was out of this world. The trout was top notch. The atmosphere was WAY TOO LOUD. Not relaxing at all. Hard to take. But the food and juice were fabo.

PHCh8vK-wSemK3yrBJjR3g.text: I like the food but I don't like the seating. Not comfortable. I had the big veggie bowl with 2 types of hummus as an appetizer and spaghetti squash lasagna. Both delicious! The appetizer was visually very impressive!

36pkyQYCg0qtTOJjDsiwXQ.text: The two words I would use to describe the food at True Food Kitchen would be FRESH and FLAVORFUL! I probably will never be able to enjoy a vegetable from Safeway again after the amazing produce from True Food!   I don't even especially like veggies and the crudite plate was amazing.  I could go on and on about every dish, dessert, and drink that we ordered.  The staff was incredibly accommodating and knowledgeable.    The ambiance, service, and food make it a great place for a fun lunch with girl friends or a lunch meeting.

Os-wb-hzCXvCmrsKY60Wfw.text: True Food has an interesting concept of including a "superfood" with every dish. I ordered a Penang curry, and I guess the superfood in it was coconut milk? I'm not sure. It comes with three protein choices: chicken, shrimp and tofu. I chose tofu, and was expectantly awaiting my side of brown rice only to see it nowhere in sight when the food arrived. Alas, the brown rice was drowning at the bottom of the bowl, soggy and soaked in curry sauce. That was really disappointing for me, because the idea of rice is so that you can modulate how salty you want each mouthful to be, but because every grain of rice was drenched in milky, creamy curry, that proved to be impossible. The taste is decent, although not quite spicy enough for my tastes, but if you ever order this, be sure to request for your rice on the side. I also ordered some shrimp dumplings, which was probably overcooked as the dumpling skin was gelatinous and gluey.  Service was bright and chirpy, but I guess coming from NYC, everyone else will seem angelic in comparison.

5SwR37hXZQz_iPtZSjiMfA.text: I love everything about this place!  The staff is AMAZING!  Everyone is super knowledgable and helpful.  The food is soooo soooo good!  For being healthy, offering multiple vegan/vegetarian options, and being reasonably priced, I'd say that is one of two restaurants that are my favorite in town.

ZsxCeWKB7BV2BXiZm7e6HA.text: (Here's my disclaimer:  I usually think Fox restaurants are pretty meh...not bad and just good enough.  However, True Food is the exception.)  Ugh, last Sunday was a REAL whammy at work, so I told the woman we were going out for food and drinks and on me.  Thankfully, she picked a place that would have more than one item for me to eat.    Each time we visit True Food we're greeted promptly and by friendly staff. We've never experienced a wait longer than five or ten minutes and the atmosphere is nice and bright, especially considering what I used to be (anyone? Coffee Plantation?? Ugh..that bathroom always reeeeeked! I digress)   Anyway, on this particular stop I ordered the Spontaneous Happiness (a cocktail with St. Germain, lime, and ginger/vanilla infused sochu) and m'lady opted for the Apple Carrot and Ginger tonic  to start.  My bev was silky smooth and went down way too fast.  So, then we ordered a bottle of Moscato. What? I was in the mood for sweet drinks...I'm allowed to be frou frou once in a while.    For our appetizers, we ordered the Shiitake and Tofu Lettuce Cups (tofu, cashews, garlic and a gingery sauce) and the Local Vegetable Crudites (fresh veggies from McClendon's farm that came with tzatziki and olive tapenade...neither of which worked for us, so the server brought it with hummus and a champagne vinaigrette instead!! YUM!).  Then we moved on to the Tuscan Kale salad (kale, lemon vinaigrette, Parmesan, and breadcrumbs) sans cheese.  For entrees (I know, it was a feast) she ordered the Shirataki Noodles, and I ordered another Tuscan Kale....it's that good, peeps.    When dessert time came around, we decided on their chocolate pudding (vegan) that came topped with walnuts and pistachios.    Our server (I can't remember her name and I feel like a jerk about it) was rad, the food was perfect and the drinks were divine!

G7wY7IIkEwVsVVhg4lY3IA.text: Let's just start off by saying I've never been into trends, especially the most recent "organic" foods one (well, I guess recent since the 90s?). While I did feel like I was in an episode of Portlandia when I read the menu, I was delighted with the taste of all the food. The waitress asked if we had every been there before, and told us about how, well, how healthy everything is.   My coworker has been there multiple time, and suggest we start with the edamame dumplings. Very good! Were there worth $2 per dumpling...? I don't know. I guess your wallet decides that.   I had to ask what multiple ingredients were (vegenaise = vegan mayo; hehe!) but finally choose the TLT. Tempeh, by the way, is a compressed soy bean (I think?), smoked, that "tastes like bacon." It was actually really good! I thought the TLT had turkey in it but about 1/2 way through I realized it was just the tempeh. Avocado was great too.  My TLT came with a couple of side options, and none sounded too appetizing (see: previous reviews. I like beer and fries, like every overweight American), but I've been on a health kick, so I went with the kale salad. It was actually very good- due to the grated parmesean and bread crumbs. Very "kale-y" still, but I guess kale is kale and there's only so much you can do to mask the healthy taste. The lemon dressing was good, but a bit too much actually and completely soaked my bread on my sammich that was sharing it's plate.   Everything else was generally good (service, decor) but I was surprised for such a busy place, they'd only have one sink in the bathroom. I had to wait for some chick to stop staring at herself (see: Scottsdale location) to wash my hands.   I think I'd go there again just for the TLT ($10)- everything else was out of my budget for a lunch. My coworker got the ravioli; 5 pieces for $15. I have to wait until I marry rich to enjoy those spoils.

Fc4tkAHOarVhnl685vsWPA.text: This place is great, good food and great selection that always changes. If eat here all the time if I was closer. An experience is love to have more often.

fNwUyfRO0Ay_XmxujR1rOQ.text: I had the beef tacos that were 3 inches in diameter which made eating in hand impossible.  The $14 veggie bowl had no more than $2 worth of edibles.   A glass of wine was underpoured.   Service was good but there's not much on the menu for me to return.  Overpriced and interior noise was annoying.

CsH925sKDXP0ZDGp06isLA.text: I love love love eating here!! I usually get the red chili shrimp; it's so tasty! I've gone home and recreated their Tuscan kale salad (I make this regularly now) and their sweet potato hash because it's so good! I've also had their seared tuna wrap and the spaghetti squash casserole and both were delicious!!

OhN961qAc1nXJvpyZ6vUSA.text: True Foods is Truely yummy!   I FINALLY went here last night after hearing from tons of friends how great this place was. Love the way it is designed! I seriously want one of those huge wood tables in my house, and reallllly had to stop my self from rolling off with one of those cute planters!   We started off with some hummus. It was mighty tasty, but just like other restaurants that serve hummus ::cough cough pitajungle:: they never give you enough pits for all the hummus. I loved the addition of onions and olive and cucumber to the mix.   I also had the "soda" of the day. A strawberry rhubarb concoction. It was very refreshing.   For dinner I had the farmers market salad. Sooooo good! So Fresh! loved the peas and asparagus pieces in it.   For dessert we split the strawberry rhubarb crisp! I didnt even feel bad about getting dessert, it was so light and fresh!   I will for sure be going back here, just wish it was a few bucks less a plate! Also the staff is all really weird and overly overly nice.

URtV1yC7-qEA1oV4n0qMww.text: I came in here for a quick bite the other day. The food is good, but the prices are just too ridiculous. A cup of vegan lentil soup is $7. That's just crazy. The entire bowl probably cost a little bit of change to make, and the bowl size was small and not even filled completely. As much as I like the food, and even though I have the money, I just can't justify spending $7 on a small portion of lentil soup. It didn't even come with a piece of bread or some other like carb. I finished it in less than 5 minutes.  Whatevs.  I could understand if it was mind blowing food, but I can cook food that is comparable.

KGQ4QPxtQ0J_dtuLonknhg.text: If there is one thing I adore, it is restaurants that provide fresh food. Not only is the food delicious but the fresh drinks are incredible. There is a happy and friendly atmosphere that really adds to the effect and really makes you feel welcome and feel good about eating there. If, of course, you find inside to be too noisy, there's always the option to go to sit out on the patio.   However, I do feel like the prices were a little steep, but then again there is always a higher price on fresh food simply down to the fact that it's cheaper to process food. Other than that, a truly fantastic place to eat with appealing food.

Pq4S92FT3PYpK5n-wk1mfA.text: Fresh healthy fun food.  The Kale-aid is rich and refreshing.  I recently had the lasagna. Tasty and the perfect portion but I'd definitely pair it with a side salad next time.   I've ate here about 5 times now and I've never been disappointed.  The healthy drink concoctions alone make this place worthy of visiting.

XXi34EbzZUnTAT-vAX5IPw.text: Traveling for work can be tough on the diet, but I know whenever I visit Gabi M in Phoenix there are healthy meals in store for me  And sure enough my first stop in Phoenix was oh so healthy True Foods.  We sat on their lovely heated patio (gotta love that in mid March) and enjoyed the veggie crudite appetizer.  They freeze the veggies to make them extra tasty...mmm.  There's all sorts of unique juice options on the menu and I opted for the Ginger Nojito, highly recommended by our waitress.  Liked it, a lot!  As for my main entree it was a tough decision between the miso cod and the spaghetti squash casserole, but the squash was calling my way.  It was mixed with organic tomatoes, zucchini,  and lots of fresh mozzarella cheese. It was (almost) as tasty as a plate of spaghetti and definitely a lot healthier!  Rumor has it they may be opening other locations and I'm crossing my fingers one of those is in Chicago!

j6zcr1eS8tb2R7GnwK8B_w.text: After seeing a bunch of two star reviews from my friends, I was hesitant about going, but I'm glad I finally did.    From start to finish, the service was friendly.  The hostesses were chatty (but not too much) and super nice, and my waiter was polite, checked in on my, had good recommendations, etc.  The food and drink? Ridiculously pricey. Yes. Tasty though? Also yes.  I had the garlic/mushroom/kale pizza, a combo I wouldn't have thought of putting on a pizza, yet it was delicious.  The Nojito to drink? It was ok, but not really worth $4, especially with no refills.  I loved that they had the menu marked vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free. That is always much appreciated.    The atmosphere was nice, although my chair wasn't super comfy. Bathrooms were nicely designed, but not cleaned while I was in them.  I did love that you could see all the food being prepared in an open environment.  I won't be back until we're ready for a fancy date night, but I'll definitely be bringing my partner here to try some of the delicious options!

RpzaDAp8RKdDFYREX2kIkw.text: Wanted to try it all but settled on the crudite platter, turkey lasagne and street tacos.   Everything was beyond fresh.   I have never been so blown away by a plate of vegetables.   It was beautifully done and ridiculously sweet and fresh.   The lasagne was rich but not heavy tasting.   The tacos had a good flavor and the beans on the side were tasty.   Hoping this chain comes my way to Chicago.

8n90TF_yEjocV3MtffhZ7Q.text: Unique and familiar healthy options. I suggest the cucumber honey lemonade refresher, margarita pizza and strawberry rhubarb crisp. Friendly knowledgable staff in an open outdoor space.

XT6FvtcQRKW8rLvrsig6BQ.text: This was a case of the emperors new clothes to me.  Maybe I just don't get it and that's ok-maybe you will.  Very well run restaurant, service was excellent, place was packed for lunch on the Friday I went. Quality of the food was good.  I had the bison burger.  Being from Montana I've add bison before and this was just ok. It was a  little bland.  Came with like a sweet potato hash that was ok, definitely not memorable.  Had a cucumber cooler to drink. It was refreshing but for $5 and no refill, I would have rather had an alcoholic beverage but I don't think they serve alcohol.  Lunch was $23 plus a $5 tip.  Nearly a $30 lunch with little to show for it.  I should have followed other reviews advice and gone to Delux for a burger.

oyytuB6Q7aHJ9vVq6UPhwg.text: Three words: Chicken Chopped Salad.  I could eat this salad everyday for the rest of my life. Absolutely delicious. The turkey burger is also just as great.  I can't wait to come back & try more dishes as well as the juices!

t3ykMbT-jqxN-JDlgrycCA.text: The food just was not that great for the price point. Additionally, the noodle dish I ordered was DRENCHED in oil. It gave me a stomach ache shortly after.

t4G9jaClZsjudYmt6byKAw.text: Shout out to the late night crew at TFK in the Biltmore! I came in for a last minute birthday on the 17th of January and was pleasantly greeted by management. She was a delightful and gave excellent recommendations on what to try and really enhanced our experience. The service was incredible and the food was on point! Thank you for making it a special night, you know I will be back again soon.

RkNTY2vgvLov0jQpLuIk4w.text: I go all the time. Sit at the oversized bar top because you get personalized service from the bartenders and you have plenty of room to setup and do work or read or just enjoy the food and lunches. Everything is catered to a meal style that is anti inflammatory. You'd think that means you would lose on flavor but it's not True. I haven't had a dish that I dislike. I went with the seasonal salad and a bison burger cooked to order.  They have a vast array of drinks and wines that are healthy and flavorful. Erich the manager always stops by and says hi and makes me feel at home. Good place, tell your friends.  Also park In the lot out front, they validate.

fjak7rl4YW_XxrWtZnojIA.text: Herb hummus x 1000000 Spicy apple cider  The butternut squash is in season. Get it now.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Herb hummus
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butternut squash pizzaaaa

BagHkSQTRe_qQCMq6WSZ7w.text: Quality ingredients? Inventive menu items? Yes please!  After a long day of travel I wasn't in the mood for a heavy dinner, and True Food really delivered on all fronts. Being a Monday night, there was plenty of seating available, and our group of five scored a really cool table in the middle of the dining area. Service was on point and we all had drinks right away! I wanted to try a cocktail, but after a long weekend of fun I had to settle for iced green tea. I don't know if I was just really thirsty or what, but it was some of the best green tea I've ever had.  We started with the hummus and the vegetable crudites, both of which were amazing. The veggies were so fresh and piled on ice, and came with two different sauces. I wish I had one of those in my fridge at all times. It was so nice to be eating things out that were so ridiculously healthy and good!  For my entree, I ordered the panang curry with brown rice, potatoes, broccoli, ginger, carrots, mushrooms, and coconut shellfish broth. It was seriously great and had the perfect amount of spice, and I wish I wasn't already almost full when I started eating it! The flavors were fantastic and I could see it being the perfect dish for a cold day (although we are in Phoenix...) Maybe I need to figure out how to make it at home in St. Louis.  Really lovely space for healthy food and and a fun atmosphere. Thanks for a great night True Food!

yMV63F20jPqYuIL0W2tTNA.text: A trip to Scottsdale is not complete without dining at True Food. Here are my top items: - Onion tart - Butternut squash pizza - Vegetable crudites - Medicine man-- at least 2 glasses! - Teriyaki bowl - spicy shrimp - Bison burger Can't wait for them to open in Palo alto soon!

8Z8LHFiLf3gqq80xhuT1rA.text: I've been to the True Foods at Biltmore twice before, but both times it was a discount promotion.  This time my friends and I decided to come here to the Scottsdale location on a normal night.  While I like the layout of the restaurant and the concept, the prices were a little exorbitant for what you get.  The wait was crazy long, but I sort of expected that on a Friday night.  For a drink I got the Dos Cabezas Red Blend.  Good really good.  For the main course I got the roasted chicken, which was good, but basically just four small pieces with herbs.  For dessert, my girlfriend and I split the flourless chocolate cake with ice cream.  It was good, but super tiny.  In hindsight we should gotten one for each of us, but we didn't feel like waiting longer.  All totaled, I dropped about $35 at this place including tip just by myself.  I get that its healthy, its Andrew Wiel certified, and Sam Fox's restaurants charge you as much for the ambience as much as the food.  But I still left here pretty hungry.  My advice?  Go on a promo night like Valentine's Day or AZ Restaurant Week.  Prices are much more reasonable and you'll enjoy the experience far more knowing you didn't have to clean out a big chunk of your wallet to do so.

tXder-2kA8Uxj-NWGw1xyQ.text: The Quinoa burger was exceptional.  Although it looks small, it's quite dense and filling.  I only ate have and saved the other half for later, which tasted even better.  You can op for either kale salad or sweet potato has or both and I would definitely chose both.  Fast and friendly service.  They will cut you off after 4 beers in one hour....not speaking from personal experience thought.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa burger, Kale Salad and Sweet Potato Hash #Truefoodkitchen #foodie #foodporn #feastwithme

m1gDkKwSBblLyCIbV3608g.text: Chicken Curry was great. Service was great. Highly recommend the Kale salad that they serve.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Curry

U1yQk7-OFvl7TL_t52uDdA.text: Have only ever eaten at True Food kitchen for dinner but found out today they do a brunch. Enjoyed the breakfast burrito with fresh salsa and sweet potato hash. Love the concept of this restaurant with delicious healthy options!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

31CgFiuIwbpJjXxwtAD_HA.text: Interesting menu. Didn't realize they focus on an anti inflammatory diet. Definitely can taste the fresh and healthy foods. Great for brunch and has a fun California esque vibe! Coming back.

8nUxylGLdHs1R0EQ993gbA.text: Conveniently located in the Biltmore.  The restaurant  was nice and clean  . Staff was friendly.  We tried their soup . It was very grainy . It had their  spicy noodles  with. Chicken.  It was a little  on the oily side but I did like the combination  of cashews  and vegetables.  They did leave off the periods. Portions  were a little  on the small size

AeDWDmWuX9fX-xeTObaa1g.text: First time going in and the food was amazing! The hostesses were so sweet. Our server, Dylan, was so sweet and knowledgeable of the menu. Rory, who ran food to us, made it a point to ensure that all our food was to our liking. There was so many yummy vegetarian and vegan options. I could live off of the edamame dumplings! Can't wait to go back!

VyUiNSRsLkHRGekTf5PlwQ.text: Always love a fresh meal, and need to go here more often! So many great menu items and a helpful staff in case anything should arise. Can't say I've ever had a bad experience, and will remain a loyal patron! The juices are a great option for an on the go pick me up later in the day, and Squash Pie... MUST TRY!!

TnqJwF9OtmMROpn-wnmZTQ.text: Love this place. They food is consistently great and you feel pretty darn good about yourself for eating a healthy meal. I personally love the chopped Chicken Salad. Bummer that they took the Bison Burger off the menu but their grass -fed burger is a good substitute. Also, try the pita and hummus. The pitas they make are some of the best I've ever had.

Tk5kf3iIBuMpG5DMp6X63Q.text: I loved the food and the atmosphere!!  I ordered a Teriyaki Quinoa bowl with tofu.  It was so delicious!  The food had the right amount of teriyaki (meaning it wasn't drowning in sauce), with tons of veggies (broccoli, carrot, bokchoy, mushroom, avocado, sesame seeds).  Two others in my party ordered the Ancient Grains bowl, which they also loved.  the fourth person ordered Panang Curry, which she loved because it was definitely spicy.  We sat out on the covered patio, which extremely nice.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  Definitely recommend this restaurant!

JSlJvzNaHJFQqsN9jqNlmQ.text: Friendly and helpful server.  Really tasty food. Tonight we shared ( they split it all willingly and no up charge). Miso soup, bison burger And vegetable salad. Perfect texture, flavor a and attentive service

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miso soup
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miso soup Bison burger Autumn vegetable salad

YOPalx8vr_mCzhYTOW-guw.text: Didn't know about Dr. Weil before coming here and can't validate the anti-inflammatory claims based on what I was served all I know is that it was hella delicious. It tasted healthy and fresh. Our visit was during restaurant week. I had the shiitake tofu cup for starters and that was the best and my friend had the grilled avocado which was also yummy. I think the best part of the meal was the whipped coconut cream that come with the chia seed dessert..... WOW, completely mind blown. I asked if they sold it in cans or something! that was delicious. Service was excellent and I would definitely recommend to friends. I left with a happy full belly!

ptZfDxsmA70VfAwUEc0g2A.text: Refreshing to find a health-conscious restaurant with friendly, knowledgeable staff and beautiful ambiance. (Highly recommend Cheryl as a waitress!)

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IFrGRdxsYVh-xvxvtloCJg.text: Everyone I've been too is an A+. Food, service and atmosphere are all lovely. The honey lemonade is delicious for anytime of year, great juices and everything I've had off their menu has been wonderful. Can never go wrong with fresh, wholesome ingredients.

0QLx0VHu_OgIEw4_EBvmMA.text: I came here on a Friday night with my visiting aunt. I thought it was convenient that instead of giving you one of those buzzing things to let you know that your table is ready, they take down your phone number so you can get a text instead. That enabled us to walk around while waiting for about 30 minutes. Standard for a busy place on a Friday night  We sat close to the bar and kitchen so it was loud since you could hear plates clanging and staff yelling orders. It's probably even louder since there are high ceilings and no barrier to the kitchen. If you don't like noise, you probably wouldn't like it here, but if you love good food you'll love it.  To drink I ordered the "Cucumber refresher" that was made of cucumber and honey lemonade and my aunt ordered a beer. Just as a note, they only serve bottled or can beer, nothing from a tap. To eat, I ordered the "inside out" quinoa burger and my aunt ordered the "street" tacos and we shared the "caramelized onion tart" appetizer. I loved the kale salad side that came with my quinoa burger, and I was pleasantly surprised that the quinoa burger was basically vegetables, hummus, and tzatziki, sandwiched in between two quinoa burger patties. Nice if you are watching your carbs or don't eat bread.   My aunt seemed to love the Anasazi beans side so much that she made me try it. They were smoky and flavorful. In the street tacos were avocado, cotija cheese, tomatillo salsa, sour cream, and grass fed steak. There was an option for sea bass but she chose steak instead.  Overall, I enjoyed this place. It was a bit loud but the food made up for it and the waiter was very attentive and kind without being anything but genuine. Always appreciated.

_w2p58K1N1IQFVNRl0rJAA.text: It's True. The True Food Kitchen on Scottsdale is MUCH better than this one on Camelback. I had read that somewhere, should have paid attention. Good service Thursday night, as usual so far. But. The miso soup was barely warm and too salty to eat. I sent it back. The coffee was luke warm and bitter, the cream had clots from souring, and I was never offered a refill (just as well really).  Should have sent it back too. Bison burger was good, but the sweet potato hash cubes were all burned black on one side. *sigh. Truly disappointing after my awesome first meal at the other location. Won't be back to this one.

snO6SjKm-2LGRsHNI10tKQ.text: I'm embarrassed that I have only ate here two times and I live in very close proximity of this restaurant. Ate here tonight and it was perfection.  The server was so genuine & amazing! Lettuce wraps were delish along with the inside out quinoa burger. I was so impressed with start to finish. This is on my new rotating list of places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fVkhGL-BCyihpNSSZ8EuCQ.text: Prices up , quality down! They ruined the shaved turkey sandwich!!  I will not go back, period!!

epUD3fTxnR3xCRFxN5L5_Q.text: All the stars are for the excellent wait staff. As for food...it's lacking.  I know why kids in America don't eat their veggies. The preparation lacking... if this food was given to me growing up, I too would have looked at vegetarians as poor souls missing on basic pleasures of life. We ordered the lentil soup, TLT,Teriyaki bowl, inside out quinoa burger, edamame dumplings. Couple of the dishes came with side of kale and sweet potato fries. Except for sweet potato fries and dumplings, everything was bland and tasteless.

sDM7v0ofkrYm50_C9duTdw.text: This was our 2nd visit to this True Food location and again we were well taken care of by the staff and servers. We came twice with larger parties of peeps and the staff is more than capable to handle groups.  It does get a bit loud though which was the knock of 1 star.  I don't like having to feel like I'm yelling to my guests who are right across from me.   The food is excellent. Fresh, temperature appropriate, and delicious. Kids portions are very generous as are the adult portions. It would be easy to share a kid meal with your little one or have them share with you if your little person is a light eater.  We enjoyed the turkey lasagna, red chili shrimp, street tacos, turkey club wrap, salmon, and something else I forget...but it was also very delicious. My son enjoyed the flourless chocolate cake as well and it was delectable.   Can't wait to go back to True Food again soon!

EHNtBChVJ_gDaE_PHAWaDQ.text: Oh True Food...I have visited you many times since your opening and you never fail to deliver on great service and yumilicious food.  I really love your Summer Salad which I had on my most recent visit...the perfect combination of ingredients..it makes my heart sing. (I hope that I can get the summer salad in the winter?) I know you like to mix things up my darling True Food...  I also had the Watermelon Rose cocktail which may be my favorite cocktail of late...  You just make me so happy True Food!! Thank you for being you and sorry I didn't review you sooner....I would never take you for granted!
