1868PWjuQn4bZPva_X-XcQ.text: A very unique approach to New Food, the idea to "prep" the food in the front of the dining room is quite smart and helps add to the image of "True"food. This Fox guy is quite good, but the dollars are more than the bite.    I love the kale approach and fun new healthy ingredient are in the lime light. I would need a few visits to give a more complete review. From what I hear Pei Wei has put some Kung Pow in this group and we may see more in the coming!

G9dTAGm_9c7OAQ7sPOshNA.text: My fam & I are big fans... My mum is obsessed w/the Turkey Burger (opts for wrapped in lettuce & well done) w/the spicy Sambal... I like their Roasted Veggie Platter as well as the Tofu Breakfast Burrito.  I've tried the Edamame dumplings & the Crudites, both tasty.  Cute kids menu also.  We go 2-3 times a month, usually to the Biltimore location as is usually a wait at the Quarter one.

kyg-M5pbqZFboZvzxPZxuw.text: I consider myself a pretty healthy eater but I was nervous when I read this menu. Thought wow is there anything on here my kids will eat and I'm starving need more than veggies. I ordered the street fare tacos 1 fish, 2 steak. The fish was ok but wow I loved the steak ones. The neat was perfectly cooked a medium rare, tender with just the right amount of veggies. I did say no cheese and sauces. I don't like my food flavors taken over with sauces. The corn tortillas tasted like sprouted corn not processed. The kids ordered chicken noodle soup and cheese pizza. The pizza looked great and they are every bite. The soup I would say noodles they just clumped together but the broth and chicken was on point. My husband said the chopped chicken salad and miso soup was yummy. The water is really good. Nice and clean and cold. We also ordered a lemonade it seemed to be sweetened with honey husband loved it. Best of all we felt good after we ate to go explore the museum district.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street fare tacos . Beef tacos are the best!

TbxUCAftAFfq0NfKC-blBw.text: Healthy, creative, and delicious. This restaurant puts thought into their dishes. I've eaten at a few of the locations and am always pleased when I walk away.

Yk887Cvc2Ds-6pbVTQi1gA.text: Even during the lunch rush, the food came fast, the service was excellent! Our waitress Cheryl was fabulous and had a great attitude.

i8Zhvehpk9gbat_xqe_6_A.text: This is the place my co-workers and I go to for lunch every now and then. I am not really sure why lol... It's good but I am bored with the menu. It is just ok and it's always busy. Is it because we think it's healthy? Not sure... I like what I get which always the same... The turkey pita with sweet potatoes. It is decent and pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5SJVJIJa7qsB_ACurbjrlg.text: I have wanted to go here for a while and am so glad I finally made it here. The food was so fresh and delicious and I felt great just eating it. I had half a harvest salad and half a kale salad with chicken. Also a glass of delicious Parducci. My husband had the chicken sausage pizza and it was delicious. The crudites were popular according to what other people had on their tables, so can only imagine that was good. I am a fan!

zT-qNzQH10gCIn0sjH8E1w.text: Wow!!!! I wasn't sure who was running this place because everything is phenomenal. I asked to speak with the GM and this lovely sweet woman, Jessica, came over. Not only was she smiley and friendly, but had super positive energy. The food and staff was incredible, but Jessica was the icing on the cake! Thank you for making, what was an unbelievable experience, even more amazing! The food was out of this world fresh and delicious. Definitely start with the vegetable crudites!! The Thai grapefruit martini is so refreshing!! You won't regret it

2IVcf173Ouw_ocN4i_6PaQ.text: I absolutely loved the openness of the restaurant with it's brightness and open kitchen.  There were literally people preparing food several feet from us.  They definitely don't have anything to hide in their kitchen.  Upon quick glance of the menu I found a couple vegan options to choose from and had a tough time deciding between "Andy's Favorite 'TLT'" and the "Teriyaki Brown Rice Bowl" but when with Andy's Favorite "TLT" which Tempeh, Lettuce. Tomato. Avocado, Vegenaise, and Whole Grain Bread.  I had the choice to pair it with a kale salad or sweet potato hash and went with the hash.  While it was tasty and I'd say our experience at True Food Kitchen was unique I must say the prices are a bit steep for the amount of food you receive.  I understand it's healthier food and often that comes with a price tag, but $10 for a basic sandwich is a bit much in my opinion.

uEK1_fNiNnP6Ztg0zqk9kA.text: If the gym is a place you visit on a regular basis then you already know food is everything. I've recently discovered their salads, with a fresh piece of blackened fish and a hydrating drink with chia seeds and the amount of energy is unreal! I love the Biltmore location as a recent transplant and will continue to hit this place before a workout. Otherwise lots of great food selections and an upscale, healthy crowd which, if important to you, will keep you coming back for more.

nja9KLP9sWdn2J2uDPrEbQ.text: I had been to this location once before, liked the concept, and decided to bring a friend to try it out yesterday.  Let's start off with what I liked: The Honeydew seasonal soda was refreshing and not too sweet.   The Shiitake and Tofu Lettuce cups had good flavor and texture, despite being extremely messy.  Now for the rest of our experience: Firstly I should make it clear that I am not picky.  If I am hungry, I will eat anything. We ordered the Sea Bass Fish Tacos and the "TLT"(tempeh bacon BLT) sandwich to split.  The tacos were not good.  The fish was soggy and had almost no texture or flavor.  So much so that myself and my friend, though we arrived very hungry, didn't even attempt to finish them.  The sandwich was ok, and the sweet potato mash that came on the side was completely undercooked, still crunchy.  Overall, a "meh" meal. I'm not one to penny pinch when it comes to a meal.  But to pay $15 for an entree that I didn't even want to finish sucked.  Now on to the service.  I get it, TFK is a busy place.  Being in the service industry myself, I am generally very understanding and patient.  Our server never even refilled our waters, or asked if we might want another soda (I did).  She was also way too touchy-feely.  After we finally received our check, I requested that she take my part out of  two 20s, and put the other half on my friends card.  Ten minutes later, she arrived to tell me that she was very busy and it " wasn't worth it to her to give me change for the second twenty", and that I could just keep the tip.    Now I don't know if she made the assumption that my tip wouldn't be worth her time because of my age, apparel, what have you.  But it felt like a huge slap in the face, considering that I was going to tip her my normal 40% despite getting shoddy service and not enjoying my meal.  I've never been treated like that, and I would never treat someone that way.   It's been made very clear to me by that server that True Foods Kitchen doesn't need my business.  So guys, you got your wish.  I won't ever be back and I'll make sure to let my friends know why.

3d9hAPTPIV-6oGbF0LiC8w.text: Best salad I have ever had in my life!!!  It was the chicken cranberry one.  OMG!!!    Customer service could be better.....................

YPoLwo6RJuEOXAEfa-H0ug.text: We travel a lot and eating healthy and good used to be so hard to do in the US. We are so glad we found True Food all over the country. Great and healthy food.

1N_8fWZacAovKslQVdPSeg.text: Healthy options never tasted better!  The Korean Noodle Salad was fresh, and seasoned just right.  Fine details were tended to - the bean sprouts were "trimmed" - the top sprout and bottom stringy tail were cut off (fine details that Is traditional in Chinese cooking).  The Kale Aid was refreshing and nutritious.  The squash pie was phenomenal with the graham cracker crust and fresh whipped cream.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JeSKsASj7Iey1h7Aj1Tndg.text: I can eat their hummus all day! Although everything I've had here is satisfying. If I lived close to this place, I'd probably order take out everyday. The staff, especially, are great. They are friendly and make you feel welcome from the moment you walk through the doors.

fLEJ8I1xehJ0wDQTrfIlcQ.text: All around great experience. The food is fresh and full of flavor. All of the staff there have always been friendly and personable. This is a great place foa great meal.

kNE38u3dZ8igQATJOZ-3Ig.text: I have always loved coming to True Food since since u first discovered them. The food is always fresh, delicious and I can leave feeling good about myself because of the way they prepare everything. This last experience was one of the best I have had though. My server Mae took the time to help me and my indecisive and picky girlfriend navigate the menu to find something that she would absolutely love. While I understand that is the role of most servers, Mae went above and beyond to help figure out her mood, taste for the moment and helped to steer her to dining bliss. It really adds to the experience when a server, who was as busy as Mae, made the time to make sure our experience was perfect.

V12KJ8brpcv7IewHLj_GEg.text: I am not convinced I've never reviewed True Food before. I'm convinced my review must have been lost in some update or something.  Oh, where to start? So, the bigger chains usually turn me off and this is a Fox Restaurant Concept although they've stepped up their game and have some pretty decent places these days. This is definitely one of them.   It is a bit pricey if you're like me and want one of everything, even though you know a simple meal will suffice especially when it's nutrient dense like the ones at True Food. Dr. Andrew Weil helped design the menu here with health and taste in mind. Some of the items are very simple making them delicious, like the turkey sandwich, with grapes (if my memory serves me correctly) and a half and half side of Tuscan kale salad and sweet potato hash. All very simple yet packed full of flavour and well, you just feel healthy afterwards.   The bison burger will keep any meat eater pleased and is a bit more complex, with an umami sauce and a medley of roasted mushrooms and caramelized onions. Even for those such as myself who aren't huge proponents of meat, I have no guilt in indulging in one of these burgers.  The crudites blew my mind the first time I ordered it and the hummus is a personal favorite of mine, I make the same recipe at home and have never had one that tastes better. Okay, maybe once but it was out of state, therefore, out of mind.   These days, I typically order whatever seasonal salad they may have and am always impressed at random goji berries or boysenberries that maybe paired with whatever seasonal vegetables at the time of my visit.  Though their dessert selection is rather minimal, I still love the matcha ice cream. Not to mention the beverages, both alcoholic and non. I personally like the spontaneous happiness drink if I am in the mood to drink and I do spontaneously feel happiness at those times. I also really enjoy their elixir, maybe they have more than one and I'm sure they're equally deserving of a mention but I've only had one.  I've tried a rice noodle mushroom dish that was divine as well.   The kiddo loved the crispness of the veggies in the kids teriyaki bowl which was surprising because she is rather picky and I believe it came with black rice.   I personally don't think one can go wrong at this place. I wasn't stoked on the tuna started we had last time but think it was just the sauce for me. The only other complaint I have is that there isn't one out by me in Gilbert yet, especially with all of the new development in the area.   Fingers crossed.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

aEbXBl6B3eNHBOgwvof5vA.text: We loved everything about this spot. Our waiter made sure we ordered the best items on the menu! The pomegranate lime mimosa was to die for!   We loved the Fennel chicken sausage pizza, and the Fig & Onion tart was really good! We also had the spaghetti casserole

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Bk9E9YkHDwiwPB0AUhReVQ.text: I used to really like this place and it was a go-to when I'd visit Scottsdale before they began opening more of them in California. Unfortunately, the quality has drastically declined, the prices have shot up and the portions are smaller/wimpier even.  The solid constant are some of the salads to which I ordered an addition of a protein and wanted it crispy-done. It came nearly undercooked and thoroughly inedible. It took our server such a long time to come check on us that by the time she did, it wasn't worth sending the salad back as I was 3/4 finished.  After I shared about the underdone protein, I was offered a replacement meat. I said it's okay as I'm already done with the salad. At this point, seeing that it was untouched, normally, most restaurants, even a small mom n' pops would offer to remove the item from the bill. Nope. Still on there at a price that was more than my kids meal! On top of that, my husband ordered tacos. As easy as a meal can get to prepare in the southwest. Guess not. Out came the dinkiest, chewy, yet saucily marinated street tacos that completely disintegrated within the first bite of the SINGLE, small corn tortilla. He couldn't even lift the remaining tacos as they just unleashed their contents from the single, small corn tortillas.  Why do I repeat "single, small, corn tortillas"? Because everyone who has ever made a taco knows that you DOUBLE a corn tortilla (you know, the kind that sell for around $3 for 100 count bag in any grocery store) if the meat is saucy. It was like an attempt at gourmet tacos, as the marinade was good, but between chewy meat and a single, small, corn tortilla at nearly $20... That is just asking to be written-off as a desirable restaurant.  I believe the clean food factor on some of their other items is what keeps this place busy, but someone is in dire need of protein preparation classes! Update 7/12: When management reaches out with a kind message, it really goes noticed and appreciated. So I am increasing the stars from a 1 to 3.

Cw5veRTaViBg-Vm8HNyXNw.text: I used to really like this place but the last couple of times it feels like its just fallen of the cliff. The food has become terrible, portions have shrunk, hygiene is questionable and the patio just reeks. It's lost its way. I hope it goes out of business soon so something else can come up in its place, I really like eating at this location.

aGpW7GKk846aWCU4PFCKCw.text: Both the service and the food here are exceptional. Our family loves going to this True foods location because of how accommodating they are and we never have to think twice about our dietary restrictions! Some of our family favs include the edamame dumplings, poke bowls and Korean noodle bowl.  They also have a wonderful assortment of craft cocktails! The servers always treat us so well and sent us home with an extra bottle of wine for my birthday.

fvcBRkw4hIUbpqN9Wlk8Uw.text: I follow a plant-based diet and True Food Kitchen is my favorite healthy food restaurant in Scottsdale. I always go to True Food Kitchen for my birthday and anniversary, because I know it's a special place with a wide variety of menu items to choose from. They offer several entrees, salads and desserts that I enjoy. Family and friends love going here too, because their food is so tasty. I also enjoy the choice of indoor or outdoor seating depending on the weather. Every staff member has been professional and kind. Do try to make a reservation, because this is a very popular place.

q-E8C_zlMK71p4FKXaD9EA.text: Great healthy choice in the Camelback True Food Kitchen.They have a variety of choices ranging from pizza to salad and ramen.   Have healthy options for sides such as kale salad and sweet potato. Also have some healthy vegetable and fruit juices that taste fantastic.   The staff is very friendly and nice.  Had such a great time!

uc4NwtoraoCfbW7MR4gLBw.text: This is a wonderful location. It's located at the beautiful Biltmore Fashion Park and is very busy especially during lunch/dinner times. The menu is great and also has seasonal options. Everything is fresh and has an open kitchen concept and they even have a small garden at the entrance. It's very inviting and the service has always been great.

yqURICaUnx4r7wuH56JGzQ.text: Super loud and always busy, but the food is always amazing! Ordered the ancient grains bowl $14. Delicious!! We also split the berry with coconut whipped cream dessert- it's small but the perfect bite to share after your meal! Love the kale cleanse juice also.

dn_BhsSICQrkVwqS5-vOZA.text: This place is pretty good and the food tastes fresh and healthy. The atmosphere is casual and pretty quiet. The staff were very friendly and very informative about the menu and the background about "True Food". My server was very attentive to my special request of no onions, asking if it was a taste thing or allergy. This shows they go the extra mile to make sure you aren't going to be allergic to an item on the menu and can guide you accordingly. I can see this would be an important aspect of the brand they are serving. The place is clean and looks very appealing. It's nice to find places that aren't a chain and have reasonable prices. I would for sure go back here. Family friendly restaurant as well. Keep serving up the good True food and fantastic service. You guys rock!!! Thank you for the enjoyable dinner.

RRKO87tkr0uiRbYLDuILQw.text: Great food. Awesome service. 100% satisfying exsperience. Food is made with excellence everytime freshly made in house

5ZfXZfcGr2_-iVOF6Z2-rg.text: We arrived a little early for our reservation, however we were still seated immediately upon arrival. Delicious food, smiling staff and very helpful. We will most definitely be making this a regular in our list of restaurants.

Pf-i8EAooLR9vF8OFcTE8Q.text: The food is absolutely amazing! The edamame dumplings and chicken satay are to die for! There are so many choices and not one is a bad choice. The service is always top notch. The atmosphere is fun and inviting. It's a great place to bring guests or just enjoy a great meal.

cS2z9rtAByK4_7LNi4mUeg.text: By far the best meal I've had in Phoenix since my return three months ago!  Ok, I don't get out much, but the options, ambiance and service here are great. It's obvious that the ingredients are of the highest quality and there is something on the menu for everyone. You can "feel the love" in the food and know without a doubt that it's nourishing your body.  I had the ancient grains bowl and added grass fed steak; each bite was full of complex flavors and delicious!  I'll definitely be back frequently.

jdgAG7o_2gqiAK78ZtOTPw.text: Always love this place. We sat at the bar tonight and the bartenders were amazing. Had to get the dumplings, they are always my favorite. Tried the burger for the first time and I think it's my new go to. My husband tried the new watermelon mojito and said it was so refreshing. So happy to see Katie managing now too. She deserves it. Thank you True Foods for always making us feel so special. We will be back very soon.

-4reOCpJigSA-Ry8P0KLRg.text: Impeccable service, creative, healthy food choices every time. I love this place and stop in every time I'm in the valley that I can. Love, love, love.

nm6Bw9Grke_F8ubrSyV4WA.text: Love True Food Kitchen! The menu is seasonal and delicious. I left feeling healthy and happy. The portions are a bit small.. or my appetite is to big lol. But I would highly recommend going. It's a perfect place to have a party or a special event. The atmosphere is lovely and fresh. Our waiter Trevor was awesome. He was so attentive and polite, my whole table left really impressed with his service.

byRQgwrzEDSoZbUnnuwdWQ.text: The continued demise of the shaved turkey pita......  Today I made the mistake again of ordering the shaved turkey pita for takeout.  The pita was different. It was not soft as it should be. It was hard and ripped when it was folded. They no longer include grapes which were a nice touch. The sauce is different....bad different. The tomatoes are now slices not the tasty little cherry tomatoes. The cucumbers used to be thin slices and now are chunks. BUMMER. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me. My bad. Will now search elsewhere. I really hope TFK gets it together because the concept is great, they've just missed the execution one too many times.

KuSfZ9_SeNsLuXY-AncxkQ.text: We're already planning our next dinner at True Food. Well, actually we'd like to try the Happy Hour next!  We were kindly accommodated outside with our pup. We really appreciated TFK allowing us to have our dog outside, who fared well in the shade provided by the side of the building, the hanging canopies in the alleyway, the umbrella by our table, and the overhead misting.  Adam was our server and he was so genuine and his presence was truly a delight. He answered all of our questions concerning the menu and when we were stuck between dishes, he gave us recommendations that did not disappoint! As it was our first time here, he explained the philosophy and seasonal schedule of the restaurant to us, which is right up our alleys. A changing menu is awesome because it gives incentive to keep you coming back to try more.  We had guacamole as an appetizer which was fresh af on a hot September evening in the Valley. I ordered the chili noodles and my SO ordered some kind of grass-fed burger wrapped in lettuce. After we ate our meal, we didn't feel overly stuffed or uncomfortably filled with heavy food, as meals out often leave us feeling. We felt comfortable, light, and satiated, more than likely due to the fresh ingredients in our dinner. This really makes a difference in our dining experience, and is the main reason we're coming back to experience this place again in the near future.

4oRYgOShj2OCw66AWZxfXg.text: I adore this place...fresh doesnt describe the food. Loved the wines! I would definately recommend it.

VRGUxRwlKtwvIBaNy0OoAA.text: Coup De Tart is the best deal. I have never seen so many vegetables!  Also the Spaghetti Squash Casserole (VEG GF) organic tomato, caramelized onion, zucchini, fresh mozzarella  Without the cheese this is pretty darn close to vegan:)

NR78SRtbTmy2OeLJewkYVg.text: There are very few places that I eat where the food is better than what I can cook at home. Including Fleming Steakhouse where my husband wanted to go for his birthday, and our bill was over $200.  I just ate at True Food Kitchen and had to kill guacamole and the grass fed beef burger and that was the best meal I have had in years. Absolutely delicious. You will not be sorry if you eat here. It seems like a vegetable kind of place but it actually has very good meat selections.  I've never had a grass-fed burger that tasted good, and the one I ate today was absolutely delicious. It's going to be hard to not want to go there all the time. And I also got the food to go so I didn't even eat it Fresh Off The Grill I didn't eat it for about 20 minutes after I picked it up. That says a lot.

EZXEGuxcNNgj-C5GfRe_eQ.text: I've been here a few times. Lovely atmosphere.  Last time there, I ordered the curry bowl and it was not what I expected. I love curry but could not bring myself to eat their dish. I had to send it back and ended up going with my usual mushroom pizza, which is great.   A little pricey, with rather small portions.   All in all, they're worth visiting.

bh7BoJLfSJkGZGRQPr3IcQ.text: This was the best food I've ever had. Ever. I save my five stars for stellar restaurants only and this one? IS the definition of stellar.   I'm vegan and often eat with my boyfriend who is not vegan nor vegetarian. This place allowed us to both eat straight off the menu with no modification which is AWESOME.   Our waiter, Adam, was helpful, knowledgeable, and absolutely a valuable resource when it came for my boyfriend to choose between the steak tacos or the lasagna.   I got the ancient grains bowl and couldn't be more happy. I am so full and so happy. This place has a CUTE earthy vibe and reminds me a lot of Nashville. I adore it, and will definitely be back often.

8JtQutyknz6ctM1-jHzquw.text: So the food is pretty good. I got the all grain bowl which was tasty and my husband got the beef tacos which he liked. I got the flan for dessert (yuk!) and the cappuccino (good!) it's more like sitting at your kitchen table which didn't seem to mirror the atmosphere.

C_JAKEHzEQJA2PfuG1XCQw.text: Very good food. I had a pleasant experience because they accommodated us very well. Would recommend to anyone looking for a healthier option.

E4XXw2RXjNXa8plUcIQVWA.text: The food is good but sooooo overpriced that I just can't justify eating here. $7 for about 3/4 cup of soup? $9 for a little plate of cauliflower ... really?

0PqCZGWpBkRe1hNvxeWUrg.text: Food was absolutely amazing and so was Hailey our server! My colleague and I ordered the edamame dumplings to start, which were amazing along with the skinny margaritas. I had the ancient greens and my colleague had the sausage pizza. Both cooked to perfection. I asked if the kale salad was good during our wait and she kindly brought me a small bowl to try! Super sweet. Overall, the best food and service I've had in a while!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0JA1fVAgCVadsUBcy3vSvg.text: The best Tuscan kale salad, great customer service, yummy desserts every season and great appetizers. No guilty here, just a happy and healthy yummy

GDJr2wTgzpj18MMzyYJNaA.text: We love this place. Even though it's in a mall, I'd still eat here as my sole destination. The open kitchen boasts a confidence that cannot be argued with. For lunch, I had the kale salad with salmon. The salmon was cooked to a perfect medium-rare. My wife had the quinoa salad. While I loved my lunch, I tasted hers and will have a hard time deciding which to order when I return, but the entire menu looks good.

LSAm_IryLsrrNwAxZtJYxA.text: I love this place, but their service is horrible. Food is great, healthy, great flavor. The delay between ordering food and actually serving it needs improvement. Not coming back for awhile. Hopefully management sees this and improves this aspect.

F70oZ84QdSnY6a-hZ5uO5Q.text: This place is incredible. Love it so much. Anything you get on the menu is going to be delicious. I'm convinced. Haven't had a bad meal here.   I highly recommend the edamame dumplings for a starter. Incredible.   Red chili noodles dish is amazing as well!!

tPI0QpWSPdQOPjLh4rQ-ug.text: My wife loved it. I thought it was mediocre but I don't care for these kinds of eateries. Not into organic, vegan, gluten free chow.  If you like what is apparently uber healthy, tasty chow, then this place is probably for you.

6TNYqz8S1BAyKcTUPBljoQ.text: I had dinner here for the first time with a friend who recommended it as a place to get a delicious healthy meal.  Well, she wasnt wrong.  We ordered the cashew pad thai and the squash casserole.  Both dishes were delicious.  I would absolutely order both dishes again, especially the pad Thai.  My only complaint is that the portions are pretty small for the price.  There weren't really any carbs in the casserole dish (mostly squash and tomatoes), so would it have killed them to include a slice of bread?  In fact, they don't offer any kind of complimentary bread or anything when you first sit down.  I'm all for healthy eating, but it's the little touches that make me return to a restaurant.

O08q_d_C8TXhCYkkWM4WLw.text: Amazing and healthy! They are very concerned with health and provide a menu suitable for most diets. I am vegan and ate the TLT (Tempeh Lettuce Tomato) sandwich and it was one of the best sandwiches ever! I also had the Cucumber Cooler to start, which was a perfect compliment to the meal and very refreshing.

tQjwu4OwAogkjacbK5rf5Q.text: Even if you aren't vegetarian or vegan, you will love this place! Their food is amazing, and the presentation is incredible : )

RII48W4Q2d8c79V1gkPElA.text: Let's hear it for waiter BILL who served FOUR TABLES with courtesy, efficiency and attention!!! There was a mix up on our cocktails and he subtracted the total for them from the bill! Maitre D' Kelly was also excellent/gracious. FOOd??? Absolutely delicious!!!!! A tad noisy, not much atmosphere but do go for the food and service!!!

_ifKK4Kz8l2wJdlbvlgVBA.text: Sooo disappointed. Arrived here yesterday with a friend at about 4:15pm. Seated promptly. An over bubbly petite girl approached our table.. (you know the kind.. TGI Fridays "flare" type) speaking in cheerleading tones, we'll call her "bubbles" letting us know our server would be with us in a minute.. right as our server arrived.  There were maybe 5 tables sat including ours in all areas of the restaurant and Ill be damned if our poor server wasnt waiting on every single one of them.. which explains why she wasnt very attentive. Not really her fault..Our food did arrive in a timely fashion delivered by "Bubbles". My friend had ordered the squash casserole and had asked if bread was available for her to order and the attitude and outright snottiness of bubbles next comment decided the gratuity and the fact we will never go back. She said " we dont have bread.. this isnt the Outback." You should have seen the looks on our faces.  She then catches herself and says we have pita and my friend staes "nevermind, that's not what I was looking for". Bubbles goes away and comes back with an order of pita anyway. We sat in silence for a good 5 minutes.. apalled at that little bitch's outburst. As a manager I would have fired her on the spot for speaking to a patron in that manner.   After the "incident" and our meal was finished, the plates were cleared and we sat...and sat while our server tended to the rest of her tables. Meanwhile there are 5 servers doing sidework right in front of us.. including Bubbles (who mind you was leaning over the sidework table laughing and not helping her coworkers at all). We made eye contact with several of them hoping they would notice we were looking for our server and nothing. We had actually wanted dessert but by the time our server finally showed we just wanted to leave. Im sure our server would have been great had she had any form of assistance from her coworkers. But the snottiness of the self righteous self entitled Bubbles was inexcusable.  Im sure you're wondering about the food.. it's decent but not anything amazing..too many restaurants in Phoenix to come back here for their food, let alone to be talked down to by the staff.  Oh and also, we were told their tomatoes are flown in from tuscany.. Seriously? In this economy you're flying tomatoes in from Italy and not supporting your local markets..FAIL

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi sliders with sweet potato hash

YWNrOhOTxC3pZaJXewKJjQ.text: True Food is a healthy alternative to your typical restaurant. The Kale salad is amazing! I didn't think I would like kale. Also amazing are the Spaghetti Squash Casserole and the Turkey Pita. They also have a large variety of specialty sodas in addition to beer and wine. The staff is very knowledgeable on all food too.

YdnmocqZ7fFRHoemv1SJzw.text: The food here is great!  I love their street tacos and their watermelon salad (seasonal).  Everything I have had here is delicious.  Also recommend the Hangover Rx...really refreshing.

w9jhasocuetU1WH6t3SJeg.text: I was in Phoenix for a business trip and avoided going to TFK my first night because it was so crowded.  The second night it wasn't too busy so I went in.  After eating the food, I know why it was so busy the first night.  Great food and a friendly atmosphere.  I eat a gluten-free diet which in most places makes you feel like your selections are limited...not at TFK.  Excellent selection - my only problem was that I was only there for one night and didn't have enough room in my stomach to try all of the things I wanted.  Next time I am in Phoenix, I will be back...and will wait on line if I have to.  (Note:  went to Christopher's on the first night - what a waste.  Should have went to TFK both nights)

R4-LBwfsRq7HtLuxbco0Pg.text: I went here earlier this week on a work outing. The food and drinks were very fresh and tasted good! If they weren't so pricy I would definitely stop in here more often. I will probably visit again on a special occasion.

f_3XHvFtdbkwQPMX1GPRMw.text: The food and service were excellent and if my rating was solely based on that I would have given True Food 5 stars.  BUT, after using the restroom, and witnessing my server cleaning the splash zone around the urinal, my rating went down to 2 stars. Even though I saw my server wash his hands, I was still grossed out. I know someone needs to clean the bathroom, but does it really have to be my server?!?!  Don't get me wrong, I was not mad at the staff, because I am sure they were just doing their job, but I really wish I did not have to see that.    I really love this place and always get good service and delicious food but I just don't appreciate my servers also cleaning the bathrooms and then handling my food.  I don't know if this is their policy, but unfortunately I have not been able to bring myself back there since then.

RiRn52j2kdjiBExVCXpGhw.text: Awesome place for clean and fresh eating! Great sweet potato hash is awesome. I love that you can watch the chefs prep in the restaurant.

TtahYbrDik562Jaiqf857A.text: As a vegan, I've eaten here a few times and my dishes have been hit or miss.  The delicious ones are the Edamame Dumplings (amazing!), Tofu Stir Fry and the Hummus and Pita Plate.  When I ordered the Seasonal Roasted Vegetable plate, all that came out were 3 different types of potatoes and some carrots.    The non-vegan options that my friends and family get are usually amazing and my favorite thing on the menu besides the dumplings is the Vegan Chocolate Pudding.    Also took away one star cuz it's overpriced (lots of upcharges, $5 for a glass of iced tea).

_xQS5X6vM-er2oXmr33HRQ.text: Finally had a chance to try True Food, as I had heard so many great things about it!  Their drink menu looks interesting.  My friend ordered the honey tea, and said it was refreshing and light. Everything on their menu sounds appealing, but is a bit on the pricey side for what it is.  I ordered the chicken sausage skillet from their brunch menu.  It was good, but a little on the bland side.  Could use some salsa or hot sauce to spice it up.  The other two at my table ordered the bison burger, which was amazing!  The flax seed bun was fresh and the fixings were perfect.  Kale salad and sweet potato hash on the side, which were both really good as well.  For dessert, we all had coffee and split the flour-less chocolate cake, which was perfect in size and flavor.  The coffee was nothing to boast about, but it rarely is for me.  Service was good.  I recommend sitting outside if it's a nice day.  Next time, I'd like to try the pizzas or tacos.

JM8amdXzrG793jVwaF4cog.text: The food was delicious! We are dorks for sustainable this, and organic that so we loved it.  We had shrimp dumplings, kale salad, ahi salad, miso soup (awesome), tomato soup (soup of day) for starters.  Everything was great, kale salad was a little plain but tasty, ahi salad was our favorite.  I had a kilt lifter from four peaks, one of my favorite beers so not much to say about that.  For entrees i had pan roasted chicken with brussels sprouts and butternut squash and faro, and my date had salmon with quinoa. I would have liked more Brussels sprouts (1 total cut in half) but everything was so good together it didn't matter.  The salmon and quinoa beet salad was incredible. The salmon was cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Damon, our server, was an amazing host. He suggested most of the things we had and he was dead on. We had a great time. Awesome.....and we'll be back.....loved it.

Sk_PZBpGQbh8xlcXosQZcg.text: I started eating lunch at True Food. The salads combinations are varied and delicious. And filling.  In one month I lost 10 pounds without even trying. It doesn't get any better than that.

upEpzvkNnnMHNu6U4BMC5A.text: Too expensive for what you get. I would way rather go to Pita Jungle, or Federal, or pretty much anywhere...

0ZLTUvMqtNHdrCyhkXAhMQ.text: Lots of healthy options. Good for people watching. Ginger Ale made to order. Mediterranean Chicken salad was good yet pricey

1JjcGkZ59lWO3SY3xwjuLQ.text: I crave the Tuscan Kale Salad.  And the service is always excellent.  Always.

4SuijgvVN2uSVBmC5Fp8hw.text: Always consistent. 2nd best lettuce cups in the valley. Fancy drinks!

W7H3SrVYNxJltXL8ybBUhg.text: Where do I start?!  The True Food Kitchen is superb. It all started with the fresh house made juice. I chose the "Kale Aid" .  I thought it was very hydrating and delicious all at the same time. At first look I thought it would be a vegetarian rest. but it's actually more of a "anti-inflammatory" restaurant where they focus on healthy dishes that do more good than harm on your body. A nutritionist by the name of Dr Weil is the founder. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. We sampled multiple dishes. One that I ordered was called "Panang Curry". If you like thai peanut sauce get this. Overall...great experience. Thanks Dr Weil!

Q_3s7hDpDatS35MN4N8ujQ.text: i want to move there just so i can eat here frequently! love their veggies & concept

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I could eat this Every day!

0hyUGxry4lrYCMfyePUeYA.text: High Prices. Cheap portions.  I ordered the heirloom tomato and watermelon salad.  Received a bowl half filled with huge chunks of tomato and watermelon along with 1 tiny dot of goat cheese, 2 cashews and 2 scraps of basil.  Not much for $12.  I also ordered 2 $10 martinis.  Maybe a thimble of Ketel One in each.  Two people = $100 tab and blah food.  Bummer.  Won't be back.  Too many other tasty options out there for that kind of scratch.

6FAH5Z2FcWmamBNUMuyUJA.text: Amazing food! So healthy and great service. Wish AZ would have more places like this.

d16IItL4KYYuy-NpfMmTew.text: This place was just delightful.  I have been here twice now and liked it both times.  To be honest, I can't remember what apps I've had there, but I do remember the turkey bolognese and it was excellent.  It was rich and satisfying without being overbearingly greasy or oily.    The organic honey lemonade is also very good.  It's just too bad that it cost 3 dollars for such a small amount.  GIVE ME MORE.

83Z_ER32n5GjGxhCZpVU9A.text: It's refreshing to find a restaurant concept that features natural produce and healthy fare in truly remarkable flavor combinations. I adore True Food, particularly the local vegetable crudites with tzatziki and olive dip. The heirloom carrots, crunchy radishes, baby bell peppers and other earthly treats are fabulous. I also highly recommend the steelhead salmon or turkey bolognese. The servers are respectful of food allergies or preferences, and they are happy to customize drinks if your palate is being particular.

05skvUo2DkJf0d3q9ZKucA.text: One of my favorite places to eat in the valley.  Everything is fresh and delicous and perfectly portioned.  My recommendations are the TLT sandwich or the Turkey Bolognese.

iVqLBXSK80j7vYqAWATWZA.text: This place is incredible.  Boyfriend & I went to Scottsdale to visit his Mom & we went twice that weekend!  I love that it's all fresh, organic ingredients, and I also love that while Boyfriend is on his healthy/vegan/etc. kick, this is a place that more than suits both our needs!  Our first trip was dinner; I had a turkey wrap thing that was v. v. good...Boyfriend had the kale garlic pizza (which, just, wow, no words!), and Boyfriend's Mom had grilled salmon which she thought was v. v. good also!  I loved their selection of interesting & different drinks, also!  We came back for lunch a couple days later--I just had the margarita pizza, Boyfriend had a pizza with manchego, I think (?) and peppers, and Boyfriend's Mom had the kale pizza that BF had a couple nights prior.  Definitely high marks, still, for lunch!  All in all it was a really great experience...unfortunately, there aren't any in California, but we were told that they are opening one in Newport Beach and one in Santa Monica (YAYYY!) in a year or two!  This is SUCH a California place--once they get out here, I think they will do very well!

Q8PKazZcdAlf76ml05VCNw.text: everything on the menu is fresh and delicious- Prices are reasonable on the brunch/lunch menu, and the egg white burrito is delicious!! I recommend asking for half sweet potato hash and half kale on the side. The kale salad is amazing and does not come with the dish unless you ask.

FgDxq8Rr5llUZq9KUfuxQA.text: I ate at True Foods at the Biltmore on December 29th.  There were 4 of us(this was my sister-laws treat to my 2 daughters and myself).  We were anxious to try this Vegetarian/Vegan. Etc restaurant.  Our server was lovely and very attentive.  I checked the menu online before going so that I would have an idea of the selections.  The prices seemed reasonable.  I ordered the Autumn Salad, and as a treat I added Chicken.  It was $16, and was the size of a side salad.  My sister-in-law ordered the spaghetti squash casserole which was miniscule,  one daughter ordered the tacos, there was 3, and I wouldn't even call them the size of an appetizer, the other daughter ordered a pizza which she said was tasty, and looked to be of lunch size.  The bottom line,  the Portions are Very Small for the price you pay.  You will probably walk away hungry.  I will not be returning.

X8nd2OWyMdcjt4XD1Ik-rg.text: My husband I stopped off for a quick lunch because I heard rave reviews about the kale salad. The Hubby doesn't like Kale (or wouldn't choose it ) so we shared a Mediterranean salad and fish tacos. I know they don't go together , but the food was super fresh and delicious and some worked together. We kept looking over at each other sayin "this so yummy" and flawless. The salad had the perfect consistency of crunch and lightness. The Fish in the tacos was moist and flaky and seasons light and just right.  We also had the retail therapy cocktail, it was also delightful, not too sweet and very refreshing and made you want more , but then who would drive us home. I hope to figure out the cocktail recipe to make at home, may need to try a few more first .

_YDmkZDa45Bn5xmP77gjuA.text: I was in phoenix for work, taking a break from a long day, and decided to walk around the mall when I came accross True Food Kitchen. The decor was really inviting and the place was packed so I thought i'd give it a try.   I sat at the bar which faces the kitchen, awesome entertainment if you're dining alone. I really enjoyed the food and the service was impeccable.  I really liked the Shrimp dumpling! The ahi tuna sliders were really good for a lighter option to burgers.  Do not get the squash ravioli though, I couldn't have more than 2 bites.  Looking forward to going back during my next visit!

QaK5rny2E9mydjWPlx5JXQ.text: I loved it so much on a visit back to AZ for the week I dined 3 times... Every person that went with me enjoyed it's delectable fare.. Even the Midwest steak eaters & teenage boys... I think that says a lot... Every-time here  we ordered many things off the menu and shared... So many things I fell in love with on the menu... The Kale salad, and pizzas, green tea soba noodles, and the PITA (trying to figure out the recipe)... the raw fish of the day... of course the juices... everyone was ambrosial, yes I tried them all! All was prepared so delicately and with much culinary care.  This is the type of place you go when you want to eat healthy, and still feel it is gourmet, or you are trying to turn someone on to eating healthier...  Or you have mixed eaters, picky, vegan, veg, no wheat etc.  Once again Sam Fox & his team are brilliant. I was told it took 1.5 years to plan this place... there was so much that could not (would not) be compromised... I was rather impressed that they paid for the full liquor license only to cary one organic rum and vodka... They are taking a huge money loss by sticking to the philosophy...  Also with the demand that everything be fresh, the food cost must be frightening...   I hope people give this a try... it is the most delicious well done foodie health food I have ever had... and I dine around.   yum... I miss it already.

S4n7m2zH4_tzWp0zd2GsTQ.text: GOOD LORD ALMIGHTY!!!! Thank you Dr. Weil!!!  It's about time you can go into a restaurant and not have to worry about how many hours of detoxification, hydration afterwards or how much future Prilosec and Plavix you need to save up for!  It was a wonderful journey of food ecstasy!!!  Yes!  I really mean that!  The resturant is modestly furnished but very detailed.  I read about this in a clean eating magazine and said if I ever go to Phoenix, I'm eating THERE!  I loved the food....there was three in my party and I ordered the most and gladly paid the $100 something  bill (plus tax and tip).  Everything is clean, organic, natural and nicely portion and the variety of drinks that are "good for you" taste wonderful and they are not alcoholic!  The menu has a nice variety of dishes and desserts (Chocolate cake is fantastic)!!!!    I hope they bring this place to the bay area!  We would love it!

iZdH78y5_1S6GnFXGUCrTQ.text: This would be getting 5 stars if not for the service I have received.  I've been three times and twice felt neglected for long periods of time (and my "service" measuring stick is low - be friendly and keep an eye on my wine glass and you're my best friend).  I love the concept.  There are too many corporate chain restaurants (I know, True Food could be considered a corporate chain but I prefer not to think of it that way) that serve heaping plates of fat and salt filled belly bombs (Cheesecake factory) to clientele that has no business eating like that (Buy a mirror people!).  For those of us that try to keep up appearences, its nice to have a healthy option that makes a great attempt at pleasing the pallette in cool surroundings.  I have enjoyed every meal I have eaten at True Food, and I did not feel any bloated guilt when I left.

_gq5KJ6vGQIVQ8Kj3vajBg.text: Kathryn, my girlfriend, loves True Food kitchen and I am a skeptic of anything done by the FOX group especially when it aligns itself to a single philophers idea of eating well, in this case Dr. Weil. I am also a pretty critical person and enjoy critiquing most everything especially eatieries and restaurants.  One issue we have is that we are Vegans and while they do have a number of items listed as Vegan on the menu there are a few things that just seem silly. The first one is that they have no Salads listed as Vegan and the second is that they do not offer Vegan Mayo. The last time we mentioned the Mayo thing our server gave us a reason why they didnt but that we are welcome to bring our own in.  Today has been a fun day so I thought going to True Food would be a good treat for Kathryn and maybe distract me from other events occuring recently. Our server, Chris, has waited on us before and is always very nice. When we mentioned the Soy Mayo thing she offered to go talk to the chef and managers. When she returned the reply was that "at some point we have to draw the line." To which I explained that by offering Vegan/Soy Mayo they would lower costs, increase shelf life, and even start substituting it with real Mayo without anyone noticing. She thought these were valid enough and again went to talk with the chef and managers. To which Kathryn and I exchanged glances and began eating our soup.  To our surprise our next visitor was none other than Michael Stebner the Executive Chef of the restaurant. We began a 10 minute conversation about their philosophy and methodology for creating the menu. He explained that they are not a health food restaurant but rather a restaurant with a health focus. He also pointed out that they are happy to modify anything on the menu to accomodate a number of eating requirements. This was really cool stuff.  He then went further and talked about his history as a chef and what he has seen work and not work from a practical perspective. This was a real conversation and I appreciate his engagement with us both. At no time was he demeaning to us and he never brushed a point of ours off. While I disagree with the philosophy of their menu I respect their methodology and see that they are interested in doing something more than just sell as much food as possible.  Overall this was a great experience and while it did not result in everything I wanted I am more than happy to refer anyone to eat here and will be back again!

PmzgseNw7vYyPx2My21ueg.text: What happened to this place?  The first time I went about a year ago, both the food and service were great.  Second time, last May, I ordered the same dish and it was horrible.  Drowning in sauce.  But, at least the service was decent.  Just went a third time and it will be my last.  Both the food and service were horrible.  Went for lunch, sat inside and it wasn't very busy.  Our waiter was totally out of it and only had 4 tables and hardly paid any attention to us and kept forgetting things, like taking our order to start.    Then, even the food runner forgot to bring me half my meal after I asked her for it.  In the meantime, I counted at least 17 staff member hanging out in the kitchen area, which is open, so you can see them and half of them were folding napkins.  My food was not very good and actually made me a little sick.  This is a shame, especially because there aren't many places in Phx that have vegan choices, but for the price you pay, I would expect a lot more.

A0FsYkSpl5Rw4FC-yeLpQw.text: I have nothing but GREAT things to say about this place! I have been to both locations in the Valley (Biltmore and the Scottsdale Quarter) and not only is the food mouth watering..the atmosphere is so great! I can't wait to go back again!

49ohrp9PWWEZop_x-PNd0g.text: The Wild Ahi Sliders from True Food Kitchen come with wasabi, radishes, cucumber and a sesame brioche. Don't be mislead, the wasabi is merely a nice little portion which gives you a perfect essence, no epic nasal burns here. I ordered mine with the sweet potato hash which was absolutely amazing and the Green Arnie (Matcha Green Tea & Honey Lemonade) for my drink which was very refreshing and a perfect match. If you get the opportunity to stop in, look for Nate he's the cool guy at the bar. He'll get you squared away. True Food Kitchen is a cool place, great atmosphere, with awesome people. Highly recommended!
