Yl67ov3HnKSfj_Ev9iWTEw.text: Delicious from the exotic cocktails, to the appetizers, main entree, and desserts with vegan ice cream on top! First time at this restaurant and will definitely be back.

NV6zEWsASF8A_yrpKAWtzQ.text: Ok ok what's not like about this place? I'm highly impressed with Andrew Weil's work, and this place seems like an exemplary example of his philosophy. Fresh, organic, local when possible plant centered menu is right up my alley! When we were seated, my daughter immediately read the info/propaganda sheet about the restaurant and squealed with delight because it meshed so well with our philosophy on food..... However, I'm not impressed when young PEOPLE (often called children or worse "kids" in our culture) are disrespected. The hostess put two real menus in front of my 13 year old daughter and me, and then she slapped the "kids menu" on the table in front of my 10 year old son without even really looking at him or asking if we wanted a child's menu. He and I were both insulted immediately. Unfortunately that feeling didn't improve. We normally don't even consider the child's menu because my children have been treated as "people" their entire lives, so they eat real food with real flavor like the rest of us!   Never the less after he slid around the table so he could look at my menu, we did look at both menus because their child's menu actually WASN'T filled with pasta, hot dogs, and chicken strips like most kid menus. It looked like a smaller version of the other menu... almost. For example, apparently children only eat cheese pizza?! Really? Dairy and crust alone with no veggies are anti-inflammatory? That's not what my research shows. How does one expect to start people on a healthy path of eating if we don't start right away. Shall we stick with the old "four food groups" concept when we are young and then magically develop a taste for vegetables once we're old enough to understand how healthy they are? That makes no sense! It's just stupid.... On that particular day, however my son had a cold and didn't have his normal appetite, so smaller portions of regular food was appealing to us. When the waiter arrived I asked about their "kids"menu. Shaun was nice enough --in an aloof and subtly condescending way. Just for the record I look like the old punk rocker that I am, but don't judge a person by his appearance these days. You don't know my income level or food/health knowledge and experience. You might be surprised. Anyway back to the menu! So I asked Shaun, "what about your child menu, is it bland and tasteless like most?" I told him we had raised our children eating the same food we eat, the same food your establishment is pushing, and he assured me that wasn't the case here. These were just smaller portions.    Onward to the show!! --The food. I started with a root and remedy drink and my daughter ordered the kale aid. Both were very good except for the typical over abundance of ice. I wish they had asked if we wanted ice, so we could have made our own choice, but like the kid menu, assumptions were the rule of the day not choice. We all shared the Tuscan kale salad and it was the highlight of the meal. Although vegans beware it is covered in cheese. The salad was fresh and had lots of garlic. I highly recommend it. For my main dish, I ordered the shrimp chili which cost extra to be gluten free. Why? I don't know. It's well documented that the hazards of gluten to the human intestinal wall lining are a likely suspect in inflammation. Seems like a no brainier for rice noodles to be standard. That being said, the chili was excellent. It was well spiced and had lots of fresh veggies. My daughter ordered the spaghetti squash and it was also good. As for my son, it was not his day.... insult followed insult! He ordered a chicken breast, peas and rice. His dish arrived early, so he was out of sinc with our meal. Furthermore, his food was bland and luke warm at best. Just as I feared, the assumption seems to be that young people, aka "kids," can't take flavors so it better be plain. Yuck! We were in sensory heaven, and he got cold, bland chicken. He ate two bites of chicken and half the peas and rice which were also cold. He and I felt as if he was being treated as a second class person the entire time we were there. As for the dessert choices.... Blah! There are so many wonderfully good dairy free and even raw desserts that everybody likes and can eat. The only desserts here that we're gluten free and vegan were chia pudding and scoops of ice cream. Uhh coconut? and nut crusts? Why be so limited? We skipped dessert!   I may try the Scottsdale location because I want options that are of this quality, but we won't be back here. I wish we had just gone down the road to the Whole Foods which has a fantastic food selection! ...... Ahhhh but that's another review.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. YAAAAAAWN! Oh sorry if the photo is blurry: I must have been dozing off! Cold chicken anyone?

PIx_Icmwy47iACJ3_kAQ4A.text: I could eat the kale salad every day. Refreshing and light but also filling. Turkey pits is excellent too.

PgFimijOQY8D_gG-P1NH4w.text: Came here twice in one week because I loved it so much. The location is gorgeous and since I went during the holidays, outdoor seating was very scenic. The kale salad was my favorite and the butternut squash spagetti a close second. I wish it wasnt as overpriced as it is for how big the portions are but I guess fresh ingredients come with a price!   Am excited to go back and try more items on their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from restaurant patio seats

kMHNp9CeE6jjxvmF-sbIeA.text: We arrived at the True Food Kitchen at about 3pm. As soon as we entered we were greeted in a very warm and welcoming way. I loved the T-shirts the servers were wearing. They all had an inspiring message such as "Shine On" "Honest" "Green Goddess" "Truth". Those messages instantly brought a smile on my face.  The atmosphere was pleasant. The servers were speaking softly and with kindness. This is something I appreciate. The menu was a good mixture Omnivorous :) Vegetarian and Vegan. There is something for everyone. So if you are Vegan you can go there with your meat eating friends too. I liked the fact that it is not strictly vegan or vegetarian but that there is a healthy choice for everyone. The food was delicious.I particularly liked the Teriyaki Quinoa Vegan bowl and the Vegetarian Edamame dumplings with asian herbs and white truffle oil! Yum Yum!  A healthy and happy place to eat for ALL! I will definitely go there again!

vdznsAhn4TNVELu-ea5jGQ.text: Great appetizers! The Edamame dumplings were yummy, a must try. Healthy and tasty food.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wild mushroom pizza
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butternut squash casserole
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panang curry

Is-kK0ydjFPapdR7b7g-WA.text: I love 'em. The steelhead salmon A-mazing. Sometimes I just go for their tuna appetizer... so fresh and yummy. I live near the Biltmore to it's fast and close. Oh! And speaking of fast... you a=order and 5 mins later, you get you dish. Love the presentation of the food as well. Go! They're great!

xj4cVrzKIuweQweTqJSUEQ.text: I've gone here a couple times and the reason I keep coming back is their bison burger. Other than that, I feel like everything else I've tried is pretty bland. They do have a cucumber drink and that's really good, but I feel like I can finish my drink in 10 seconds, half the glass is filled with ice. It does have a nice vibe though, feel like I'm in California.

jzKv9pITsRTNQn_h8pkCiw.text: Absoulety obsessed with this place!   This is now my 3rd time in one week!   Ryan the GM is so sweet and his passion for this restaurant is amazing!  The service is so fab and the food is delish!  The spaghetti squash casserole is so yummy I couldn't stop eating it after how full I was off of the apps which was the edamame dumplings and hummus !  If you haven't been you must go!

O7URBCwqLxMI8NXO-6iFZA.text: Loved this place. So difficult to find vegan/vegetarian places when we travel but True Food had a great selection of everything for all types of eaters. Food was awesome, service was fantastic, will definitely be going back!

Z-vR759Ah8V-MLbQqGlDpQ.text: Went to True Foods Kitchen for dinner last night.  Had the Kale guacamole and grilled chicken salad.  The guacamole was exceptionally good and worth reviewing. It is one of the best gucamoles I've ever had.  The chicken salad on the other hand was nothing special. Sure, it was good.  But the whole time I was eating it I kept thinking "I could've made this at home".  The Green's tasted like they were from a Fresh Express bag and the vinaigrette tasted like the bottled variety.  I will order something different on my next visit.  Edited to Add Update as of 1/26/17: I visited True Foods Kitchen a second time on 1/23/17.  This time I ordered the steak tacos.  The tacos came with a bowl of beans.  I forgot the name of these beans as they were listed on the menu, but they were very similar to pinto beans.  I must say that on this visit, I was very impressed with how good everything I ordered tasted! The tacos were seriously very good!  I devoured them in less than 5 minutes feeling full from 2 adequate sized tacos.  The meat was cooked to perfection and the salsa was perfectly mild with the right amount of flavor.  My friend ordered the mushroom and brussels sprouts pizza and she, too was very satisfied with her meal.  She said she liked how light and airy the pizza crust was and how much flavor the white sauce had.  Overall, I think I will be coming back to True Food Kitchen in the future and getting more of their delicious steak tacos and beans.  It was truly an amazing meal.  I'm glad I gave this restaurant a second try!

uFWwwefdq_tVGdx04c2xNA.text: I was recommended Truefoods by a foodie friend of mine and decided to finally try it Sunday for brunch. I went along with another friend who likes to eat just as much as I. We were seated outside as requested in no more than 5 minutes at a 4-top, which is always a pleasant surprise. I started off with a Moscow mule. The waiter came back out and said they did not have ginger beer and said he could recreate it with fresh ginger and such. It was even better than expected. We split 3 entrees: spaghetti squash casserole, mushroom flatbread and shaved turkey. Everything was excellent. They even split the entrees up for us. Highly recommend coming here if you like good service and good eats.

FM4cHMOyA7casr79q8M0SA.text: First time here.  Had the grass-fed burger with kale salad side.  Thoroughly enjoyed it.  Nice place.  We will be back.

k19k4EC0TVtuANbC1a_ggw.text: Went here for my birthday dinner!! Our server Chelsea was AWESOME! She took her time with us and our many questions, always was more than happy to accommodate our needs, and split up our meal for us to share before we even asked!! If you're heading here, ask for her. Thank you for making me feel so special on my birthday, Chelsea!!

tA13WpGX2V_XIT2PnIQcWw.text: My favorite restaurant. Always consistent with amazing food and wonderful service. I am never disappointed.

I-bX9SIMGpAk6AGoEtfYBg.text: Extremely good & fresh organic tasting ingredients!  The Panang Curry is excellent, ordered mine with chicken protein option, but available vegetarian style as well other options. Very very good restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panang Curry with optional protein (chicken here), is fantastic!!!

3gcP2q6TJfy8CPZTBtZ-4g.text: Been here a number of times over the past couple years, and gonna say it's a right-down-the-middle 3 stars out of 5. Not great. Not awful. Average/decent healthy-ish food for fairly high prices with almost-good service.  Healthy-ish? Well let's say you get a side of kale with that sandwich. Fair enough. But when you get into it...that kale be dragged through the ocean, matey!! Yyyaaarrr! Well not really but it is SALTED like it's from the bottom of Pirates of the Caribbean, rendering that fresh, healthy kale...um, not so healthy after all. She be a salty dog, yyyaaarrr!  Order a juice-based drink. Cool, super healthy, right? Then how about the "HANGOVER RX" - YEAH YEAH YEAH BRO! AFTER I SPEND THE WHOLE NIGHT YAKKIN, I WANT A PINEAPPLE AND ORANGE JUICE, Bruce! I swear, I feel like half this menu should be wearing an Affliction t-shirt, Ed Hardy trucker hat, d-bag sunglasses, camo shorts and flip flops. Maybe this is just the reality of Sam Fox and his Band of BMW Brahs. Alpha male goofballs who like to PUT A BAR SPIN ON HEALTHY EATS, BRO.  Granted there's a lot to be mocked at ANY Sam Fox "concept". But on the plus side, True Food attempts to stay healthy and sometimes offers a decent dish. I've been pleased with a few of the salads...I've been let down by most of the sandwiches though. The bread they use is often too heavy and not fresh enough. They can't get potato sides right, but to be fair most places cannot. Fries/taters at sit-down restaurants are too cold half the time, and usually over- or under-salted.  The grill items: chicken, meat, fish...good enough. Overall decent quality. However prices, for what you get, way too high. I know what fresh carrot juice tastes like (you serve carrot concentrate, son!); I know what a good house-made veggie burger tastes like; I can spot great-quality Ahi. I'm sorry, but these things are not present at True Food. Is it a step above the neighboring and overpriced Cheesecake Factory and Del Frisco's Grille & God-awful Sam Fox Mexi-Blanco three storefronts down? Yes. And for that, it is a 3-star joint.  Service trends towards more on the friendly albeit not extremely food knowledgeable. Parking is easy peasy. Indoor acoustics a little loud, and some of the tables are too close together, especially if you're 2-topping.  If you want a centrally-located meeting spot with a good parking situation and a hip and healthy LOOKING environment, this is it, chief. A sufficient lunch spot for wealthy ladies shopping on weekdays and office types looking for an alternative to the neighboring steakhouses and chains.  True Food doesn't succeed because it's successful: it succeeds because there's a dearth of good restaurants in the immediate area. Bro.

Uos14frM0NeixiFpjy55mg.text: I LOVE TRUE FOOD! Thank you Dr. Weil for creating this amazing restaurant! The food is so delicious, clean, and healthy. I love the tuna tataki!!!! The caramelized onion tart is crazy good! The roasted seasonal vegetable board is also really yummy. Everything is so yummy! I love that the fish is sustainable!  The service is fabulous and friendly and the atmosphere is very welcoming!

ZfImjyDlVTIvpl9jO1QEwg.text: Love the fact that all the menu items are healthful and delicious.  Never had a boring or bad meal here.   Have had only lunch items but they've all been great.  The service is fine and the atmosphere is cheery.  Great place to have a business lunch.

5EDY_1P4iRulTjknA-Ao_w.text: This week the Jolly Diners went to True Food Kitchen. We had appetizers of lettuce wraps with tofu which was absolutely delicious because they mixed little chunks of smoked tofu with peanuts. Heirloom Tomato bruschetta with some olive oil and some almond feta. Again absolutely delicious. My mom's entree was chicken noodle soup. My sister's entree was a mushroom vegetarian pizza, and my entree was a sandwich called the TLT. It had tempeh, guacamole, tomatoes, and it was absolutely delicious. Now the food was good, but that wasn't the best part of the whole experience. The best part was the service! The waitress was absolutely flawless. She was able to get me a Diet Pepsi and an order of french fries and even though the True Foods Kitchen doesn't  serve those items, she went next door to a place called The Zen Burger to get the items that I wanted as a part of my meal. I was stunned because I've never had someone go to those lengths to fulfill my needs as a diner and a guest. We definitely recommend True Food Kitchen for anyone who wants a great meal with vegetarian, gluten-free, and vegan menu options - but also fantastic service, a great atmosphere, with both inside and out dining, and some pretty good music. The Jolly Diners rate True Food Kitchen a 5 of 5. We couldn't have been more pleased or had a better time dining outside, under the water misters, with a nice breeze, and great food.

iccVSvBwS6uOWjHAJofBbw.text: Absolutely a healthy favorite that doesn't skimp on flavor, inspiration, and creativity!!  The veggie crudites is typically my starter if I dine in or take anyone who has never been.  The dipping sauces are yummy and fresh and the one is gluten free.    I usually opt for the turkey pita which is absolutely delicious.  House made pita and roasted turkey shredded with tomatoes grapes and a yummy yogurt sauce never disappoints.  You can either get roasted sweet potatoes or kale salad as a side which I usually get 1/2 and 1/2.  My favorite entree here for dinner is the squash casserole.  Yummy tender squash covered in a zesty marinade with freshly melted mozzarella is light but satisfying.  I love heart veggie dishes that satisfy more than even a steak or a burger.  Dessert wise I've tried the olive oil cake which is yummy but tiny!! It's a muffin size with about 7 berries.  I could eat 10 of those things.  For take out lunch everyone always gets the kale salad.  I personally really prefer the Mediterranean chopped salad with quinoa.  The dressing is light enough so the yummy pea shoots don't get soggy.  The Marcona almonds and feta are the perfect touch.

35L_hyZOQjsnksH_mobzmg.text: True Food Kitchen is another successful Fox Restaurant Concept.  Along with the other two places I have tried, 'Olive and Ivy' and 'Montana Avenue', I have yet to be disappointed by a meal by this company.  I would advise checking out their other places as well.  The service was a bit slow, but the food was really good and good for you.  The drink I got was really different and refreshing called New Moon (pink grapefruit soda water and agave nectar).  They have lots of different drinks to choose from.  I had Ahi tuna sliders and for dessert flowerless chocolate cake.    All of it was really good and I did not feel heavy or that feeling  of needing to sit down at home in front of the television for an hour after eating a meal.    I will return hungry and order some other drink on the list.  After words I might be doing yoga.  The thing with healthy food I find is that you end up trying to keep up with it, and if you are in the Biltmore area I would check it out.  Recommendation: To anyone who is a healthy eater and everyone that shops at whole foods.  To people who are vegans and non alike that just want a good meal come to True food kitchen.

WALcGl2nonrOgwTmb51G3w.text: Hit or miss with food...  The drinks can be the same way.  The turkey burger is excellent, the ahi tuna sliders are great!  Service is decent, the crowd is mixed.  Certainly a bit overpriced at 50$ for lunch for 2.

PcpqjWZnZSEgz1pTHiUAaw.text: Overrated. I had a $17 bowl of ramen. Food was pretty bland and uninspiring. Not terrible, just not worth the prices. I had a smoothie also, which was also meh. The desert tasted like a cliff bar with some stuff on top. The appetizers were ok.

O90tBcjAXq2bcRHXnyC9YA.text: A great alternative to the highly-processed, unhealthy options out there. Glad that restaurants like this are getting attention as it helps raise awareness for the importance of healthy living.

TqeUqcSl3VIPByxvNyEJZg.text: Great service.....but mediocre food. The kale juice was a rip-off...diluted and glass full with ice. The humus dip was too sour with lemon....and the buffalo burger was salty!

y39E8S-_HLyswI-hGOtazw.text: Woop!  Yay for TF's super chic patio, interesting drinks and AWESOME healthy food options!  I love it!

1EpDrFvhrcQztx1_nm-0Bw.text: Clean, simple, healthy food with a good amount of variety on the menu. I love restaurants like this that prove healthy food doesn't need to be boring or bland. I got the turkey burger which was delicious, as was the kale salad and sweet potato hash. There was no shortage of food options that sounded tasty and quite a few choices for gluten-free and vegetarian diets. They also had a lot of really interesting looking (non-alcoholic) drinks and I kind of regret not trying one out--next time I suppose!

h8Zmiq28vLJk2qlmiNo3dg.text: My wife and I stopped here for salads since we were at the Mall where this is located. Both of our salads were delicious and the service was excellent. Recommended.  Nice patio dining as well.

EGrs5G7G27_ulHk38noPMA.text: A couple of things about my recent visit.  First of all, I had the Teriyaki Brown Rice, Local Vegetables, Sesame & Avocado with Tofu.  Since I'm vegan, it was one of the options conveniently marked as such.  And it was delicious!  Flavorful and hearty, I truly enjoyed it.  I took my mother here for her birthday, and both my mother and brother enjoyed it.  I've been a couple of times for lunch, and I have enjoyed it, but neither my mom nor brother eat a lot of food that follows this concept.  My brother, a near carnivore, liked the steak tacos, but thought that the tortilla was bland.  We ordered a bottle of delicious wine, and thoroughly enjoyed the strawberry hemp-milk ice cream.  That should definitely become a permanent selection, because I am vegan and I did not see another vegan dessert option.  And finally, the waiters and staff were awesome.  Our waiter was friendly, polite, and incredibly helpful.  I definitely recommend this for anyone looking for some local selections, a unique mix of (mostly) healthier food, and anyone wanting to enjoy a good meal.

nNxi3jS7x3rAQrOD9lyBJQ.text: The only reason I'm changing my review is for the best waiter ever. Seriously. I have never had service in Arizona as good as his. John is an amazing waiter who clearly takes pride in his work. This to me is hard to come by. When you get good service it just makes everything taste better :)  My mom and I are very picky eaters...no oils, no dairy, no wheat or gluten. He was very understanding and didn't make us feel like changing around the menu was a bother (it has to be). He was on top of everything. Anticipated every want or need.   If you eat here, ask to sit in Johns section. It will be a great experience!

pQ2wQXGRzanBmk1PjUXnaw.text: Came in with a group and shared 6 different dishes, every single dish and side were excellent. Awesome drinks, desert, even the coffee was good. Awesome!

zYlGXFbDUMs-VT7nPQst8Q.text: This place is a home-run to win the world series! The menu is unique and robust. Everything I had was perfect. The kale salad and sashimi were perfect. Great setting and interior. They have fresh nutrient rich juices, too! Wish I could eat here regularly and will make it a point to eat at True Food whenever I'm in Phoenix.

q-ZoVUH3_0rJmMY7Z-aLgw.text: I wanted to like this place more than I actually did.  Food was good but considering the taste, price and atmosphere.  There are better options in phx.

D3jV4jMNioAGUmSDFus43w.text: Love, love, love True Food. It is one of our favorites. You can't go wrong with the turkey bolognese, steak tacos and the Tuscan kale salad. Plenty of gluten free and veggie options and a great wine selection. So yummy.

QmphF5G8kWbat8ZKpGT-uw.text: I had the turkey burger and it was amazing! I can't wait to try more.

ea_CHatVJQGfKWJPkuYFxQ.text: I enjoy going here.  Food is good and the waitstaff is always nice and friendly.  It can get a little loud during peak hours, but other than that, it is a good place to go.

CyCLgI7PQnM3cQKfDWq18w.text: Excellent food.  I have been here for breakfast, brunch, and lunch and everything I have tried has been wonderful.  There are many vegetarian options to choose from.

J23f0E-iHHH_viHhN69-mw.text: True Foods, a name I'd heard seven million times before finally stopping in as a part of my "AZ Healthfood Tour", this was my first visit to the Phoenix location and this place had a lot of hype to live up to. Unfortunately my experience left a bad taste in my mouth. My experience started around 8 p.m. on a Thursday night, I was sat by the restroom by a young man that smelled terribly of B.O., myself and the young lady I was with spent quite a bit of time laughing about the "V.I.P. restroom seat" we got.....with a dining room full of open seating. We were on our way to a show and decided to have something we could split,as people who frequent the Scottsdale Quarter location, we decided to break our norm and try a Margherita pizza.... we'd come to regret this, as the pizza took much longer than it should have on a night as slow as this one, and when it did show up, it was burnt. Not even a passable "well done", just flat out burnt. When our waiter passed back by our table ten minutes later I called for him and let him know the pizza had "missed its mark" and was a little over done. He responds "is it?", now I smiled because it clearly  was not fit to feed to anything, let alone anyone. He takes the pizza and we are soon visited by a manager who let us know she would take care of it for us, and that she was sorry. Not long after our second attempt comes out, and its burnt.....again.... in their defense it wasn't as bad as the first one but was still not very pleasing. At this point its so bad its funny, so we order our favorite Banana and Coconut chia pudding and jasmine tea, which was exactly what we needed to sweeten our experience up a bit. We decided not to have the rest of the pizza and called it a night. All in all, its not the Scottsdale location, but that Chia Pudding is a highlight. Still a fan of the brand, just cant see myself coming back to this location.

Jh0mfvJooeDVgFveLbDBPQ.text: This is why I typically wait until I've been to a restaurant more than once to write a review. Consistency means a lot - I don't care if the service is consistent, but the food should be. Especially if you're trying to sport a "healthy eco-friendly" image capable of reaching naysayer-veggie-haters that have only had bad experiences with healthy cuisine. My experience would certainly not have convinced any timid diners that they should try new foods. Which is unfortunate and makes me sad as a healthy food lover.  My first experience in February was absolutely lovely. Went for a friend's birthday and had the private room in the back. I ordered the green tea soba noodles with tofu and extra veggies - simply delicious. Everything I wanted...light, healthy, flavorful and a good glass of wine to boot. Service was spectacular and dessert was delightful.  My second experience really let me down. Fine if the service wasn't outstanding, I can get over my awkward waitress. The wine was fine. The food was not. I ordered the roasted vegetables with farro. Both the veggies and farro were undercooked and barely lukewarm. I don't like mushy vegetables, but al dente would be nicer to my jaw. And PS - those weren't figs. Definitely not figs.  I'd like to go back and try something else on the menu to see if this was just an off night, so for the time being I will deposit this mediocre review in hopes to have my confidence restored next time.

B4siQ3bjyU4xsqBKzBOb0Q.text: I have actually eaten here about four times already, always with the best intentions of giving it yet another chance, but I just  have never had that great of an experience at True Food. Today took the cake, when the waiter left with my half-eaten pizza to box it up for me and never returned for the rest of the night, neither to refill the water, nor to check on whether my friend and I needed anything else, nor to return aforementioned pizza. Unfortunately at that time we had already paid (which I guess explains his inattention) and I honestly could not remember the guy's face to track him down. But even had the service been outstanding tonight, the food has failed to impress me just about every time. Today I had the eggplant pizza, which was ok but the dough rather tasteless. In the past I have tried the miso cod (ok but not worth the $22 they charge) and some ravioli that were rather unmemorable but have since apparently been removed from the menu (I think they were stuffed with butternut squash). The only dish I have ever really liked is the Edamame Dumpling appetizer - if another friend of mine has their heart set on True Foods in the future maybe I will just have to get 2 orders of those. The decor is nice enough but the tables are too close together for my taste and the noise level inside quite excessive.  All together not a place that I will ever frequent again if the choice is left up to me.

Fm0UWm8a-3hwf-1QxcGrMw.text: Love this place! Never disappoints, salads are fantastic!  Try the chicken chopped and corn/eggplant pizza.

BTjavdEvMfCfsmWQ1wQaZw.text: Everything about TFK is awesome; from the vibe, to the drinks, to the food. This is one of the most unique concepts you will ever find. The food is very healthy, but so incredibly tasty. I recommend the Turkey Burger.

tlueXjJYIzZDEySH3fN3nQ.text: True Food has so much going for it - a well thought out menu, delicious flavor combinations, a killer kids' menu, and good service.    We've been many, many times, and have always enjoyed ourselves.  The Husband and I particularly like the menu coding system (vegetarian? gluten-free? you know EXACTLY what you can/can't order).  The mock-tails are deliciously refreshing... light, bright flavors that just taste good for you!  The Husband swears by the crudite appetizer... and even I, who doesn't always love the green things, really enjoyed it.  The curry dish is my personal fave, and the carne asada tacos are pretty darn good, too.  The kids' gluten-free pasta with red sauce, greens (kale??), and lots of cheese is enormous and totally worth the money.    A good stand-by place, especially when we're feeling like eatin' some healthy stuff :)

_DEvIXIHsubVlSiBQH5xEw.text: Loved the outdoor patio seating, the humus and Thai chili shrimp appetizers were really good, the street tacos were good and the apple crisp was excellent to be a "healthy" version of it.  The drinks were so/so.  I am debating between 4 and 5 stars, I am giving this 4.5 :)

wE9nDpIR5jyBnXD3ZSdMPw.text: Everything I have ever had here has been delicious. If I could drink the Kale-Aid every day I would. Have them put some jalapeno in it to elevate it that extra bit... yum! Service is very responsive, bringing extra silverware, filling water glasses, splitting checks and validating parking tokens. The only down side is that the restaurant is very open and it can get a bit loud during peak hours.

hUodN0X8_gP0ap3JXEg6hg.text: Great food, amazing concept, but poor wait staff. Expensive as heck for very very small portions. Like I said it's an amazing concept, concept meaning idea. The idea wasn't carried out to well though.

ptjYW5FXJd8mwmU1FpCUlA.text: This is possibly my new favorite restaraunt.  It's healthy eating, but yet it taste so good.  The Lasagna is my favorite dish.

kLaXrgWOgF4-nphL9_Mb6w.text: My family and I were visiting my sister over Thanksgiving, and we tried out this place for brunch.  I was impressed with everything about this place.  The food is delicious, but is uniquely creative and healthy.  The menu is filled with wholesome entrees, ranging from meaty to vegan, and all the options are tasty.  I ordered the tofu scramble wrap, and to my family's surprise it was the best dish ordered (although the quinoa jack cakes, the date-pistachio-espresso-banana muffin, and good ole scrambled eggs and turkey bacon were delicious too).  What tops this place off to a 5-star rating is the great ambience, with both outdoor and indoor seating options, the attentive and informative wait staff, and the innovative kitchen.  It is completely open to air, with the servers working at prep stations.  You can watch them prepare your food, or pull salmon fresh from the icebox to be cleaned.  Amazing.  If I lived in Phoenix, I would be here all the time!

5USC20fqTbkocIIDlFEjBw.text: Attended an amazing event in which Dr. Andrew Weil hosted and provided a wealth of fantastic information pertaining to diet, health and cooking.  I really hope something else along these lines might be presented again.    Luved all the samples of the new menu, which included smoothies, tofu breakfast wrap (surprisingly good!) pistachio loaf, yummy pancakes, and yummy granola & greek yogurt.    I appreciate that all their ingredients are upheld in very high standards, and they are being recognized all over, hence opening in other locations such as Scottsdale Quarter (will be much closer for me to visit) and in California.

zndiMqgEhNse0nS2FW23Lg.text: I had the shaved turkey pita and it was delicious. Our waiter was nice, we got our food relatively quickly and I liked the high celings and simple, but sophisticated decor.

jyZFMlIhY1NGPzzh9A7Eog.text: Yes...it's True, I found this place after devouring 8 Krispy Kremes over the weekend!  The visit was a detox! I searched for a place to dine where I would feel healthy and guilt-free after a weekend of indulgence, and I felt like I was dining with Bugs Bunny after I was served a heaping of fresh veggies...aka Crudites.  Then came the fresh fruit "elixir"...the Cucumber & Honey Lemonade...awwww  Oh, the Turkey Lasagna w/Spinach wasn't bad either.  The servers were friendly, and the atmosphere refreshing - like the drinks (non-alcoholic...this time) ;-)  Can't wait to go back!

3ljuWKunvu91r-RF4lSPVg.text: The kale salad is to die for! The wait can be horrible at times, but it is worth it!

yYFU9e6lSE9BzmyTrjWBPA.text: I'm back :) How many updates am I going to write? Well, it depends on how many times I visit. I spent another evening at True Foods last night with a group of friends.   The service was just a hint slow but what do you expect with a big group? The food was good, everyone at the table mentioned several times how happy they were with their entree choice.   My boyfriend and I ordered our own dishes and then split so we could try two of the entrees. I got the steak tacos and he got the chicken. Both were really good.   What we didn't realize was that True Food actually allows you to order half portions for half price. We could have tried 4 different menu items had we known this. Oh well, next time... and there will be a next time!!!

1Ue6FhtWoNnDA7tIDTCT-w.text: The menu has a little something for everyone and the kitchen is amenable to customization. I enjoy the fresh, local ingredients and the seasonal changes.  A nice selection of wines, coupled with organic cocktails and fresh juices are available.  Of course, the biggest draw is Dr. Weil's partnership, although if you've read his books there are some selections counter to his recommendations.  The inside is loud (and dark at night), but there is also outdoor seating that is much calmer.

ymTVo9KVVENqvzsB0_2BDw.text: sadly, they took the wild sockeye salmon lox off the menu.. *sniff sniff*  (but the spaghetti squash casserole i tried was a great alternative!)

fsnghDgc6Lw8GlQ0J_hbLg.text: WOW!  I am very sorry that it took me so long to convince Bri D. to go here.  We went for brunch and it was amazing.  Absolutely one of the best breakfasts I have ever had.  The johnny cakes were out of this world!  They have a granola-y taste to them, are filled with blueberries, and topped with yogurt and real maple syrup.  It is this awesome combo of sweet and tart that is great.  Despite being three pancakes, they weren't heavy and dense like normal ones.  They made me feel satisfied but not "stuffed" and gave me lots of energy throughout the day.  That's exactly what the awesome waitress said they would do.  I love this place!  It is beautiful inside, I love their theme, I love their concept, and I love the food.  Can't wait to try more.

shbU5NqeZtcuucWqu9RoWw.text: This place is a five star! Love the food! Love their drinks! My favorite drink is the red moon and i heard if you add vodka it tastes great! There's inside and outside seating. A great atmosphere and the food is just awesome and if you want healthy but tastes awesome then go here!

oTXauzxkqcqEQIc4rto6cA.text: I love to come back here for the refreshing drinks and for the pizza, so far I've been here often enough and their pizza doesn't bother my stomach even with the cheese. I am hooked on the cucumber juice and also their variety on desserts...will need to go back again, it's been almost a year.

Kalqt0-Kvbv_oizNw6mbBQ.text: Good for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Whenever I go, it's usually with vegan friends, and yet I am able to find something to fill me up. Great decore and atmosphere. Will return again and again.

zlygRtH-HyJjLBdAwNLNgg.text: True Food is awesome! It inspires me to dissect their recipes and try to cook like this at home.   True food offers a variety of healthy, delicious choices. We started with the Summer Chopped Salad with a nice, light but flavorful vinaigrette dressing. It was a good mix of greens, snap peas, strawberries, walnuts, and goat cheese. It was a good-sized portion for a starter salad.   I opted for the Spaghetti Squash Casserole with fresh mozzarella and tomatoes. I love it and saved the rest for lunch! My handsome dining partner tried the Natural Pan Roaster Chicken with asparagus, fennel, and farro. It was drizzled with a light sauce and was very tasty. The chicken was cooked to perfection.   So believe it or not, we had room for dessert and tried the Apple-Cranberry Crumble with dairy-free maple flavor ice cream. I should have skipped the salad and had two of these! We also tried the Lemon Cake with Strawberries and Greek Yogurt. That was also pretty good but then again I usually never disagree with dessert.   Other than the awesome food, the service was friendly and attentive. I love the decor as well. True Food Kitchen has an open floor plan (that never seems too loud) and a nice patio.   I would highly recommend! I've dined at True Food several times and have always left satisfied. On other visits, I've tried a variety of their cocktails and enjoyed them. The Teriyaki Brown Rice with Asian Veggies is also great!

jGK_OUj-E27qmm6U0M8HrA.text: Got the Ancient Grains Bowl with Chicken and it was soooo good.  The food was clean and I feel ready to rock! The service was great and we got the food quickly.  My wife got the Turkey Burger and she said it hit the spot. I recommend this place to anybody wanting amazing food and a super cool place to chill.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Got the Ancient Grains Bowl with Chicken and it was soooo good.  The food was clean and I feel ready to rock!

cHm0VJlaA9Hgg1gevJnkcA.text: Being out of town on a business trip, my co-workers and I were recommended to this place for lunch.  We got there just after noon and while fairly crowded, we were able to be seated quickly outside: we were a little apprehensive about eating outside, but the covered porch had misters surrounding the outside which kept it comfortable.  Our server, Michael, was very attentive and knew the menu backwards and forwards.  The five of us had a mixture from the margherita pizza, teriyaki chicken, turkey wrap, and chopped salad with chicken and it was all great. Our appetizers - the humus as well as dumplings - were a very nice start.  Get the honey lemonade as it was very good.  The food arrived fast, and we all liked how the food was prepared with an open kitchen the diners could see and appeared very clean.  The service was outstanding.  This was my first time to a True Food Kitchen and I'm ready to go back on my next trip to Phoenix or keep my fingers crossed one of these comes to the Houston area.  Give it a try as you won't be disappointed.

CkEWztI7hyLwcVh8Ld_V_g.text: Good and fresh! My turkey burger was a bit salty but still good. The squash pie was great.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ginger honey beer

L0QioBG2Hiff3yUWyYAueQ.text: This was my 2nd time at a True Food and this experience was really wonderful.  Our server explained the concept of anti-inflammatory foods in a way that was just right (not condescending, just really healthful.) while I didn't love the Kale-aid juice, I did like the concept of it-  I think it needed watermelon and a little less ginger/celery (too much bite) in this drink for my taste.    The food was mostly perfect this dinner!   I highly recommend the turkey lasagna!!! OMG.  Tender and cheesy but not too heavy.  The kids turkey sloppy joes was a hit too.  The Moroccan chicken was absolutely perfect-  crispy skin and juicy meat.   The only two real False notes:  an overly salty miso soup and a too dry almond butter kids sandwich (needed honey.)   Service was outstanding, especially for a busy night and our large party.   Can't wait to come back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey lasagna
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids sloppy joe
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moroccan chicken

mZ0hfCu2eLPH7O2PRm0wSA.text: So impressed!  So many options to choose from! It was hard to decide what we wanted. We ordered hummus appetizer, is was soo yummy. I liked that the pita a lot. It was on the lighter side.  Also ordered the curry bowl and added shrimp. It was AMAZING! My husband ordered the chicken wrap. He liked it a lot but liked my dish better. The skinny mArgarita was fantastic! Molly was our server and she was so great. Super informative, sweet and very attentive. I can't wait to come back and try some other things.

_e6lRAyKP6g3rbLCoohimw.text: Staying at the Camby and next door was the Biltmore Fashion Park. I wanted to try something new in Scottsdale. True food is not new but 1st choice of crepes didn't work out since they were closing in 15 mins.  The waiter was very welcoming and asked if we had been to True Food. I said yes in Houston.  He was cool this one is the original.  The food, decor, and service was good and consistent between the locations.  I got a nice light dinner of spaghetti squash casserole and was happy.

qxD8oy042fdcuxk5eiXnIA.text: I have been to this location several time and I still love it!  Lots of healthly selections and just love the atmosphere in the outdoor and indoor seating.  My favies:  the matcha lemonade (it is off the menu, but they can still make it for you), edamame dumplings, herb hummus, house-made chicken sausage pizza, flourless chocolate cake, and ice creams.  The service is always on par and quick.  Also nice and relaxing here.  This is one of my go to places!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cute pumpkin
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flourless chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream

KdeeJeJHu28NtPL86q1dAg.text: Showed up at this restaurant for a early dinner reservation.  Table for four people..  The restaurant was empty.   The hostess immediately tries to seat us at the worse location in the whole restaurant.   Should have known  When we were seated at a better table and we had ordered our dinner I had asked for one of the Poke Bowls.  Making sure to tell the waiter NO MISO or Salt on the dish (Sweet Potatoes especially)  Can't have soy and on a low salt diet..   The dinner comes out super Slow service.. and as I am starting to eat it--realize that it is salty/spicy and the Miso Glaze is on the dish.. When I tell the waiter he says--Oh I forgot to put that in the notes to the kitchen.   So I waited for my dish, while the others ate.   It came out correctly BUT nothing was done at all--we were on our way to the baseball game.. so I had to rush to finish my meal (we however missed the start) because of the mishap  (we showed up at 5 pm and the game started at 7 pm)   ridiculous      Will not go back again  and if you have food allergies.. I suggest you skip this one

smzXoiFqkFIHNjEt8u8rGg.text: I visited there for the second time to introduce this place to my husband and daughter. I took one bite of the kale salad which has grated cheese and noticed  movement. As I looked closer I realized that the kale had maggots. Let's just say we will not be returning to this restaurant ever again. I'm pretty sure this was not a one off incident either (at that location). I also found out that they store their produce in the same area as their trash. I let upper management know what I found and I also shared with them that other businesses at the Biltmore were aware that they keep wares and produce in the hallway area with trash. Very disgusted with this place. Many of you probably didn't even notice the maggots in your kale salad because you mistaken it for shredded cheese. Bon Appetite

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Maggot on piece of the Kale

J8LO8mv1w8gc5w4l2Hnkvw.text: Celebration dinner for 9 ladies.  They let us make reservations.  The table was ready.  Trendy decor unfortunately it was too loud in the big open room and hard to have converesations. They were willing to work with us on our adds and deletes to menu selections.  I added shrimp to an appetizer and it turned out being a great meal.  The wine pourer was very entertaining.

89csMQ4gOb3WZlrToHP7LQ.text: In Phoenix for the weekend and wanted to try something we don't have in Tucson! First of all, I would not be writing this yelp review if our server wasn't so incredible. We probably asked Rory 40 questions and he knew the answer to every single one. He was super personable and kept us entertained the whole time. We had the herb hummus to start and then we have the moroccan chicken and the brussels sprout and mushroom pizza! And finished with the flourless chocolate cake (10/10) with the vegan ice cream you couldn't even tell was vegan. 100% would go back again, and Rory made the experience for us for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

qix8mDf4Mlbi7MFYUgQTDw.text: True food is a definite staple if you live in the north Scottsdale area. I can't say enough good things about this restaurant. All of the servers are so nice and helpful and the menu options are not only healthy, but so delicious. True has become one of my favorite restaurants. I love coming here and sitting outside & it's such a bonus that they have pressed juices! From the salads to the homemade guacamole you can't go wrong. If you haven't been you should def go!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale / quinoa salad add sweet potato &amp; chicken

PWBWE3ovOdeKXp8erZUjcQ.text: Really enjoyed my recent experience at Phoenix's True Food Kitchen.  Got the Medicine Man natural refresher which has sea buckthorn, cranberry, pomegranate, blueberry, honey, black tea ($6).  It definitely was really refreshing and was not too sweet, I really liked it.  The Wild Caught Albacore Tataki was delicious, very fresh and light, a great choice on a hot summer night.  For my entree I had the Grilled Fish Tacos which were packed with a generous portion, definitely a very healthy take on fish tacos.  The fish was very meaty and tender.  Got to also taste the Moroccan Half Chicken which was delicious.  Loved the sauce and the chicken was just flavorful and juicy.  The Half Chicken is one of the heartier dishes on the menu and it tasted guilt-free and so tasty.  Would definitely have all of what I had ordered again in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

f-quCgqFNZ9t9ROMW0vJMw.text: I will say this place gets packed really fast.  I met a friend for lunch this day.  We skipped on the appetizers and went straight for the meals.  I ordered the grass fed burger and a side of fries.  I will say the burger was really tasty and fresh.  The fries were really good too.  I have had a lot of burgers in my time and this is one of the best.  I am not sure if it was buffalo or beef.  I had a buffalo at a different True foods location too.  It was excellent.  This is on the top 3 list for burgers.

mz5otI2jYtlA10LwkQQFDQ.text: This place is cute and seems to be loved by many. I came on a Sunday mid morning but I wasn't very impressed with the brunch menu though. I look forward to coming back for dinner perhaps

4B7j4RUhuocFjMBQURtHhA.text: Came in for lunch with a colleague on Friday. Ordered their non alcoholic sparkling green tea, which is phenomenal! Also enjoyed the salmon kale salad. Everything was good, but for lunch the timing seemed off. We were waiting a bit for the check and for boxes etc. They were pretty busy so no harm no foul, but if you're in a hurry keep that in mind!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xRg9bSG1Pgxr4ZqZWTsYRw.text: Love this place normally but tonight's visit was disappointing. There is a dish for any dietary requirement at True Food. The disconnect comes with the service. We came as a family with a young child. Had to request water twice. Had to request a non-breakable, lidded container for child's milk. Had to request a straw for my adult beverage that came in a tall glass. Please can we stop with the Straw Wars?! It gets old having to prompt the waiter to do a proper job. Appetizer did not come out first. Had to request child's plate to be brought out early since dinner, and ALL dishes, took over 30 min to arrive. Waiter didn't hang around to improve the situation. Service should be better and more tuned into the group's needs. No coloring menu for children either. Not the most kid friendly place. Disappointing night when I just wanted to relax & not cook.

mC1-ODUbWhKWqHjMgjKvqg.text: I'm generally a fan on True Food Kitchen, even though it's a chain. When I'm wanting a reasonably healthy salad on the road, they are a go-to spot. I've been happy with their salads in the past, and ordered their chopped salad tonight. While it tasted good, I was disappointed by a few things 1) the serving size has shrunk from the previous times I've ordered this salad. 2) for a $4 up-charge for chicken, they put on about 2 oz of chicken. Seriously? I didn't expect much, but at least give an acceptable amount of protein on a $20 salad (including tax/tip) 3) this is called a chop salad, but there is nothing chopped about it. The pieces of everything were huge, unlike most chopped salads I've encountered, and the spring mix wasn't chopped at all 4) the spring mix must have been old, because I got a number of bad pieces of lettuce. Yuck! Otherwise, the service was good and as I said, the food tasted good. I'd never been to this location, so hopefully it was just an anomaly and/or the way they do things in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. (Not so) Chopped salad with a very meager portion of chicken added.

mJ6MCBSSV1pkFG40gHrO1g.text: I used to give this restaurant very high marks based on the deliciousness of one particular dish (the Panang curry with chicken) and one particular cocktail (the skinny margarita). Both were indisputably top shelf. But lately, the service has gone downhill at this location, and they have also altered the way they prepare the dish (which one should never do when one has perfection).  Brought my daughter there last night for dinner and it was very disappointing. After taking our order, our waitress basically abandoned us. We had to flag her down just to get a spoon - never saw her again after that. Asked the server who brought the food to please bring a chopped jalapeno; she never returned and no one brought the item.  When it was time to pack up, we waited forever for some help, and when we finally got someone to attend to us, it took another century to get the process completed. I'm thinking it's a management issue, but I don't know what's going on behind the scenes there.   The Panang curry had a ton of green beans this time, no broccoli (the broccoli was one of the best parts), underdone potatoes, and just wasn't nearly as "soupy" as it used to be.   Sad - such a let down. I'll try the True Food over at Scottsdale Quarter soon to see if it's just an issue with the Biltmore location, or it's it's truly time to say goodbye to one of my very favorite meals in the Phoenix area.

TYbpZaZsTqwEBBVxAX70WA.text: Why is this place so amazing?! Seriously though, I can't get enough (my wallet can though). I love trying their different seasonal drinks, I haven't been let down yet! They have a really awesome kids menu which is always a plus since my toddler is usually our dining companion. They are extremely accommodating to food allergies. I can't seem to bring myself to get anything other than their kale salad but my husband has had their vegan squash pizza & he loved it! Love this place!

qMCOMYfjbS2xxvpjXUk25w.text: UPDATE: Returned there a few times since my last review. Definitely had more consistent quality. Could tell because I basically always order the same dish (yay ancient grains bowl). Had it with the delicious salmon once. My go to protein is the chicken. Also tried the sparkling antioxidant tea and it was just the perfect drink to go with it. Now I just have to try some of their other items. Or do I?

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ancient grains bowl with chicken and a sparkling antioxidant tea Across the table is the spaghetti squash with chicken sausage (bit salty)

azaDPXOhb0jw29ArCnbtGg.text: I received an email promo for free delivery so I decided to try them out.   I went online to place a delivery order. The website is ok but seemed to be running a little slow. One person in my group is on a special diet and asked if they could order two hard boiled eggs. I called the restaurant and spoke to a man who asked his co-worker who said yes. I asked how to place the order online for this special request. He said he had no idea and that he had never even been on the website. He said there should be a place to write in special instructions. There is not. The only place is during checkout and it's about the delivery itself. He put me on hold and transferred me to a woman who said they have eggs but only during brunch and only on the weekend. So I asked if it was possible to get two eggs and boil them. She said no.   So I continued my order online. There is the option to add protein to each item and a place check boxes for removing items, but there is no place to add special instructions to an individual item.   I placed the order at 10:52 am for delivery at 11:45 am. I received an email stating the restaurant had received my order. But a few minutes later, I received another email indicating that the order did not go through due to technical difficulties. The 2nd email said I would not be charged but to call the restaurant to see if they got my order. I called and the woman said that she didn't see the order come through. She said I could call back and talk to the manager to make sure I wasn't charged for the order. She said she could transfer me to the bar manager who could make sure they had not received my order.   Bar manager said they had not received the order. By this time it is 11:15 am and so I asked what my options are. He said that bcz the system did not send the order, that the delivery request would not have gone through either. He took my order so that he could give it to the kitchen so they could start preparing it. He said since I placed the order before the restaurant opened at 11:00, that is why it was kicked back to me. BUT that there was an algorythym that might send the order to the restaurant at a certain time before delivery (in this case around 11:20) and that could be why they had not received the order. He said I would have to talk to another manager about how to get it delivered since it would not have generated the request to be delivered.   I spoke with Izzy who said the whole system is new and she guaranteed that the first order was not received and my card was not charged. She suggested that I place the order again online to generate the delivery request. She would notify the kitchen that the order was coming. I was on the website as we were speaking and told her the screen said the current delivery time would be 50-55 minutes. She said that there was nothing she could do because it was on DoorDash's end based on availability of drivers. I asked if she could call me when the delivery person arrives to pick up the order and she agreed.   I also shared with her an issue for one of the items I ordered. Another person in my group has a severe allergy and she was helpful in alerting the kitchen and called me to clarify my request and offer alternative menu items.   After I placed the order with Izzy, I received a text from DoorDash indicating the driver was on their way to the restaurant to pick up the order. Even though they said the order didn't go through and therefore the delivery request was not generated, this was not True. The delivery request was generated with the first order because DoorDash was contacting me saying they were headed to pick up the order for 11:45 am delivery. I continued to receive texts about the status and once I received the notice the DoorDash driver was on her way, Izzy called to say they had picked up my order. The order was delivered around 11:55 am.   After delivery, I received a phone call from a woman saying she was from TFK, asking if my order had been placed and if I had received it. I said yes and she hung up. I received a call from a guy with DoorDash and he saw two orders come through and he was confused. He didn't know if I received my order or not. I said yes and told him TFK doesn't know how the online ordering/delivery process works on their end of things.   Overall, the food was fine but pricey ($19 for 2 fish tacos). It's great that TFK is trying the delivery service but they have a LOT of things to work out. I was dissapointed that Izzy didn't offer any recourse and I think a little bit of customer service could have helped the situation. I don't know that I will be ordering from them again in the future based on the overall experience. While Izzy was polite and helpful, it seems the staff could use more training regarding online orders and customer service (ie: no knowledge of the online wesbite, being told I can order an item but then cannot, etc). The website itself needs some work as does the process for online ordering.

g0UjN0Vd4Oafvfscbr5apw.text: Food was decent. But server dropped a plate of  fish tacos, and a bunch of it went on my lap. I was in business clothes for night 1 of a 2-week business trip... With beans and red sauce all over my best pair of dress slacks. All things considered, they barely apologized, cleaned up the walkway but left my foot sitting in a puddle of wet food under the table, gave me club soda only when they saw me scrubbing at my dress shirt. Didn't take any money off my total, or offer dry cleaning. When I came out, I had red crusty sauce down the front and both sides of one pant leg (no surprise as my pants were damp the entire meal, as well as the club soda over my shirt). And of course there was the discomfort of sitting in damp/dirty pants, shirt and shoes for 2 hours, and embarrassment of doing this in front of work colleagues...   Thanks for nothing. I tipped but probably should not have.

Bfk3lXiPmaXPrBsU2toOIA.text: My butternut squash soup and roasted cauliflower were phenomenal as usual . I am so happy there are so many vegan options ! Ashley was a fantastic server she is so personable and knowledgeable on the menu. The kale aid was absolutely wonderful this morning  it was gone so quick I didn't get a picture.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butternut squash soup
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7tPYPp236GGqP2SM7htXWA.text: I'm new in this area and since I came here I had bookmarked True food kitchen. This Friday my husband and I decided to go on a date night here as I'm a vegetarian - this place has a lot of options for me! Hubby ordered citrus skinny margarita (which we couldn't have beyond our first sip and thankfully was replaced by blueberry margarita which was so good!) and I ordered citrus colada which had a decent twist to the already amazing pina colada (I still love my pina colada as it is). The herb hummus was one of the best hummus I have ever had with a side of absolutely delicious and fresh pita - we couldn't help but order for refill which they didn't charge for. I ordered the inside out quinoa burger as I read a lot of positive reviews about the same - I somehow found it really bland with no flavor at all or maybe I just got unlucky. I had to ask for a side of sauce to finish my meal. The sweet potato hash side that it came along with was amazing! Hubby ordered the red fish ( recommended by the server) and found it average - I loved the baby potatoes that it came along with!  Overall we had an average experience nothing exceptional but the only reason our experience went from average to bad is because after we paid off the bill we realized it came higher than we anticipated- upon asking for the itemized bill we noticed that the citrus skinny margarita was still on the bill. The server apologized and made changes for the same but had we not checked...!   Also, the tables next to us had their candles lit whereas since we sat the server didn't even think of lighting the candle at our table.

iDPlId3s1Eh9miR6nAmBEQ.text: Ok, so now ,this really is my favorite , yes!! Edamame dumplings I cannot live without. A must!!

GuiAm9GKIWr18z7_UhOvJg.text: This place is amazing!!  I was visiting Phoenix for a quick weekend trip and found this place after perusing Yelp. Not only does this place have phenomenal reviews but it has plenty of vegetarian options for several people in our group. I made reservations on the same day (Saturday morning) and was able to get a table for 8. We were immediately greeted warmly after walking in, and were seated at a long table in a private seating area in the back. (What a nice perk!)  Drink: I got two cocktails both of which were well-balanced and delicious! They also have a great wine list and beers on tap.  Food: Given that we had a big group, I was able to try a couple of the dishes and I only have good things to report! Some of our table went with the Restaurant Week menu which were dishes right from the main menu. I opted for the Panang curry with Shrimp and it wasn't on the restaurant week menu. It was GREAT! Just as good as any other real Thai restaurants--the sauce was thick and flavorful with a good amount of spiciness. The edamame dumplings blew my mind! It was such an amazing dish that I would gladly take that dumpling over any traditional dumpling any day. My husband got the quinoa burger which he really enjoyed albeit a tad dry. The stir fried shiitake mushrooms were a delight and the pad Thai is a creative twist on the classic with a bright tartness.  Overall, a really great experience! Would try to stop by again if I revisit Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Panang Curry wig Shrimp
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cKzRoNeC1mGe_u2tWE_F4g.text: (Let me tell you why I love him)  'Cause he is the truth..... Said he is so real - And I love the wayyyyy, that he makes me feel.  And if I am a reflection of him....  Then I must be fly, ....'cause his light, ....it shines so bright, I wouldn't lie, no-." ________________  Ahhhh.  Leave it to India Arie to shed some light on this "truthful" dining experience.   ***So, are you in Phoenix and in search of a healthy dining experience?  ***Or, are you a fellow lard azz that overindulged last night while looking for a better way to feel better about last night's gluttony?  Well look no further my hungry Yelping compadres. True Food Kitchen is, VEGGIES DOWN, the place to be!!!  This modern, bright and airy location "brussel sprouting" within Biltmore Fashion Park, was a "beautiful surprise" recommended by another of my company's VP's and reluctant to make vegetarian food a dinner option, darned if my mind wasn't blown the heck away at sit down further proving that contrary to my theory...... "there's hope"!   In short, YEZZZIR!, the rumors are aLLLLLL True!  With an inconsistent menu that for the most part, changes daily (if not seasonally) I was pleased to find that EVERYTHING here is made from scratch.  #purify-me  From the vegan chorizo burrito down to the butternut squash pizza (....who knew?!!), sweet potato hash and kale salads - the result is a (....wait for it):            TRUTHFUL EXPERIENCE!   I'm in lovVVVe with the veggie platter!   Served complete with olive tapenade upon a bed of lettuce and additional produce it gave me "strength, courage and wisdom" - YET.....and as if none of this was enough I'm duly pleased to note that JUST YESTERDAY, ......Mizz Okra Winfrey herself took stock in this joint rendering it a worthwhile investment for both your health and YOUR WALLET!   TFK .....  Keep on, keeping on!!!   Those other wanna' be contenders just need to "get it together".

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. I&#39;d neVVVer have believed this was vegetarian if I hadn&#39;t tasted it myself!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The salad topped with olive tapenade was TO DIE FOR!!!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Isn&#39;t wine an integral part of the 4 (or is it 5) food groups???  Where is mine?!

wrs7_5ms50lr13li-4jIhg.text: Wow! Now that's was amaaaaazing! Thank You Megan for your top notch service. The menu from the drinks and appetizers all the way through to dessert was undeniably one of the best meals I have had out in quite awhile. I am so happy to hear they have a True Food Kitchen in Austin, Tx. I think we have found our new "go to" restaurant.

fvXIZvh2KNDgUun3B1X3-w.text: Went here for lunch with my daughter.  If it was just my lunch item, I would give three stars, but I ate half of her wrap and the appetizer.   Therefore, I am giving four stars.   If I could give three and one-half stars, I'd do that.  We started with the edamame dumpling appetizer.   Not bad.   Nothing spectacular but not bad.   The sauce was bland but the dumplings were good.  I ordered the cashew pad thai with added chicken.   Uhmmm.   I can't say I'd order it again.   I didn't especially care for the flavoring.   And the noodles could have been less cooked.  My daughter ordered the Mediterranean Chicken Pita with chicken, which is grilled flatbread, romaine, arugula, pomegranate, house pickle, red onion, feta, harissa tahini.   That one I definitely liked.   I liked the flavoring of the chicken, the crunchy texture of the pomegranate seeds, the feta, and the pickle was a nice touch.  The romaine was wilted but, oh well.   I didn't try the side of the kale salad.  I must admit, this isn't one of my go-to restaurants, but I'd go again when invited by those who want to eat "healthy."

ph25by-1kagks173MWDCEw.text: Sending off a good friend and mentor while passing on some good habits.   Spicy Curry Penang Shrimp  & Water Melon Lemonade   .  Service was great we had a very attentive waiter, and was very knowledgeable about the different options they provided.  Definitely recommend for work lunches, dates, and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

jpcTB1o47lxGPGkud9q8VQ.text: As a person who works really hard at keeping my weight in my goal range, I am constantly trying to find healthy restaurants that are truly healthy. I've been to some that promote healthy eating, yet they drown their food in oil and butter. The reason I love True Food is because it actually is clean eating! The kale salad is so fresh. The steak add on is lean and flavorful. My favorite thing on the menu is the crudite. It's raw vegetables and dip, but the vegetables are straight from the ground fresh, they use watermelon radishes, which I can't find anywhere and crave. I dream about their olive dip, which is creamy, tangy, and never oily. I also love their green juice!

rXrbavbxgTpz8BiBfkCiAg.text: I tried this restaurant several times, here are my impressions:  - There are some good and delicious healthy options, such as the Inside Out Quinoa burger and Kale Guacamole (appetizer) - Dashi ramen... salty. Pad thai... DON'T GET IT. Although the pad thai has some good intense flavors, I was disappointed with the texture of the noodle (hard and not soft like they should be) and the addition of meat is not worth it (+6$ = 6 medium-sized shrimps). - We had Inside Out Quinoa Burger and asked for extra onion from two different people including our waitress but it never came. Also, our sweet potatoes were burnt... - Sparkling Antioxidant Tea, Hangover RX, and Kale Aid (really sour) were tasty but nothing out of the world. - Interior was fantastic, clean bathrooms.  Give this restaurant a try if you feel like trying some unique, healthy foods. However, I recommend to stay away from dishes that you can get at places you know are good (Pad thai, ramen, etc.)

QPsSUvsfUM0VrYlObISUDw.text: True Food Kitchen has become my cafeteria of sorts as I go often for lunch and dinner. Full confession, sometimes I go for lunch and dinner. I try to be a healthy eater but I love great tasting food and I like to eat out. For someone like me, True Food is the perfect prescription. I frequent the Phoenix Biltmore and Scottsdale Quarter locations and both have outstanding staffs. I cannot remember ever being even slightly disappointed by the food or the service. At the Biltmore location, ask for Kaylee Duffy-- she's the best!

pHW41DYyZbVfdbKv7QVzTw.text: Update** I finally got my alcohol namesake! The Wild Orchid! I think if I were a drink- that would be my name. First off we were seated outside, which my bestie was extremely hesitant since it was 100+degrees outside..so happy to say that their outside patio is very pleasant and Cool. Win!! My Thai bowl was good- I'm new to this No Meat life, so I'm having chicken withdrawals. Chicken, which you have the option to add, would have made the bowl Great! Now to my drink. I was happy. I didn't want to get sloshed, because..hello..no one wants a d.u.i.! So my Wild Orchid was pretty domesticated. It was cool and refreshing. I felt very pretty drinking it. I couldn't bring myself to eat the flower like our waitress Tessa suggested. I'm not okay with eating art.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tlt. Tempeh, lettuce and tomato. The tempeh tasted like beef jerky. Get it if you&#39;re in the mood for a healthy slim Jim sandwich!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thai bowl.

k_Soft0_xy81E_fNKHQ7Bg.text: I always love coming here.   Jasmine Tea w/ lemon and honey   Vegetable Crudites   Soups (different every day, but always delicious)   I highly recommend True Food Kitchen for anything they have on the menu, when you want something healthy. I've tried just about everything and I've never ever been unhappy with anything! I LOVE TFK.

p2EqeazDjEkBrkkAEZzPRg.text: We decided to eat healthy one night this past week. But also something tasty and not meat. So after scouring the menu, we came up with Hummus to start. That was ok. For a main dish I ordered the Chicken Paillard. It was the best tastiest chicken dish I have had in awhile. It was both juicy and tender. If you go, try it.

oDhLr1IeVemkaj4uOctwkw.text: I recently did a cleaning eating diet that left me with very limited options of what I could eat, especially out at a restaurant. True Food Kitchen was on of the few places that had options that would work for me!  I was doing no alcohol, sugar, or caffeine so I ordered the Kale-aid! I wouldn't normally order this with dinner (it's more of a bunch item), but I really wanted something! I always order it without the celery (my least favorite vegetable...gross) and then I add turmeric. I find the taste to be quite good, and I say this as someone who isn't super into juicing or health foods.   For an appetizer, we ordered the roasted cauliflower.  This has got to be one the most flavorful things on the menu! It covered in a really yummy harissa tahini yogurt sauce and topped with dill (l love dill!) plus it has pistachios mixed in for some added texture. It's so good!  For my main dish, I ordered the spaghetti squash casserole. I was going to order it without out cheese because I was eating diary-free during this diet, but I "forgot." I'm soooo glad I had the cheese, it really made the dish. Without it, it would be very bland. I really liked my dish until I tried my friend's Lasagna Bolognese. Wow, now that dish was tasty!

-GDZjo5RSeU3lt7FdN1cEA.text: I LOVE coming to this True Food, I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to eat heathier! or enjoys fresh cooked food.They have so many options to choose from and the food taste great. Also, their service is awesome, I would recommend a server named "Alisha". She has great customer service and will guide you through the menu to get you the best meal suited for you. Thanks True Food and Alisha :)

e5cu9XoNjF-TzR8kggN8rA.text: Often packed and sometimes a wait but that is expected when the food is good. The food has always been wonderful everytime I've come here. At both locations. Here and Scottsdale.

5_HfAXZsG4wTwXtQgzWnBQ.text: Great service and food at the Biltmore Trie Foods!! Sooo good! And love the "green tea" to go!! As well the wait staff always seems to remind me of my parking token which I really appreciate!  Thank you

_txc6XaQYgp_QA2ySqyRJg.text: The roasted eggplant pizza was great.  The kale drink is super tasty and even my husband liked it (not enough to order one for himself though).  If your looking for tasty, well thought out "health food" this is your place.  Unfortunately my less than crazy about health food husband didn't like his burger so I guess this place won't give you the best of both worlds.  I can see a return trip in my future.

gj1CC5Mcjuu_Ufx5uOp6-w.text: What a wonderful place!  There was nothing on the menu that I wouldn't get along with.  It took me a while to decide because everything sounded fantastic.  I started with one of their fresh squeezed/blended juices (ginger, agave and soda).  It was light, refreshing and REALLY good.  Highly recommend this one.  I finally decided on the tuna sliders which comes with a side of kale salad or roasted sweet potatoes per the menu.  Our server told us that we could get it with 'half and half' sides.  So, of course, I went half kale salad and half sweet potatoes.  The sliders were good but the size of the tuna in each was not real consistent - the reason for 4 stars vs 5 stars.  Another person in our group also ordered the sliders.  For my two, one of my sliders had a really thin piece of tuna and the other one had about a 1/2 thick chunk.  The other order had different size pieces too - strange.  I usually don't order dessert but was really tempted by the 'stellar' Banana Chocolate Caramel Tart as described by our server.  'Stellar' was the perfect description for this masterpiece.  The chocolate crust contained mesquite flour which I found really unusual as I had never had it before.  We visited the Desert Botanical Garden and learned about the mesquite tree/shrub and the guide told us how they make flour from it.  Service was absolutely top notch FANTASTIC!  Our server was super helpful and knew that menu backwards and forwards and knew all the ingredients/spices in everything.   I wish we had this kind of a place in central Illinois!

6sosl2LYP7tAJOirejhU9g.text: Carry out order.  Quick service and polite staff. Ordered salmon; quinoa and arugula & beet salad.  Delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon; quinoa; arugula and beet salad.

Ir0K7GtuOzZvUx00QEwqZQ.text: The customer service was great as was the meal. I didn't feel like I was picking health over taste, as the food was both very nutritious and flavorful. I had the hummus and the quinoa burger and was satisfied with both. I just wish they'd have one on the west valley!

tPfcRoEcUnd8SIe7hLAlig.text: I had dinner last thursday at the biltmore location it was very busy but i waited for a server to take my order for 15 min and 1 hour for my food when it finally come to the table was cold we paid and gave 20% tip but i was very happy about it idk if ill gove it another chance to True food biltmore location

KVL6hYHBT95JprLz7Y9pFw.text: Table of 4 adults.... Spent $100 bucs and we all left hungry!!!  Super small portions. Sweet potato hash, bland and undercooked. Burger meat tasted good but was small. Tasted more bread than burger!!!  Wouldn't go back, would recommend paradise bakery or jimmy johns, subway over this place!!!

PlPNjIVKchGXPjje86BeIg.text: Oh how I love True Food Kitchen!  I met a friend here for lunch today and had a great experience.  We both started with a pomegranate limeade and enjoyed the spaghetti squash casserole...yummy!  Great atmosphere, professional staff and healthy, but super tasty food!

GgpJBNcczO1jjOXfF1IQxQ.text: Love, love, love True Food! Have been to the Scottsdale Quarter location dozens of times & have only been twice to the Biltmore location. Atmosphere is open, bright, clean, loudish. Service is always excellent! Gluten free pitas w/hummus (FAR BETTER THAN THE REGULAR PITAS) are to die for! Don't go here w/out ordering the gf PITAS!!!!!! Skinny margaritas made w/cucumber & basil are the bomb! Everything else is very good - always delicious!

2HnoM5dVu_MSQEH7vZX5hA.text: All the puzzle pieces  fit together. Great food, great service, and good atmosphere. I had the squash, sons had the chicken sausage pizza, and shriltaki  noodles, wife had teriyaki rice bowl. Chicken was a little dry on the pizza other than that everything else was good.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretty good place for aRed state

5PnwSZZTXXOVKrgV6FAg9Q.text: This place really hits the spot when I'm looking for something on the lighter, healthier side.  The chicken chopped salad is an item I CRAVE at least every couple of weeks.  I go frequently with my husband and we used to split a salad and entree (some notables are the Panang Curry, Teriyaki bowl, Street Tacos, Shaved Turkey Pita, and the Caramelized Onion tart) - UNTIL we found out you can order half portions of most of the salads and entrees!  It's fabulous!  I am usually there to try to get my week off to a healthy start, but occasionally we have gone on Saturdays during the day after shopping at the Biltmore.  Nothing beats their patio and the Skinny Cucumber Citrus Margarita!  Beyond the food, the service is always excellent- the waiters are friendly and knowledgable.  Just a great experience all the way around.
