RQlFOCcV_RombXG1bPbt-Q.text: Food is amazing!! The house chicken sausage pizza  is possibly the best pizza I've ever eaten! Also, the manager, Arianna was very accommodating. Great service great food! Highly recommend!

WninVdxos9blJGa46HVejw.text: Overpriced, tiny portions. Whiskey sour was good and the lasagne was alright. Decent atmosphere. I'm pretty sure the waiter had a fake accent.

bUUCjI-mGijvfZL0JC7g_g.text: Love this restaurant!  Food is fresh and prepared well. Wonderful flavor combinations for healthy eating. I also love that you serve Kombucha!  It's not common here in AZ.  Service has always been good here as well.

h5WjL3P9emLAbp31uv20xg.text: Wonderful service and always amazing food!! We had a friend visiting out of town and he wanted a pizza. They customized his pizza and also found a Sprite for him because he was not into healthy veggie or fruit juices. We had our usual Kale Aid drink and also tried the hummus Greek salad with gluten free pita bread with fresh cucumbers and olives. Sat outside on the patio which was a nice area for conversation and great weather!

yU5ch51Puv_CmmplJMY9Mw.text: They allow you to choose half portions which was amazing since we wanted to try many things. Creative dishes with friendly and attentive staff. They're also willing to make alterations to a dish depending on any allergies or preferences.

zZf3DuRte8qjFUikM7HAKA.text: This was the one place we wanted to try while we were out here in AZ. My fiance is a Dr. Weil fan and he had eaten at this restaurant many moons ago. He has since raved about the Kale salad here. A few years down the road I finally had the opportunity of eating here myself.  We had lunch one day and dinner the following day. For lunch I had their Street Tacos with  grass fed beef. They were delicious. Perfect size and very filling. Alongside that I had the Kail-Aid. It was very refreshing and had a nice ginger taste that lingered after every sip. My fiance had the Kale salad and added the Grilled chicken. The chicken was to die for. I had never tasted grilled chicken like that before.   The following night we enjoyed dinner here. I had the Turkey lasagna and my fiance had the Spaghetti Squash Casserole.  I LOVED my lasagna. It was hearty and rich, the flavors blended perfectly. I tried the Spaghetti Squash that was also mouth watering. It had a bit of a crunch to it, which I actually enjoyed. Again it was also very hearty and filling. We split a kale salad that complimented the rich flavors of our main entree.   Overall the food was absolutely fantastic here. The atmosphere is spot on. The service is perfect. I did not have a single complaint except that the prices are a bit high but you are paying for quality ingredients. Next time I want to try the breakfast menu. Can they please bring one to STL???

-VONNRJMesq-La0Iumgh8w.text: Yum yummy yum! The food is fresh and full of flavor. The freshly prepared juices were tasty and a refreshing change from usual soda or iced tea choices.  The atmosphere of the restaurant was a sort of fancy-relax. Dark but not too dark with splashes of bright colors and a well lit, visible kitchen.   The waitstaff and hosts were friendly and very helpful. They had quick service that didn't feel impersonal.   I will definitely be back to try more of their numerous vegetarian options.

MBUoISfvPaxpj5nUCaHVrA.text: This restaurant is not a good place for a vegan, or anyone that enjoys a relaxing atmosphere to have a meal. The selection is slim and what is offered is salty, bland and lifeless. This is a place that people either love or hate and let's just say I didn't love it.  You could get a vegan pizza at whole foods for cheaper and it's so much better than any of the food here. The waiter also took a long time to serve us and I didn't even go at a busy time it was 3pm on a Sunday.  This is one restaurant I will never be going back to.

rvxBVOiuAT4cHGGx6D3dtA.text: Food was good and atmosphere was nice.  Had the curry and it was a solid B.  Very good vegan and vegetarian options.

X0Yrlk2YoyPE8RilHU8RYA.text: Yet another GREAT Fox Restaurant Concept - actually probably my favorite of all of them!  My wife and I had dinner here on Valentine's Day with another couple.  They had an enticing prix fixe menu that we couldn't pass up.  The server was friendly, even though we were there right up until close, and the food was very good.  I had the Herb Hummus as an appetizer and the Steak Tacos for my entree.  The hummus was delicious.  The tacos were also very good - I would have them again - but they fell apart very easily, which was a bit of a turnoff.  More than anything, you have to appreciate a mainstream restaurant like True Food dedicating itself to using seasonal, locally grown, organic food as much as possible.  That alone will make me return for another meal soon!

XiYZ4Wkcaamw51mOBPsiWw.text: I would give their kale salad 5+ stars.  Its amazing that they were able to find a way to make kale irresistible.    The drink menu also looked great.  I had a really great green tea drink which I really enjoyed.    The reason for 4 stars?   My main dish, the green tea soba noodles, was pretty unimpressive.  Also the service was pretty bad.  They mean well but they just didn't have it together. Our food took forever to get out to us.  We would have to ask 3+ times to get water, our check, etc.  I will most definitely return here.  For the kale.  Yum.

qcalIc-Y6OFHY-g_4I5R8Q.text: This is my new favorite Phoenix restaurant. I'm not good at commitment (don't tell my wife), so I'm the guy who asks waitstaff for recommendations. When I couldn't decide, she offered me two half portions of a salad and some curry thing. Loved both! The lemonade is tasty too!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4Ina4ypt1hvzVfKji-KQ1w.text: As soon as you sit down - you can only help but feel healthy. They get a big thumbs up for interior decor and A+ on the service - very attentive from the door welcome to the check. I am trying to low-carb these days (post holiday!) so I ventured straight to the salad section - although I did notice the pizzas, sandwiches and lighter fare on the menu. I will definitely be back to try other menu items. I can only say that Fox Restaurants can never steer me in the wrong direction it seems - CHEERS!

aJa55rPoTmZtLtrGtJ2WxQ.text: The menu changes with the season. I have food allergies and the wait staff is always helpful. The pizzas are great, the salads are transcendental. The lemon bars are amazing.

2PWYKpm-bLfupzA9vK-HGA.text: We eat here all the time. So far in Phoenix it has our favorite Turkey Burgers. I love the way everyone is in same color uniform, super clean and excellent food. Amazingly well-run restaurant. They also have muffins that make you wanna slap your mamma.

FIrvt7JKX9ltwlzXXv8KRg.text: I'm giving it 4 stars to start...they will have to work for he fifth star but they will get it. Sam Fox borders on "genius" and True Food is another masterful creation. The look...it's brash, fresh and it erased 5 years off my age. The vibe....well knows how to get the buzz in the community. Bathrooms....well he takes attention to detail about as far as you can take it at this point. By the way, True Food looks like it defies the recession and rightfully so. Positive Vibe. Kudos to you Sam.  Oh yes, the food. Well, it's a "healthy" offering, so I thought...could taste like so much of healthy food, bland, boring and I usually have to go to Jack in the Box and order 2 tacos to feel full. This is NOT case. I had the Turkey Burger. It was downright astonishingly flavorful and filling. The turkey was zestful and spicy. I was pleasantly surprised. Add to that, the side salad with Tuscan Kale....like a first kiss. Anyway, will be there for dinner this week and the fifth star is probably earned on that trip. Again, Sam....you had me at "hello".

xUzOxKRGufEHPcrsS8ryyA.text: Ingredients are fresh. Service is pristine.  The tofu and bean dish with brown rice was aright.  I liked the pineapple drink I had.  Wasn't a big fan of the zucchini baked pasta though. Its long thin sliced zucchini instead of pasta, and the texture just isn't right.  On the pricy side but most of it seems healthy. I guess I can't have both health and taste.

sSXThyvGktnFHoSZlSHzIQ.text: If you're willing to run out for lunch a little early, enjoy the lively patio atmosphere will dining on yummy vittles. A When-Harry-Met-Sally picky eater, I, um, grilled the waiter on seafood's sustainability and ingredient origin, and he was good-natured and knowledgeable. A perfect eatery for a casual date or girls' day out.  Yay!

xhbmx3fZH_h1Hfur6eBNzw.text: Come on guys this place deserves a 1 star!!! service sucks !food sucks!! we paid $60 for two people and left not satified. Even my 100 year old grandma makes better food!!!

A1wxzYtzglIKwl-6kIjcWQ.text: Some pictures and brief descriptions of our breakfast: donidexter.com/blog/?p=1... Knew what to expect, having been here once before. This time though we went for breakfast on a weekday. Breakfast is "casual" as the host kept saying, substitutions are not allowed since we were told that dishes are prepared in advance. You order and pay at the counter for breakfast. Service was spotty, once seated you are left alone and some parties were noticeably frustrated not to get any table service. The breakfast menu, like the regular menu, had some vegan options which were clearly marked on the menu. The vegan smoothies were refreshing, well balanced in terms of flavor and nutrition and the perfect size. These were the highlights of our meal. We had the Green Monster (Apple Juice, Carrot, Kale, Cucumber, Olivello) and the Morning Glory (Apple Juice, Strawberry, Coconut, Banana). The food was forgettable, nothing stood out on any of our three plates but we still left full without the discomfort of a heavy meal. Pros: Correct portions, which leave you full and satisfied without being uncomfortable The food is fresh and simple Nice, clean, simple build out in a space that isn't crowded and large enough to accommodate the crowds Cons: Service is unremarkable The food can be a little plain to the point that you find yourself reciting the line "it's healthy" when prompted for your opinion.

CUTG3CkEB1uAMQ-46PSWSQ.text: Tried the Sashimi salad and fell in love. Love this place, so many options for veg-heads. Great wine list too!

m24Hrrim6uyzjkmUCnFIJQ.text: Another one of the fabulous culinary masterpieces of Fox Restaurants. Went here for dinner on a Thursday night with the BF. The 25 minute wait for a table was well worth it, even though we had scoped out the neighboring competition. The concept is inspiring and the food options excite my taste buds. I am willing to pay a little extra for healthy, sustainable foods- it's the San Fran in me.  We started with the sashimi tuna salad. Loaded with fresh veggies, generous amount of tuna mixed with a light and zesty ginger dressing.   Our main dish was the spaghetti squash casserole which they split for us half with chicken and half without for me, the quasi-sporadic vegetarian.  For dessert, the flourless chocolate cake was delightful. Although, I should have ordered my own to avoid the vulture-like antics as we both inhaled every scrumptious morsel. My learned sophistication reminded me that licking the plate is unacceptable.   Bottom-line: I would come back for the atmosphere, service and ostensible bio-dynamic food!

jN4U66ytbHyR9wxvyNKszw.text: I had a very adequate experience at True Foods at the Biltmore location. I went here with my fiancee and two of our friends as it was the best option in town to meet a variety of dietary needs. We had kosher, vegetarian, and sustainable eaters in the group. I did like the decor though at points I was worried about the sturdiness of my seat at our table.  The service was very sweet and friendly if a bit slow. I would in fact say our service was almost too bubbly and happy. Enough that we were slightly weirded out by it. However, if you really are that happy then I guess good for you.  As to the food, we ordered several appetizers, entrees, and dessert. My fiance found most of his food to be the better end of ok. I did try some of his items and I must say they all begged for just a hint of salt. Our friends loved everything. I had a mixed bag. My drink was very nice, I had the Green Arnie which was nice if a little subdued flavor wise. I also ordered miso soup to start. That one was a bit of a surprise. At no point on the menu or by the server was it mentioned that it was a red miso soup. For those of you unfamiliar, the kind of miso soup you get at most places is a white miso. Red miso is much stronger and more pungent. While I am do like both it was not what I was expecting. I would not have ordered such a large potent bowl of red miso if I had known. I then had the Wild Ahi Sliders which were really the best part of my whole meal. The fish was fantastically fresh and delicious. I did not partake of the dessert.  Overall, the food was goodish. Though I did spend much of the evening wishing I had some salt for the potatoes I got. Not a lot just a pinch of something. Otherwise, they were fairly bland. My fiancee had the same complaint. Everything could have used just a pinch more flavor.  Nothing was bad or anything the whole experience was simply ok. If it had been significantly cheaper and the service had been more prompt I probably be willing to boost it up to 4 stars. However, the portions are kind of small (other than the miso soup) for what you pay.  I would come here again with some of my groups of friends with needier dietary restrictions but otherwise I don't believe I will be frequenting this restaurant.

L2SU9sX2JlWHZmICCUMHfg.text: Absolutely nothing to complain about with this place! Service with a smile & delicious fresh food. Price about $25-30 per person is comparable to any nice place (esp in this area). I'm not sure about the issues with portion sizes, I had the roasted chicken and it was plenty. Also had the pomegranate sorbet - soooo good.

H8UgIVfT1iRxcvqs61kcPA.text: overpriced fusion food and i know we are all just paying for their rent.  It was obviously a nice place to go on dates because when we were there that one night, there were about 6 couples around us.  So it's a nice place to go to for a clean, quiet meal. Since the portions arent big, there's plenty of room for dessert.  The drinks are nice and refreshing though.

WCDRyxFSxpKFycztIH3eew.text: I've been here now not once, or twice, but thrice. My first impression is still correct: I love True Food Kitchen.   After the first time I went, I came home to Yelp about it, read some other reviews and hesitated, thinking that perhaps I had overlooked things. So I went back. I still loved it. But then I went again just to make sure. And, yup, still delicious.   The pita and hummus was simply amazing. I'm kind of a hummus snob and was surprised how much I liked it. I liked the pizza with shrimp on it. I liked the beef tacos. I liked the salmon sandwich, I liked the turkey wrap, I liked how the kitchen seemed to spill over into the dining room. I loved how open and airy it felt. Like other people have said, it did feel like L.A. But that's not always a bad thing. In the three times that I've gone I thought there was both image and substance.   There were a few items on the menu that I had no clue what they were. I had to ask. The portions are not huge, but I found them to be quite filling. I always get one of the delicious and refreshing drinks too. I like the one made from the blood orange and the one with lots of ginger in it. There was not a hint of chemicals or fake sugar in them, just natural food, the way I like it. Refills would be nice though.  The prices were a little higher, but not bad. I thought the food was flavorful and delicious. I would take people I like here. Heck, I'd even take people I don't like here.

LAEhlSTDznqT6JAh1brcrg.text: I guess I prefer False food. After three visits, the juices are the only items that impress me. The edamame dumplings are bland; so is the soup - I cannot even remember which soup I had, which is not a good commentary on its memorability. The ravioli - OK, The fish - OK. I haven't had anything at TF that deviated from "OK", but for the mid-level prices I expect something a little higher on the tasty meter.   Service has been fine all three times I've visited, but nothing above what I expect for pleasant and expedient service. I always find myself distracted by the women servers' uniforms...I know it's supposed to be some organic cotton or something, but could they have come up with anything less flattering? I really feel for those poor ladies.   I've also noticed that every time I've visited the crowd is about 75% women, with probably 50% of the parties women-only. Not sure what to make of that, but maybe you can have fun playing sociologist and come up with an explanation.

-fIWxy_XinX04fImaliS4Q.text: Had the  pan seared halibut.  The portion is a bit small but the food is great.  Also had the acai mojitos drink.  The drink wasn't so good.

rorQvEUyEbK4mYF9mdoWzQ.text: I'm a fan of Dr. Weil, so when I was looking for a place to go and found out through Yelp that he owns this restaurant, I had to try it out.  I was very happy with my experience.  The ambiance was cool, and the food my friends and I ordered all came out great.  I ordered their Kale salad, and it is pretty amazing.  I liked it so much that I looked it up online after and have been making my own version at home.  The service was good as well.

G5MwD1kuTAifh2oVSo1P3g.text: I can't get enough of this place! Everything I have tried on the menu is absolutely amazing. The food was seasoned perfectly and the drinks were mixed well. I love the ability to never feel full even though I ate too much...

5h14MZ64SWO2cLslg10j0g.text: If today was my first time at True Food Kitchen, I would probably give it one or two stars only, but because I've been there a few times, I have to give it more.    I went for breakfast today and the service was just terrible.  We ordered coffee to drink, and the cups sat empty for almost the entire meal until we were able to flag down another waitress.  Same case for the syrup for our pancakes, and we were one of four tables there... that's just not acceptable.    But the shining star is the food- I just LOVE the food here.  I've been for every meal and there is always something I love.  The quinoa blueberry johnny cakes are wonderful for breakfast and the salmon is great for dinner.  I also love their elixir's- the green arnie and cucumber refresher are my faves- super refreshing!!   If you're going to try True Food, and I definitely think you should, I suggest going for dinner when the service is so much better!

bXmng4EI2NzeagFlJOomrQ.text: Been here a few times, love this place because everything is so healthy and natural, their freshly squeezed kale juice is amazing, and really love their quinoa salad, this place is a bit too loud and pricy but quality is really good, oh and their fish tacos are really good too!

mYW-Md03U_TBbVdChGNptw.text: Good food, although portions are small for the price. The street tacos were very good but not enough for dinner. Could use some fizzy beverages that don't cost a fortune ($4.00 for watermelon water?). Nice setting and great outdoor patio with misters. Love coming here.

cbXRW8XUY2oGlgrufmdnUg.text: I over-hyped myself on this one. Chris and I liked our lunches while the less healthy eaters amongst us were not impressed. Service and decor were fabulous, and I felt good knowing I was eating well but something was missing. It's no Chaco Canyon (Seattle), but it's no Chez Panisse in a mall either. Maybe it just needs to blaze its own trail for a while.  If I lived close by, I'd certainly meet people there for lunch but maybe not worth going out of my way for, and I'm a HUGE Dr. Weil fan.

FXrCWpn_oM3PCklkUVV1Lw.text: My fav place to eat. Great food and service, can't go wrong with anything here!

GYPxR8kMhWOa_k-z115Zeg.text: Great food and great service. I had the half sized kale salad and pizza. It was great!

KGzp59_WxcU73-H0DtZsAA.text: Of course, everyone was likely on their best behavior the night a friend and I tried True Food because Dr. Weil was sitting at the table next to us.  So the service we experienced could not have been better...and I love it when food is served "complimentary."  Love it.  To tell you the truth, I do not remember the prices, I remember the food.  I loved that the meal and pairings choices were different, and I have never had better fish anywhere.  It was so wonderfully flavorful!  The restaurant is clean and sparse, yet beautiful, and not pretentious by any means.    I will return!

mEyBSZePEXKVC_Zfz_3O5w.text: I have been a bit absent from Yelp as I lost faith with some hidden reviews but I choose one of my faves in Phoenix to return with a review. True Food has added a wonderful roasted veggie salad to their menu with a horseradish dressing that is bursting with flavor! Their shrimp curry bowl is very good but lacks spice. For a beverage, you must try the Medicine Man. It's an antioxidant pomegranate/black tea based elixir that tastes like a vacation.! The only reason I don't give 5 stars is the dismissive server attitudes and sub-par service we tend to receive. Overall, I highly recommend!

xDF8GtGXhD-riD0f6wLFCw.text: 4 of us arrived on a Friday night, and the place was hoppin'.  We were seated promptly after a 10 minute wait, and since it was Friday night, it was time for a beverage! I started out with a blood mary, and it was great!  Followed that up with a skinny margarita, which was tasty in my book :).  Appetizers: onion flatbread and dumplings.  The dumplings came in a great broth, but the onion flatbread was awesome! Really thin, almost cracker like crust!  Sides: Kale salad - my friend raved about this dish, but I thought it wasn't anything special.  It definitely looked and tasted healthy, interpret that how you will.  Entrees: grilled salmon -- this dish was really tasty! could have used a tad more seasoning, but it was perfectly cooked. I really enjoyed the arugula salad that accompanied it, and the terrific crunch from the pomegranate seeds.  Dessert: The four of us split the cobbler, which was topped with a non-dairy ice cream.  This was surprisingly not bad, especially the ice cream! Great textures.  Overall Food: Good "healthy" food, try the salmon and the onion flatbread.  A little pricey, but that's necessary for organic, farm-raised, etc.  The four of us + tip was $150 +.  Environment: it was LOUD, we almost were screaming at each other to be heard.  The decor is modern casual.  Service: Our waiter was fabulous, she definitely lives the Dr. Weil lifestyle.

aaCBsdlCLh9HV-gX7UnriQ.text: This place has all the amazing potential in the world. It's a cool concept and I certainly appreciate the plethora of vegetarian and vegan options they have available, but I gotta say: bland, boring, blah.  The hummus was good, but certainly not the "best in the valley" as our waiter purported. I ended up adding salt.  My "LTL" (veggie version of the BLT) was very bland. I added salt and that didn't even help. My bread was slightly burned and the potato hash that they gave as a side was cold, limp and you could tell it was burned during the cooking process.  The vegan pizza was also pretty boring. It was a combo of olive oil and red sauce. They could have spruced it up with some spices and made it really flavorful, but it definitely left me wanting for more.  I appreciate the charcoal water filtration system that helps eliminate "water bottle waste" but I don't know that charging $2 for the table is necessary.  The honey lemonade was good but gave me a tummy ache, and the nojito just had way too much going on (honey, lime, ginger, soda water, etc).  Our service was good, if not a little overbearing, otherwise I would give this place 2 stars. The food is boring and extremely overpriced. Our casual lunch turned into $50, and there was no alcohol involved.  I am all for health and I support the cause, but they really need to do something about the taste of the dishes.

uFMGf9f_kvvDp5FtKM1vGw.text: Ive been here 3x. First time, I had the organic ricotta ravioli. Which was quite good, but oh so salty. Almost unbearably salty, and I am a salt-loving girl. I had a hard time finishing it.   The second time, I had a a pretty bland salad that doesnt even seem to be on the menu anymore. I wonder why.    Third time, I ordered steak tacos.   I keep coming back because I want to love it. As you can see though, I havent found something worth ordering twice yet. Bad sign after 3 visits.  I ordered my tacos well done and another server brought them out. They were medium-well which was totally fine with me and I was about to start eating them when our server suddenly appeared, said something about them not being well done, and stole the plate out from in front of me without even giving me half a second to make a decision, and then took it back to the kitchen. When it returned, the steak was kind of chewy.  I guess Im just used to the high quality meat we use at home? The beans that came with it were...just okay.  The honey lemonade was too sweet. I had about 1/3 of it and couldnt handle the rest.   My mom ordered a soup (not the miso) and it smelled great but tasted...flavorless. *SIGH*   I'll probably give them one last try before I call shenanigans on the whole joint.

IwTn6QoLBvnO8MluAqU52g.text: I went here for a birthday celebration - for ME of course! It was excellent! Our server was completely fantastic, and even though I really disliked the drink she recommended (the honey lemon ginger with rum), her upbeat attitude was totally worth it.   I'm #glutenfree and went with a pescatarian/no-cow-dairy-eating-person, so we are a match made in heaven for horrible ordering. I ordered the spaghetti squash casserole. She ordered the shrimp goat cheese pizza. I love the menu, because it spells out the ingredients (which are all pretty simple - the whole appeal of the natural hippie simple recipe theme) and lists if it's vegetarian and gluten free. The casserole was SO delicious, I would totally go back once a week to eat that! My girlfriend's order came back with cheese on the pizza, although it wasn't listed. The waitress gladly remade the pizza and apologized. See, I told you she was great!   They also serve Dos Cabezas wine here - a fantastic winery in Sonoita, AZ. I suggest you get a glass when you go there. They are fantastic people and I love supporting local wineries! I had the rasberry sorbet for dessert and the pomegranate seeds really took it to a whole different level.  This place is brilliant, but I'd love to try it again to see if everything else is worthy of five-stars. I hope that the rest of the wait staff is as awesome as the server we had. It's not cheap by any means, but it's worth it if you want TRUE food :)

yY5Dn7Dq1j7wdbf6kwptEA.text: Found this on the second to last day of my stay in Tempe and went right back on my last day. Pretty much everything about this place is good (except that it is a Fox undertaking . . .) The Prosecco was delicious and came in a beautiful glass, the kale salad was amazing (though it was a bit more lightly dresses on the first go around, which was in fact, better), the gazpacho was decent, the squash casserole was cheesy goodness, the farmers market salad was simply good all around, and the flourless chocolate cake was soft and chocolatey on the inside but overdone-brownie-like on the outside. Though I did not try it, they offer a gluten-free pizza - hello! Would definitely come back.

UuPBnNwMsCoT1QotnvY6Cw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in the valley, and my husband agrees!  Today I had the TLT (Tempeh, Lettuce, and Tomato) with a side of steamed Kale. AWESOME! (Although next time I will ask for no mayo, and was that parmesean on the Kale? Delicious, but I avoid dairy, and try to eat vegan.) Omni hubby went vegan with the steamed vegetables and farro (wheat berries).   A few months back, we had Sunday brunch there, and I had the scrambled tofu and soy chorizo wrap, which was also very good.   My only complaint is the popularity of this place means that there is a wait for lunch, even on a 115-degree day. Also, because of the utliltarian kitchen decor and the crowd, it can be noisy. But the food and the service will keep me coming back.

kOxr3XBlYOAf-VdplkfhrQ.text: I love to go out to dinner or lunch or really any meal. It makes that meal a little extra special. As much as I like making a meal into something special, I literally crave to go to some place and feel like I haven't eaten something that just added 20 pounds to my stomach. True Foods did something that I have rarely experienced, I walked out not only feeling not heavy, but feeling better than I walked in.   I admit, I like the unhealthy, bad for you, nasty, ginormous amount of calories, full of not so good for you food. I fully admit to that. I like that good tasting but not nice to your body stuff. I do, however crave something that is a little on the healthy side. Nay. I crave that even more! I would love to go to a restaurant and say, lay some thing in front of me that doesn't weigh me down! Slide me something that will soothe my hunger and tease my taste buds in to nirvana. Yet, that place is such a perplexity of possibility that I rarely ever find it.   Then I come to Phoenix.   A client suggested that on a recent trip to Sedona, when I had a little layover in Phoenix, I slide on over to True Foods. I am a fan of Dr Andrew Weil. I think and feel his philosophy of eating things that are nutritionally sound is quite up my alley many times, and when my client told me about his place, I knew I had to venture forth in to the great unknown to me of Phoenix and have lunch.   Parking, I did so in the back. Need I place myself among such fancy schmanzy cars up front? Nay! I am fine rounding myself around back. But then I nearly stumbled in. Weary from the two hour drive I just slaved over, needing sustenance that would not only revive but rejuvenate my wilting body. Holla! I made my way to the bar for refreshment and refreshing meal. I sat down, about ready to gnaw an arm or two off when I saw the enlightened menu. So many choices, such little room for all of it. I had to choose wisely. I started off with a green nojito. Refreshing indeed! Certainly my taste buds as well as my body were singing high praises!  I settled on a certainly reserved lunch. the Teriyaki brown rice stir fry with chicken. Exciting? No. But it was damn good. Avocado, bok choy and spinach with tender pieces of chicken. Hello! I could have munched all day on that, but to do so I needed a little more drinky drink. Off to the green Arnold, more tea that I thought but the final product placed a happy smile on my face.   What threw another smile on my face? The friendly and smiling service I got not from one, nor two, but from three separate staff members. Nice. I like.   The price was fine, nothing I wasn't surprised about, but really when I left I not only felt good, I felt great. I felt like I was energized and ready to go. Honestly that is a hard thing to find when I eat out. Rumor has it this place is expanding. Um suggestion? Chicago would love to embrace a healthier eating lifestyle, okay... I would love, no LOVE for you to expand out my way. I would fight Andrea R for a spot for first in line, but I know I would win. I can elbow harder.  Okay... I can... but I would be happy to be second in line just as I had a place to have some place healthier to eat.

opsDA_b4yA3rakcetO4tJQ.text: Wow, I really am disappointed that it took me so long to come here.  To be fair though, I didn't want to try it until I read their breakfast menu, where practically everything looks delectable.  In any event, we have been here for breakfast a couple times and I have enjoyed it immensely both times.  On our first outing I got the blueberry quinoa johnny cakes and the mango/pineapple (or something like that) smoothie.  The johnny cakes were so good and so filling.  It was served with REAL maple syrup and complemented beautifully with a dollop of greek yogurt.  There was way too much for me to eat and it kept me energized and full for hours.  The smoothie was wonderful too, but a little pricey.  The second time I went with the 2 egg breakfast that came with turkey bacon and sweet potato hash.  The eggs were surprisingly greasy compared to all my other stuff.  They still tasted good though.  The turkey bacon was surprisingly good to me, and I don't usually go along with "substitutes" like that.  The winner of the plate was definitely the sweet potato hash.  There was some seriously awesome caramelization going on in there and the potatoes were perfectly sweet, only made better with a little bit of salt.  After my two visits have clearly shown me that healthy food does not mean bad tasting, I am much more inclined to try this place for dinner sometime.  I am also intrigued by the philosophies of the co-founder Dr. Andrew Weil and I would like to experience more of it through the culinary delights at True Food Kitchen.

mXWSbq1Cd46avvOx1VJ5BQ.text: I am seriously in love with True Foods. I can't afford to go all the time because it's very pricey but the food is amazingly delicious and extremely healthy. They have awesome drinks. I always start with the vegetable crudite. It's a nice bowl of yummy vegetables served with two sauces. I had the albacore tataki which is good but cost about the same as my huge bowl of veggies. I have had a couple of their salads which of course are so delicious that I am drooling as I write this. My finance got the street tacos which he thoroughly devoured but after we left, he was still hungry so portions are small and the price is large. We had two desserts, I don't remember what they were called but his was a lemon bar or pie of some sort. He loved it and I had a berry cobbler with frozen greek yogurt. Yum!!!

aSeAgZBW66g5A8BvxaDnJQ.text: Whenever I come back home and visit Phoenix, this is the number 1 restaurant I want to visit. A ton of healthy (actually healthy, not fake healthy like many 'organic' food restaurants), creative options that are extremely tasty. Always have great service; every, single time (out of a dozen or so visits). Servers have unique personalities.  A little expensive (not too bad), but worth it if you want tasty, healthy food that is a little special, but not so rich that you fill sick afterwards. (healthy, fresh food can be expensive, even if you cook your self)  I've enjoyed everything I've tried, but I especially recommend:  Edamame Dumplings (like edamame ravioli with truffle oil; so delightful and light) Turkey Bolognese (filling entree if your hungry for brown rice pasta) Crudites: Perfectly al dente veggies  Salads: Liked all of the ones I've tried!  Enjoy!

Iw1vOmzhB6GSfxVCWi9FNg.text: Yum! Clean, fresh vibe to the place. Wonderful veggie options and adult beverages?! A rarity for veg friendly restaurants in the valley. Only complaint is the seating. I hate being in the middle of the room and most of the seating leaves you feeling exposed.

MBBDFyGW6xtkvD6Uw1WFRA.text: We have been eating at this location for some time and love it for the most part. Some times the food is better than others, but they do seem to keep it clean and balanced as possible. They'd get 5 stars if their dishes included meat and fish that are clean and natural instead of any of the farm raised refuse. Their 100% grass fed burger meat is seemingly the only good animal for us to eat there unfortunately.

OqKNoPvFXTlcGwqrxuWuOQ.text: This place is a health food nuts dream come True. Not my first time at this location nor other locations. This is however my favorite as it is at the biltmore, nice ambiance and friendly staff. Our server was very nice and friendly, and made lots of good suggestions. I started with a pomegranate chia limeade which was very refreshing and surprisingly delicious. For my meal, I ordered the seasonal ingredient salad. This was very very very tasty. The ingredients were Brussels sprouts, cauliflower, butternut squash pomegranate, white beans and the surprise ingredient, toasted mulberry all mixed in with horseradish vinaigrette.  HOLY molly this was a great salad. The one disappointing thing in this meal was the portion comparing it to the price. I hope they increase it as I loved every bite of it and would like to try it again when I go there.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The seasonal ingredient salad.

yzJTqoAdGrr3lBT0jd5mRA.text: I have been here on a weekend and even though it was crowded, the staff were very friendly and detailed. When you are seated, they immediately ask what you would like to drink and will wait for you if you are not ready. The inside of restaurant is unique and matches with the cuisine they serve. I had the farmer's market crudites and grilled salmon. I liked how the salmon was nicely presented and well seasoned.

EeE3ZHzyQcmLOpEmWqVfVw.text: If I could give it 10 stars I would. Starting with impeccable service. Gina and Chris at the counter.  Supercool place. All fresh. Love the prep on the main floor. Menu has a wide variety of choices. Started with a fresh squeezed juice. Cucumber n lemon juice. Yum!  For my lunch as the recommendation came from Gina-the kale salad topped with steelhead trout. When told it tastes like salmon I was on board. Amazing. Perfectly served and the steelhead was grilled to perfection.  Next who can resist the dessert menu. Normally I do. But was swayed by Chris to choose the banana and chia pudding. It's topped with toasted almonds. To die for. Restaurant is bustling. Seating in and outside.  Can't wait to come back. See pics

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ok let&#39;s dessert!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wow. Steelhead on top of kale is serious! Perfectly grilled
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The banana and chia pudding. Is amazing.

m8URFtw6immY9beTJsaSAQ.text: A guilt free go-to spot.   Relaxed atmosphere and food thats filling but doesnt weigh u down.    Edamame dumplings are awesome.  The roasted turkey wrap, T.L.T., Margherita pizza, House made chicken sausage pizza, and teriyaki quinoa bowl are ones i know wont disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey wrap with kale salad
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Edamame dumplings

nz0Ag_8-ez-hbKL07q64-g.text: Booked a reservation through open table, restaurant did not honor my reservation even though was clearly set on both ends. Put us on the outside patio in 118 heat while we "waited" for our table since they basically gave our reservation to walks ins (keep in mind I showed up 10 minutes early)  and another 52 minutes of waiting and watching two other tables of 4 being sat we called the manager over. After finding out that the hostess was simply incompetent, lied, and has poor restaurant customer service skills we were sat inside within 10min (over hour 20min after our reservation) and offered a free appetizer. I will never go back. The manager did her best but ultimately there is no structure or knowledge of the FOH.

_5b0qFUqSHdwM94q5bzkbA.text: There were a couple of vegetarian dishes on the menu. They were expensive and a small portion, but full of flavor. Customers service wasn't great...we were ignored quite a bit. Seating was good.  I haven't been back since the first time...I'm just not that into quinoa and kale.

ra6WmzNoGuXH84Fd5hL42Q.text: I have had meals in 4 or five True Food locations and remain amazed at the consistently great food and service at these restos!  Get some!!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t beat True Foods!

v6qiyaQtq-HKlRC1vFvMXg.text: Great menu, great service, great atmosphere! I have eaten here before but tonight was my first time actually eating in the restaurant. The summer menu is still in full swing, which is cool since it's still 108 outside.   I ordered the ancient greens bowl with tofu and the server was telling me how it's a new item to their menu and that it is really popular. I can see why, it's awesome! Loaded with superfoods like quinoa, avocado, and shiitake mushrooms, this bowl is complete and packed with flavor. I don't even like mushrooms (it's a texture thing) but these babies were divine!  I also caved and ordered desert (sorry hips!). The lemon tart is nothing short of amazing! Seriously, do they sell this in a fat guy version because it was so good, the large slice they give you, though plentiful and generous isn't enough for the fat boy in me. Lol. It comes with a coconut whip and blueberries. Ugh, so good!   Everything I ate was vegan and therefore responsible (sorry to get preachy on ya!) but I'm so happy to see more vegan options at this joint...can't wait for the fall menu!!!!

8HihL5YIX-kuvfRf2wh_yw.text: Located in the fancy schmancy Biltmore fashion park, True Food Kitchen offers healthy anti-inflammatory food. If it's your first time here, they can give you a little spiel about Dr. Weil!  We went for dinner twice and tried: Herb Hummus Wild Caught Albacore Tataki  Braised Bison Short Rib Butternut Squash pizza with GF crust Sustainable Petrale Sole  The tataki was soo good! I wish it came with more pieces. We were licking the sauce off of the plate. The herb hummus was meh, pretty standard and something I could have made at home. Of the entrees, we both liked the bison short ribs the best. They were so soft and meaty.  The space was a little too "cafeteria" like for me with all of the tables so close to each other, but other than that I really liked the offers they had and their service. Our servers both times were GF themselves, so it was so easy for my GF dining partner to get recommendations.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Autumn spiced sparkling tea and sparkling apple soda

5deN3OENSmNHiXH0XfuyaA.text: Always good. Always love what we order. Excellent service but be sure to make reservations!

aKqXjwkuYFhiggeezgdreg.text: Used to love this place but not anymore. Terrible management, cheap drinks. My reservation for birthday got cancelled a day before it , which was booked a week in advance. Do not recommend this place at all!

P-NbiWuGdzfHkDchs2Z5EA.text: Great food...great service...and they even brought out a little birthday surprise!!! You get the best feeling when you leave here because of the things we're stuffing inside of us!!! I would recommend this place to anyone even to the nay sayers...you have to try this place and you will be turned!!!! We will be back as always !

Jw-OS2HTPf9iPmBtfyAVxA.text: The food here is really awesome. Love going here bc there's a variety of options for everyone. The menu is quite refreshing! I like the atmosphere of the restaurant and the staff is really friendly and helpful

aeGeftCdhm95qPQFw1mfFg.text: This was my second visit to True Food at the Biltmore location. It was nothing short of spectacular. From the service, to the drinks, the food, the atmosphere- everything was truly phenomenal!   Our server, Desiree, made everything so enjoyable. From an incredible introduction to the restaurant, to great drink suggestions, and even better food options.   I have to commend the manager, Ari, as well- she came over and made sure everything was flawless. Service was incredible, and we all truly enjoyed the environment and the evening as a whole. I wholeheartedly recommend True Food Biltmore to anyone who is looking for a fun, fresh, and healthy culinary experience. Keep doing what you're doing Desiree and Ari! I can't wait to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Farmer Crudité. Veggie heaven!

aUyyCrGXmvmvG5Zbkdbmaw.text: Super good food and service! It was my first time trying True food and I was delightfully surprised!

4aNrrU61Aeoa6MF6TMfAXw.text: Good and healthy and all the drinks are really good and different. Plus it's a great atmosphere with friendly staff.

zxk7OGsEuPujvRtAvOf9XA.text: 5 stars, no question! The quality was incredible. Ever bite you are reminded of what food should taste like - natural and healthy, leaving you energized and feeling great. I had the grass fed burger with sweet potatoes and kale salad. I usually hate Kale, but the lemon juices and seasonings made it super tasty! The rest of the day I felt good and wasn't tired.   I walked through the kitchen and they have people peeling carrots, washing lettuce, cutting squash, etc.   I'll definitely be back and sharing this with my friends and family.

sqdsXb6dItB3ohIOHBF7ag.text: What a wonderful atmosphere and menu. If you have dietary restrictions, and love food, come here and enjoy.  My wife and I split the artichoke/pesto pizza and turkey burger.  They also had a lavender Collins that my wife loved.  Great bartenders. Would highly recommend.

8nqLswVJbFQ179k-rfKEiQ.text: This place may be my very favorite restaurant in Phoenix! I've been here more times than I can count, and have LOVED everything I've ordered every single time. So many fresh, healthy options available, and they are so accommodating of vegetarian and vegan diets, BUT also have good options for carnivores (my huz is obsessed with their grass-fed burger). True Food Kitchen was a game-changer for me when I first tried their kale salad years ago. It was the kale gateway for me, and ever since, I have sung the praises to people who "don't like kale", that if they tried salad they would change their mind. I even found their recipe for the salad online, and have made it a million times at home since.... but I still keep coming back and ordering it here. I can't recommend True Food Kitchen enough... this is a happy place for me :)

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuscan kale salad with salmon
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Charred cauliflower
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grass-fed burger with kale salad and sweet potato hash

5zLInOfElsGZGj_HFn1FQQ.text: Went back today for some yummy food , the Edamame dumplings are my new favorite. I love how fresh the food is here. Such great flavors as well!   Thanks again for an amazing meal.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Charred Cauliflower
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Edamabe Edamame Dumplings
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita Pizza

I_nfprrPJKJVMhdhxlJCJA.text: Whenever we want to meet up with friends, we tend to choose a central spot that is easy to find. And is equidistant from most of them.  The Biltmore Fashion park is easily one of those locations. Accessible from SR-51, a plethora of great dining establishments, and convenient parking - this is definitely a great place to congregate.  This time around, we chose to dine at TFK for dinner with some friends. We chose to dine outside, seeing as that it was a busy Saturday and the noise level was a little elevated inside.  Except for the mister residue that was all over the seats, we chose the ideal location to enjoy a dinner and the company of friends.  The service was prompt, attentive, yet unobtrusive. It allowed us to catch up without being interrupted every few minutes. However, our drinks never went long without refills.  Because our friends were running behind, we decided to open with the Minestrone soup. It was light, yet delightfully tasting as always.  For our main courses, I ordered the Sustainable Sea Bass. My wife ordered the T.L.T. Our friends ordered the Margherita Pizza and the Grass Fed Burger. This gave us a wide breadth of samplings from their menu.  Not even one of our meals disappointed us. All the ingredients tasted fresh. Although some of the flavors did take some time to get accustomed to, it lit p all our palates.  To close it all out, my wife and I shared the Flourless Chocolate Cake, with Vanilla Ice Cream on top. Its tempered sweetness rounded out our well plated meals. It was such a nice surprise.  We've eaten here many times since then. And thoroughly enjoy their offerings each time we visit.   I figured that after all this time of patronizing TFK, it was about time that I reviewed this fine establishment.

2Fiopfkt9kkkCkxgiqZX4A.text: True Food Kitchen is a full service Restaurant with around 40 locations In the United States. They serve food based on celebrity doctor Dr Weils alternative medicine and theory to avoid foods that cause inflammation. I went to the Biltmore Location in Phoenix. This location offers indoor seating, bar seating and lots of patio seating. Indoors the tables are somewhat crowded and is very busy with lots of noise and music.  I came here to try the Redfish Special off the limited time offered Summer Menu. WOW! It's really great! Got a generously moist meaty delicious Redfish and the most amazing corn......I think the corn was the best tasting corn I ever had in a restaurant. It was like they picked it fresh from a farm. I can't believe a 480 calorie meal could be so delicious and so satisfying.  My husband picked the Spinach Mushroom Pizza also off the Summer Menu. He was surprised that the crust was better than he thought it would be. The mushrooms on the pizza were super flavorful but the spinach was just served wilted. My husband miss-read the menu description and didn't realize the ricotta was almond and not milk.....got a little grumpy from that.....he said that he doesn't like this vegan cheese so he was scrapping it off.....But I suggested leaving a little cheese on to hold on some of my dishes delicious corn to make the pizza tastier and it did become tastier. He turned happy and said Fork over some more corn!  Our server was really great. She gave us the best service.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Limited Summer Menu - Redfish with Corn
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Limited Summer Menu - Spinach/Mushroom Pizza
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside

jcD5cgZbgfE1MM5PAd37jA.text: Who knew healthy food could be so good? Truly good food!? I think yes! I've visited this spot a few times and am always pleased and satisfied with my experience.   It is a very clean and modern location with relaxing and welcoming vibes all at the same time. The staff is very friendly and my friends and I were constantly checked on throughout our visit. Just to give you an idea how nice the staff was, my friend and I arrived at 5pm and left only because they closed! Not once did they ask us to leave, which would have been fine; instead, they wanted to make sure we were comfortable.   The food is very creative with a mix of healthy and flavorful. Recently my friend and I have been addicted to the Chicken Sausage Pizza. First, my friend eats like a bird, but when it comes to this pizza she destroys it! Second, she refuses to go anywhere and eat anything that is remotely healthy, but she's visited this spot two times in one week! We even asked for extra chicken sausage toppings and we received it with no extra charge. Lastly, the cocktails are just as good as the food and I can't wait to have another Cucumber Collins and Blueberry Martini. Overall it's nice to visit a place where I don't feel entirely guilty for eating a pizza. If you're looking for a similar feeling, hit up True Food.

VOzSi8VARW4xy8_3_GOnSg.text: Just wow! I left True Food Kitchen with a smiling tummy. Such a great place, in a terrific location, with AMAZING food! I had the Teriyaki Quinoa bowl, it was full of  broccoli, carrots, bok choy, mushroom, brown rice, and avocado on top! We also had edamame dumplings and left satisfied and excited to come back and try even more..

Fj3ccfq3nuulKyhPQvvwCQ.text: The Biltmore has so many restaurant options to choose from. If you decide to try out True Food, you won't be disappointed! They have a variety of different vegetarian, vegan, and meaty options to meet the needs of everyone in your group. They offer cocktails, beer, and wine, but I recommend trying the honey lemonade or the sparkling peach tea! On this visit, I tried the TLT which is the tempeh, lettuce, and tomato with avocado on whole grain bread. It's a vegan take on a BLT sandwich. While smoked tempeh is not exactly like bacon, it's a good substitute if you're plant based. My dinner date ordered the cauliflower polenta bowl and she loved it. The servers are always courteous and helpful. If you haven't tried True Food Kitchen but you love tasty, fresh, and (mostly) healthy eats, give it a try!!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. T.L.T.  Cauliflower Polenta**
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uecSSKRImf4lwSWJlkqxtw.text: I really like True Food. I've been to a couple of locations and the good is consistently good. I had the Korean Noodle bowl at this location and I really liked it. I really also enjoyed the quinoa burger in the past. I think the food is good, whether you are health conscious or not.  Lots of fresh veggies.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

QzQdMbmGNfO9gpZOxWLvPw.text: Another great lunch @ TFK. We both ordered the chopped salad. I got mine with salmon. Love their salads - fresh ingredients and tasty. Also had the watermelon lemonade and the lavender tea. Service was friendly, quick & attentive. Always worth the trip for a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped salad with salmon.

d9oprdhK7LKQh7VXE3Aq0w.text: This place was all right. A bit trendy. All local seasonal ingredients. I had a chicken sausage lasagne bolognese. It's something I wouldn't necessarily order, but it was very good.  I split a chocolate cake dessert with some of my friends. Amaze balls.  It's located in a mini mall. And I'm not sure I'd ever go back. Even if I'm Scottsdale again, which if history dictates I will be haha.

LSDUEy2O-3Wx93lcTv4H1A.text: Alissa made our experience top notch. Went for lunch and I was taken back because Im not a health nut. I went with the flow and because of her... I'll be back! She recommended a few options and we took all of it. The service, quality and taste exceeded my expectations. Alissa came correct and now I'm craving it again ... good food, worth the stop and they take pride in their work. I appreciate that personally.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Mex2DKWP5r26xviO2Gh7iA.text: We're back in town. It's about 100 degreeso we want something light and refreshing. True Food Kitchen is a perfect place. Plus they have HH. Even though it's hot outside, it feels like a nice cool summer, inside and outside with the misters. We ordered summer corn and tomatoes flatbread. It was so good. We also ordered herb hummus. Loved that the pita was ultra thin. Then there's the cauliflower polenta. It was good but small.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cauliflower polenta with shrimp, herb hummus and summer corn &amp; tomato flatbread
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Herb hummus
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Summer corn &amp; tomato flatbread, so good

KuEZBEvcnIddfBgGPvYI4A.text: The restaurant with an outdoor covered patio is centrally located in a shopping area of Scottsdale. We came here for lunch on a weekday and absolutely loved the food and the ambiance. The outdoor patio was gorgeous with a border of beautiful flowers surrounding the perimeter of the outdoor seating area.   We ordered the Hangover Rx which was basically a concoction of coconut water, pineapple, orange and honey. Would strongly recommend this! It was so light and refreshing. For starters, we got the kale guacamole with grapefruit, cilantro, sunflower seeds and light crispy pita chips. This was the first time that I've had grapefruit in guacamole and loved it!   For our main entree, we ordered the margherita pizza and the inside out quinoa burger with a side kale salad. The margherita pizza was also light and flavorful with its crushed DiNapoli tomatoes and fresh basil. The inside out quinoa burger was also good with the quinoa patties serving as the bun. The kale salad was light and refreshing with a hint of lemon.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kale guacamole
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The menu
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside out quinoa burger with a side kale salad

NOHF9fAA8tUEf6QE-OYjdg.text: It wasn't hard to get a table for 3 even though it was lunch rush. The restaurant is laid back but there are a lot of office buildings nearby so people are in that sort of fashion. There is indoor seating, bar seating, and outdoor seating.   My friend had the lasagne and I could smell how amazing it was from across the table. She is Italian and loved the sauce. It was unique because they had the sauteed spinach in the lasagne.   My other friend had the chicken sausage pizza. It was the perfect size and good amount of protein. It lacked a complex flavor layer. He dipped it in my friend's lasagne sauce and that made up for it.   I had the kale salad and it was so flavorful. It had lots of different texture and it tasted so fresh. It was bit so I have some to take home later.   We finished with the key lime mousse. It was so so good and perfect to share. The graham cracker bottom made the dish.   We all got refreshers drinks, so 3/however many there are are amazing. I wanted more, but they are $5. So worth it once but not a refill.   We found out about this place because of a podcast by the owner who is a doctor. 100% worth it. I want to come back tomorrow.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Sausage
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Key Lime Mousse**
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good Earth Kale Cobb**

R5s7S77ueJ9zKwJ4gWEHsQ.text: I love the place good ambience and food. Me and my wife went there and had ordered Herb hummus and it came with pita. I can probably say that's the best pita I had and we ordered more. My wife had ordered in and out quinoa burger. It was missing seasoning a bit. Hummus had raised the standard up high. I had ordered Mauritius island redfish and it was really good and well seasoned. We tried cocktails instead of wine this time. She had Citrus Colada and she loved it, I don't like coconut much so I found it okay. I have ordered Citrus skinny margarita and I didn't like it at all and had requested to get a different one and the waitress suggested to go with blueberry vodka it was nice better than the previous one.  Less star coz the lamp on the table was not lit and when we received the bill she added the drink which we have returned. We were almost leaving then realized it looked slightly higher that's when found she added the drink price as well. She apologized and corrected it.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry vodka
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Herb Hummus
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mauritius Island Redfish* **

AiXKR3FklYMAipy6LI9ODg.text: Walked by many times. Finally tried it with a visiting hometown friend. So here are our thoughts. Nice concept. Trendy. Music is kind of loud. Decent menu. Everything is modifiable and made fresh. Lots of vegetarian/vegan. You can eat healthy! You'll quickly lose it on adding in on beer, wine, cocktails.  But there are plenty non-alcoholic beverages so to each their own  My friend joked:"Hey - did you see each item has calories listed? This means you're not getting food. " Me:"Not a lot, at least." lol It didn't really turn out to be a joke.   We ordered roasted Brussels sprouts appetizer that came Asian styled. I like the firm crunchy sweetness of roasted Brussel sprouts and I love mushrooms but it was over-sauced, salty, and too much umami. Where it leaves your mouth/taste buds kind of puckered.  My friend ordered this seared chicken breast over broccolini, edamame, olives capers in a tomato sauce. He said his food was decent. He took a picture to send to his wife to show that he was eating healthy.   I had the poke bowl.  The waitress looked at my face when she delivered the poke bowl. She said I looked quizzical? I said no it's fine. She double checked. I sent her away. But my friend started laughing because there was a very small portion of poke over a much larger bed of rice. There was a few strings rainbow radish garnish and a very slight amount of English cucumber rounds with some pickled ginger. There was sauce on the side. About 1/8 th of a diced avocado.  While flavorful, All I knew was to eat very slowly and drink lots of water to trick my stomach into thinking it's full.  I also choked down the rest of those brussels sprouts so I could discount my feelings of not being satiated.  They tried to woo us with flourless chocolate cake, a chia bananas foster or a butternut squash pie. Decided against it.  Our bill came to about $25 -30pp including tip.   Once is enough for me. I'll be going back to Flower child even if they don't have pizza or adult bevies on their menu.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken breast filet over broccolini, capers, olives, tomato sauce and edamame
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poke bowl

hIVYKZJkl-AHkHJjyJyZMQ.text: We LOVED this place! We cannot speak highly enough. We came in for a date night dinner as finding good, vegan food is pretty hard.   We had the hangover rx drink and they were great! A little on the higher end for price but you get what you pay for. I had the vegan tomato pizza with arugula and it was very good. You could tell the sauce was fresh. I was however, expecting a little more flavor. My wife had the teriyaki quinoa bowl and that was AMAZING. so much flavor.   They were very compliant with our son and our server was very friendly. We will definitely be going back to try more.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

VvolAW4rqKVWQJxoJsdPRg.text: The staff at this location are wonderful! Our server was very friendly and seemed genuine. Large patio that when the temperature is in the 70's everyone wants to sit on, give it another few months in Phoenix and it won't be the case. Herb hummus was okay nothing special. Smashed avocado toast with organic sunny side up eggs, Gouda and thyme was good. Thick pieces of toast, eggs were prepared well there was not a lot of Gouda on it (but hey it was only 550 calories) vegan chorizo bowl had good flavor, avocado, sweet corn and beans served with corn tortillas. If you want fresh healthy options it's a good spot to try.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado toast with egg
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummus
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch

s0iX9MlxSD0xRetivSZ0hw.text: True Food is definitely a favorite restaurant for my family. We frequently go to this location and the Scottsdale quarter location. When you first walk up, they have planters growing vegetables and herbs and the interior is very open and calming. We had a reservation for noon and the hostess was able to seat us immediately even though we were a half hour early. I love the green tea here, it's so refreshing and has a great flavor without being sweetened. Our appetizer of the edamame dumplings came out super quickly, it was the first time I got something besides the kale guacamole (my favorite). The dumplings were delicious. I got the good kale Cobb salad, it was the first time I got a salad from True food and I was not disappointed. It was super filling but didn't leave me feeling sleepy.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good Earth Kale Cobb**
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i3TWEivKUih-hWbxagE1qQ.text: My family used this location to cater my little sisters graduation party and it was a hit! My sister, along with a few other people in my family, have dietary restrictions which keep them from eating a lot of things and at True Foods, they were able to find things that they could not only eat, but also enjoy. We got enough food for around 30 people and they had it ready in a timely manner and it didn't even cost an arm and a leg! Staff was very friendly and helpful, even rectifying a small mistake for our order immediately, that's what I call great customer service. Even the inside of the restaurant is well taken care of and tasteful. I would definitely be back, the highlight would have to be their gluten free pizzas, which were a hit! Thanks guys!

Nb_1kFhUl2eaOYRJDEGUzA.text: So good. Pleasant staff and great food. Going back again tonight. I had the spaghetti squash casserole and finished with the gluten free chocolate cake. Better than most normal cakes.

-mvvctTf3prgIu1h-uK0WA.text: I'm sorry, but there's nothing special about this place...except for the ambience. The dishes are small and lack flavor. Just another overpriced, "healthy" restaurant. Was very disappointed in my experience here, and our waiter was not so great. Wish I had nicer things to say.

SGuUt_jWsPGY4MJhPgeLUg.text: Herb hummus, Street Tacos, Chopped salad w/chicken, & Tabbouleh Salad all delicious!  If I had to make s suggestion it would be to spice up the fish in the tacos with a little more flavor, but they were perfectly cooked, flaky and moist.  The hummus appetizer is a generous portion; enough for 4-6 people.

MixGlJ3S6f_ANHRh6YJ1_g.text: Really fun ambiance and a great place to go with your vegetarian and vegan friends. Service was good and the sweet potato soup with with Moroccan spices was my favorite.

z6WYDhfmQf_n0nGuhDZgEA.text: PLEASE open one in Chandler/Gilbert area next!  We love the concept, the service and the amazing food.  Very rarely near the Biltmore or Kierland - we would love to make this a regular spot on our side of town.

Oyw61gjG_9HfiOm12yo6Mg.text: Love this place- great food and service. Everything is consistent. They are expensive, but you get great quality food. A must try

HbA9hhh9tM6jV0fbVVoU2w.text: had the vegan blt and was not impressed. however, the almond cheese bruschetta was incredible. i tried three different handmade drinks and enjoyed each of them.

MkgutRSvqZAPbi924ptm1A.text: My wife and I went here after a strenuous hike. We were hungry but didn't want to eat something unhealthy after a good workout. My wife got the grilled chicken salad and wouldn't share with me while I ordered a quinoa bowl with chicken and it was delicious. The restaurant itself looked terrific inside and out and the service was excellent. Highly recommend this place.

jSmG6piT8Lka7fs36L5Zzw.text: Love this place! Another good Fox Concept! Great to being your vegan or vegetarian friends along.

OYKl3pIM_10j3kI2-JBVEw.text: My only complaint about this place is the noise level.  It is difficult to have a conversation.  The food is wonderful.  We said we would share a salad to start and they brought it already split, with both of us getting quite a large amount.  I ordered the bison burger with all of the fixings on the side.  It was recommended medium and it was perfectly cooked.  The sweet potato hash made it impossible to finish the whole burger. We had a 25% off coupon only good for the 4th of July.  Fox concepts sends them for most holidays when you sign up for their email...will try there new seafood Ola e on the next one!

lzQcMmro9_IL5T0A8HV_Kw.text: I have been going here for years! It is such a great restaurant! Not too pricy! The decoration adds a great touch and the outdoors patio has a shade which is great-especially during the summer! Outstanding food! Very nice staff and great service!

3lZna6wfBRaRyqjsowXgKw.text: Best thing I order here for a meal is the bison burger. One of the best burgers if they cook it properly to what you order. That's the only thing keeping me from five stars.   The vegetable crudites is a great starter. Really fresh. They have a shrimp dish that is awesome for something different.   Also they offer a lot of fresh juices. The kale-aide is delicious and very refreshing. Try it if you never juice, it's a great starter.

K-6IE_8U1y6sMHSI9zYhWA.text: If I were basing this review on taste alone, I'd give True Food five stars. But this review is based on more than taste. It's based on price, because I'm a broke college student who wants to eat healthy without going bankrupt.  That being said, if you're into the health food scene and enjoy spending $10-$20 on a main dish, this place is for you. Which makes Ture Food a place I ask my mom to take me when she and I go out for brunch.  Many of their dishes are delicious (namely the shaved turkey sandwich, sweet potato hash, and soyrizo breakfast burrito), but could also be re-created at home with a small amount of culinary skill.  I do really respect True Food for also locally sourcing all of their food, and for being vegan-friendly and gluten-free friendly, but there are certainly smaller restaurants around Phoenix where locally-sourced food is offered at a cheaper price.

nm9bMA2qfcd_ftCboLpnJA.text: Creative menu, price was right, service was prompt and polite. What more could you ask?

xdQNkepy6PWtS3jnoT2QdQ.text: I'm the new Vegan on the block, I can't say enough about this place and the level of service by the lovely Desirae (Damn Daniel... back at it again with that top notch service). Once more, thanks Yelp for letting me know about this place and to all my fellow Yelpers.

9ERnMxWrzVhl9jkOvzEwcA.text: Awesome kale salad!  Spaghetti squash casserole was delicious!  Healthy vegetarian food!  Chicago - please open one now:)

3n-u-43_pwcaM3vBDxrJAA.text: Fewer plant-based (vegan) options now and no more chocolate pudding!?  Boooo.  We'll be back, but if the menu slips any more into the mainstream, we will be very disappointed.

ln6PvyVmXyZwf3kCR8oJIA.text: Love this place!!! Very health conscious and affordable! Nice atmosphere and good service!

StRABnBC7hZvljYIxQdAbQ.text: When I try several times, at all kinds of random times of the day during their business hours, to even get sat down at a table.. and cannot, then this place is doing just fine without me. Thanks for nothing Tru Food.

Dr6IsIV7yTNpqIRE0_ZJTA.text: Great food, but the portions are a bit small for the prices. I love the idea of eating locally and I realize it is a bit more costly to do things that way, but after a $60 dinner (2 drinks, 2 meals, 1 dessert), hubby and I shouldn't both still be hungry. The food we DID get was awesome- I had a chicken sausage pizza and hubby had some sort of seafood soup. The dessert was flourless chocolate cake and it was delicious, but $7 was a bit much for a round cake that was quite a bit smaller than your average cupcake and a golf-ball sized scoop of vanilla-caramel ice cream.  The service here was awesome and they happily accommodated our group of 18. It was pretty empty when we came in, but crowded by the time we left. The decor of fresh fruits and veggies, clean lines and Asian influences was great except that one of my friends ended up with a fruit fly in her drink.

eT0eL4u6g3ZkCzaJwL6RUw.text: Too expensive for what it was. Almost $20 for a bland salad. If you're looking for a place that resides on "cool factor" rather than taste and an appropriate price point this is for you.

WcEMKTBjv34TrjsTWqra_g.text: Recently got lunch carryout form here.  Service was exceptionally friendly.  I ordered the veggie panang curry.  The broth was OK but it had no substance to it.  I mean there was one sliced carrot, a couple of pieces of potato, perhaps 1/4 of a small onion, and one bok choy.  It cost me $18!  Although the flavor was OK I had to go get lunch... after eating my lunch!  For $18 bucks (all-in) I expect more.  I won't be back.

GtzjIogzf7oQ2F1bdCuvjQ.text: This place is phenomenal! Everything is delicious. I love the Vegetable Crudites with Tzatziki & Black Olive dips and the "Inside Out" Quinoa Burger with Hummus, Tzatziki, Tomato, Cucumber, Red Onion, Avocado & Feta. Yum!!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vegetable Crudités &amp; Cucumber Refresher ;)

FGFLedNa2IMRklUN1hvfVQ.text: Limited menu, overpriced, but what else can you expect from the Biltmore area? I love that the restaurant has a philosophy & sticks to it. Their vegan cocktails are awesome. It was very good, but I won't go back because of the prices. The restaurant is very loud, not great for a date.

oyEGvIa_GV8UgAdZuOlgZA.text: Don't play it again, Sam!  Please rejuvenate this concept. Bland, uninspired food that doesn't even read well on the menu. Much better healthy items at other FRC outposts (quinoa tacos at the Henry, nearly everything at Olive + Ivy).    Also, everything is $4 more than it should be.

boAVIPv17Vm1p9jb2hzKKA.text: Reasonable menu, decent service and nice food.  Bit sterile environment, not really friendly and healthy, more mass market roll them in and out. Also a bit odd with kitchen staff pre preparing meals right in the middle of everybody.  But can't complain as food was good as was service, first time I've been to a True Food Kitchen and would go back.

8luGV9SNJqIHpQkx7RXuXA.text: Have been going here since it began.  We had a real problems tonight.  The veggie appetizer was 1/2 normal size.  We were told that they are having kitchen problems.  The kale salad is great but the salmon we ordered on the top was raw.  The service was wanting.  It took 15 minutes for a Latte to arrive even though the place was half empty.  To top it off my granddaughter did not want the salmon by the time it was offered and the waitress brought a piece of cake which was good.  When I questioned the bill because they charged us for the salmon I told the server it should have been removed from the bill.    Why didn't a manager come by to ask?   Seems like the restaurant needs a manager who sees to it that a repeat patrons are properly treated.  Our waitress (6 weeks on the job) was surprised when I refused to pay for the dish.  I was charged for the salad.  We don't mi d paying for quality.  A manager never appeared.    I have never experienced anything like that in a Fox Concept Restaurant before.  They are usually on the ball - but now a favorite place is in decline.  What a shame.    We like this place and would like to come back, but this needs a fix.  Hopefully Sam will make that happen.

6WZkIme6pLjBkPhuVk0_MQ.text: Great healthy food with a great atmosphere. Food has never been sub par. It always meets or exceeds(mainly exceeds) expectations. If you want a super greasy bad for you meal this isn't the place lol, but I promise you it'll be worth it and save your arteries ;)

ff_JIWxTIMSkVe-_YJpquA.text: I met up with a friend today for an early dinner and some serious catch up.  This was my second time eating there and I wanted to sit  outside (while we still can!) to escape the noise.  We had a good meal...I ordered the shrimp dish and was warned by my server that it was "very spicy".  I'm a native so I am not intimidated by that at all.  It was yummy but distinctly non-spicy.  It came with noodles and I brought half home with the intention of doctoring it up for another meal.  My friend ordered street tacos and another enter.  She was hungry and said the tacos were good.  We had a gift card, so had dessert---a really strong, but tasty, lemon tart and a yummy frut crisp .  Our service was polite and they were tolerant of our very long visit.  I'msure the generous tip didn't hurt, either.  So, after my second visit, I am still not blown away by True Food   The menu has some variety but things like street tacos can literally be found everywhere.  I think I have an expectation that the food be healthy , unique, AND creative, especially for the price .  This is a really competitive food town.  The way for True Food to distinguish itself is to innovate and give the diner value .Once that happens, I bet more folks will place it in their regular rotation.

2uQ2uat8AAFbr5ccUpatzA.text: I do not understand the hype. Our server was nice, but the meal for 3 took over 30 minutes to come out and our side was cold. The turkey burger was bland. We paid $80 with tip for 3 people (no alcohol or dessert) and I'm still hungry. Will not return.

tOtl3qDDeH-FHdpiNMARzg.text: Ran into this restaurant for a grab and go juice! I bought the little miss sunshine & it was just what I needed! I will definitely be back for more juice & the food as well!!!

DcP2HlHIJa9NNj6KKMhMMw.text: Damn. Why can't something this organic and upscale-casual with cheap prices exist in LA?   Whoever invented this place is an ambiance genius. The place has natural lighting, a natural menu, and a full bar with natural juices.   The bison burger was $16 and succulent, delicious, and all those other nice verbs. It came with a hefty side of kale salad. (They give you the option of kale, sweet potato hash, or a little bit of both!) The manager came over to my table and even brought organic ketchup.   My friend ordered the salad with squash, brocolli, cauliflower, etc....It was filling and everything else good with the world.   LETS ADDRESS THE DESSERTS:  The banana pudding with chia seeds and coconut flakes was something else.... a little like a bite of heaven.   If they brought a franchise like this to LA, there is no way they would fail!

XZHXxdqqyFttRetsX4MLLg.text: Talk about making healthy food fun and tasty, this place does just that. It is an upscale casual, and is on the pricey side for casual, but you are paying for your health. The dishes are all sourced from local farmers and you can taste it. Even for someone that is not used to eating healthy, there are things on the menu for them.  I had the burger for example, which is bison meat. It was every but as juicy as a beef burger and had a great kick to it. They have all kinds of foods, including tacos and Thai dumplings, which I had for an appetizer. These were decent, but not the best.  The service was great and the outdoor area is well heated with lamps on those cold nights. Oh, and their kale is the best here, a great place to introduce someone to it!

d_BBuPGsvFcnd7xB5uqj1Q.text: Apparently something is healthy if you can put the words "organic," "Wild," or "Natural" in front of each main ingredient.  At least this is what True Food Kitchen would have you believe.  Naturally I went here with a good friend of mine for lunch. We had a short wait to sit on the patio. We started with the hummus appetizer. I was not impressed at all, granted I am a hummus snob (Go Sabra!). The Pita slices could have used a nice grilling, and the veggies were pedestrian.   For my meal I had the Ahi tuna sliders. It came with a sweet potato hash. The sliders were small and the ahi was a bit overdone for my tastes, the wasabi mayo covered the overdone nature of the Ahi. This is where I again question this healthy nature, copious amounts of mayo is not healthy when compared with the option of properly seared ahi. The sweet Potato hash was acceptable.
