But it is just something about the little places that is more exciting than a chain. I guess it is the feeling or intent in the preparation of the food.

3TqUPEn4O7hWyjlsFfYBiw.text: Weak.  I mean if you want a 'theme restaurant' worshipping Andrew Weil, you may love it.  If you're looking for a healthy, organically-conscious restaurant with flavor, MEH, not so much.  I spent a lot of money, heard a lot of talking about the food, but when the entrees hit the stage, I was thoroughly underwhelmed.  They talked a big game, but when it came to what was important, the very thing I'd put up with rotten service as long as it's absolutely killer, the food, did not perform.

rnwvlfQbHLFfgtM_u7B0cQ.text: Dr. Weil should come to L.A. with his restaurant sooner than later!  I had the ahi sliders which were super delicious and cooked to perfection.  The hummus and flax seed pita was amazingly fresh and light and something I'm craving right now.  Have the Medicine man elixir and feel immediately energized and enlivened.  A kale salad side is the perfect add on to the main dishes and lets me get in my daily vege requirements in one full swoop.  This is the best thing to happen to healthy dining I've seen in a while.

FDpbAmdU4uGNudYZpYNQ2Q.text: I really enjoyed lunch there yesterday and felt that the menu had a lot to offer.  Everything looked very healthy too.  I have never had a bad experience at any of the Fox restaurants so I knew I'd like this one too.  One of the servers brought us a couple of different items to sample which was fun and he told a story about how the restaurant started.  Very fun!

BRRg519q5Esu4iLeBaR-VQ.text: True Food was a truly unique dining experience. I loved the idea of going to a restaurant where you could feel good about everything on the menu in terms of its healthfulness.  I loved the vibe and decor of the restaurant. Natural. Fresh. Healthy. Colorful. Happy.   In my party we enjoyed the following selections: - Shaved turkey, provolone, tomato, cucumbers... warm pita - Grilled Salmon sandwich - Half chicken with farro - Wild shrimp pizza - Apple Crumble (do not have the exact menu name) - Chocolate cake (do not have the exact menu name) - Blood orange and olive oil cake (do not have the exact menu name)  They were all delicious. I only wish we could have tried more items from the menu.   I highly recommend you try True Food. It seems like a perfect lunch choice, but would also be good for dinner.

wCPLHudYuNpZFkzmACN0Ug.text: Excellent food that is prepared and served in a clean and healthy environment, Ask the staff about what food is good and they will help you find their best entrees!

iJ9LhhJI_DaSgR6mnbWYuw.text: This time around we had the lentil & turkey sausage soup, ahi sliders, turkey pita and of course the ahi salad. Solid!

aanS8UNIEyCHdYppLAyi8w.text: A sign of a good restaurant is that I'll become a repeat customer.  True food is a breath of fresh air.  It is healthy and extremely good food.  So far, my favorites are the mushroom ravioli and the curry rice dish.  The portions were perfect and the service was good, but not great.

nzbRp-f4kvSWLGwzCNFhww.text: What a great concept!  Fresh, healthful food with a wide ranging menu that offers plenty of options for vegetarians, vegans and omnivors. Could not be happier with every aspect of my meal -- delicious local greens salad; vegan pizza with rich tomato sauce on a tasty organic flour/spelt/flax crust; and a chocolate soy ice cream. Nice selection of organic and bio wines.  Very reasonably priced. The only complaint was a slightly wobbly table.  But for someone from Boston to be eating such a wonderful mean outdoors at 8pm in mid-Feb, it doesn't get much better.

JbWoCy2s2wLhcc4VD1s6cg.text: One of My favorite restaurants in Phoenix by far. Great atmosphere staff is always friendly, excellent service & great tasting cuisine.

55rGkH2YXhIQK_Bu2zX1Ig.text: True Food is awesome. It's great to find a place that has really good HEALTHY food!! Have been here on many,many occasions and it's always been a great experience. The shrimp and goat cheese pizza is a favorite but I've really liked everything I've had here with one exception...the butternut squash ravioli, I could do without this dish. Service is friendly and helpful and I dig the patio when it's cool enough to sit outside. Sam Fox seems to know how to do it up right. Thumbs up!

BvgElICFEuHAH-nx9W5nTA.text: I have avoided this place since it opened, because I was worried that it was too much of a scene.  I really just want to eat good food, and I don't care about who else is eating around me.  Anyway, I was wrong to avoid True Food.  I went for the first time last night, and it was terrific.  The food was great--not too fussy or freaky, but just yummy.  We had a mushroom pizza and soup.  We sat on the patio, which was very nice at this time of year.  But best of all was the service.  I don't usually gush over waiters, but ths group was terrific--attentive, kind, helpful, but not in-your-face.  Just great.  If you like green tea, the iced green tea here is a winner.

uE4Zr7nVKuj-d_Td9N_mug.text: True Foods has a great concept but in all honesty I believe it's overrated. I have dinned with them on several occasions - last night for a friend's birthday - and each time thought it was okay but not fantastic. The menu dinners range from $15-30, but are not worth that much (for example there was bones in my fish and our desert oil cake was a bit stale). However, they are a good place if you want to feel like you are "eating healthy" because of the organic/gluten free dishes. The service was very good - Damien was our very attentive waiter.

xvODfXFjkv7aV8m2HBruOQ.text: Excellent humus, good service, enjoyed the fish tacos.

2Y91oy8mgtWqnXaV5KJcHg.text: The first time that I went to True Food, it was love at first sight.  A year later, I am still in love.  This place is fabulous!  I'm surprised that they don't have better reviews.  Their drinks are delicious!  I like Andy's elixir and the one that is like homemade ginger ale.  They also have a great spicy jalapeno martini - delicious.  The food is even better!  My personal favorites are the harvest salad with the goat cheese, the sashimi ahi salad, turkey burger, the thi curry (order it extra hot, it is bland otherwise) chicken sausage pizza, and the hummus - yum.  Oh and the Kale salad is delicious - I don't even like kale!  One of my favorite things about True Food is that they make me like healthy foods that I usually steer clear of .  The staff is great too.  I have never had bad service - sometimes it's not great but it's never  bad.  They will bring you samples of anything.  It's awesome!  If you see something on the menu you haven't tried before and you are a little un sure about it, ask for a sample, they will bring you one with a smile.

VytdrLKdlYFUJA9lbDFVMA.text: My friend and I headed over to True Food for a Sunday lunch after hiking Piestewa Peak and this place hit the spot. I thought the food and fresh juices were very reasonably priced. Especially considering the beautiful decor and quality of the food.  Lovely for a spring afternoon and good company.

s1rZ-k1YMdFmeKjhResz0A.text: Being vegan, it is very hard to find good healthy restaurants in this city that offer vegetarian and vegan options. Love this place!

no-xgzAZQB6Y8Yv0yO190A.text: A little on the pricey side, but the TLT is to die for if you're a vegetarian. It's definitely got an air of trendiness and it's a little expensive, but it's good food and a good time, so I can't ding it.

AJ88zfHM-bBrYGjAZkSJTA.text: I am a huge fan of this restaurant. I love their locally grown fruits and veggies. I love their healthy options. I had their brown rice with curry sauce, veggies, and organic chicken...it was incredible! Can't wait to travel to Arizona again and return to this wonderful restaurant! PLEASE OPEN ANOTHER LOCATION IN THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA! It would be a hit!

yFR5XBTbvlzkdGW760j_Zg.text: Starting with the good first: The atmosphere was very nice. It was a little louder than I anticipated for a nicer place but completely ok. I loved the decor and the general idea of the place. The staff were nice...a bit too eager to have us like the place but they were nice.  Their juices were also good.  The bad: the vegan and vegetarian options were pretty bland. They used a lot of sauces to compensate for the lack of flavor in the food. I think part of the beauty of vegetarian, especially vegan plates is letting the natural food speak for itself. You can find better options around town. However, this place is nice for a group of vegans/vegetarians to go to as it offers more options on one menu rather than hitting up a regular restaurant and everyone has to order the same thing since it's the only available option on their menu.  Would I go again? Once in a blue moon and only if I'm on that side of town.

Mr3vW4h3tCk8abeXOURlSA.text: True food is love, True food is life. Everything I've tried is divine, yet so modern and nutritious. The Roasted Ingredient Salad  is my favorite thing off the menu but the Red Chili Shrimp, and Tuscan Kale Salad are good as well. For appetizers, the Vegetable Crudites is the way to go (black olive dip is drool worthy). As far as desserts go, the Flourless Chocolate Cake takes the cake (haha). For a nice night out without completely weighing you down and swearing to begin a cleanse or diet the next day, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Ingredient Salad with Sustainably Caught Salmon

mnDpCekI1di9fkE-R3v_rA.text: When this first opened it was my favorite however over time it seems the quality is hit or miss. For example roasted chicken has arrived lukewarm on two visits. The burger was cold inside and did not come with condiments as requested 3 times. The flavors are not consistent either. However I love the clean fresh healthy vibe and ambience. Very expensive and disappointing when the dish is not up to standard. The lettuce wraps are the best!

z7EXuP3hQ0HE6EwnvCu3jQ.text: Beyond the attractive decor and nice food-presentation, I wasn't all that impressed by True Food. Certainly the concept of healthy, sustainable, locally bought food is great (albeit in the form of an upscale-chain), but overall, True Food didn't live up to the hype.  On the positive side, the edamame dumplings with daikon radish and white truffle oil were extremely tasty, and my Ginger Margarita was excellent.   On the not-so-positive side, the raw ahi tuna app-special was just OK, and the tiny slivers of fish (maybe 8 total?) were more of a "taste" than a full appetizer. Even worse, my chicken sausage pizza was slightly burnt on the bottom, and tasted bland and uninspired -- the sausage was finely ground and lacked much flavor, and the fennel was invisible. Added to the long wait (weekend dinner reservations are a must even though the restaurant is huge) and the pay-parking lot (if you stay more than two hours, which we did because of the long wait), we all came away mildly disappointed.  With many other excellent Phoenix-area restaurants to choose from, we'll head elsewhere next time.

XooUMVVltqlpRRmJ3sIS5A.text: My husband and I were so excited to find this restaurant in Phoenix! We like to eat 100% organic, and this place delivered excellent service, delicious food, and a really nice variety of dishes. The food was fresh and in season, and the servers were knowledgeable and very friendly. The parking is very easy and we were seated almost immediately. It would have been nice to have a little more intimacy, since the seating outside and inside is a fairly wide open floor plan. Also, since we are from NYC, we are used to the prices. However, I believe high quality food is worth the money. We felt great a long time after eating, not heavy or sleepy.  I'd highly suggest eating here!

F2jw3ZtGj9Ogp8VYKOwBhw.text: I came for dinner and the menu had a wide array of different foods on the menu. I went with the steak taco's and I have to say this was the first time I've put salt on my food at a restaurant. The food was just bland and didn't seem to have much flavor.  I like having healthy food but, there are plenty of ways to keep things fresh and still have flavor. There wasn't anything I had worth coming back for but, there's lots on the menu. The hummus pretty good and I tried I bite of the flour less cake and it was better than I expected.

_H2oB6QMMIErqlZupQMB4w.text: Amazingly fresh and delicious with lots of gluten free options. The natural beef and black rice stir fry was outrageous (not gluten free). My wife had the Panang Curry and based on the rapturous look on her face, she enjoyed hers as well.

KwBt0PKopCHE2r8-AIfM-w.text: I am going to keep this review simple.   If you are a health freak this place is as good as it gets. If you want to get greasy food and feel stuffed to the point that you need to wear elastic pants to the dinner table then this is not the place to go.   I ended up getting the burger and it was good but not great. At the end of the day I would not go again because when i eat out  i dont care if it is healthy. Also the vegetable platter for the appetizer is like rabbit food.

1UEAW13OIJ246x_fvgxxYw.text: A friend of mine wanted to go for lunch this past weekend.  He suggested since it is the New Year and we are looking to eat on the healthier side, that we try this new restaurant called True Food Kitchen.    We arrived and at first glance I thought, this place is pretty cool.  It's located where the old Coffee Plantation used to be in the Biltmore Fashion Park.  It's over-sized dramatic lights and open "Cafeteria style" seating with a hip twist was interesting to me.   Bringing the kitchen to the middle of the dinning room was certainly a new concept.  They had food prep and pasta making in the middle of the room.  Not sure how well that goes over with the Health Department, but it certainly was innovative.    We were seated and immediately approached by our waitress who was very nice and helpful.  She took our drink order (oh no soda by the way) and returned to take orders. We both decided on salads. I went with the Harvest Chopped Salad, Butternut Squash, Apples, Walnuts, Goat Cheese & Balsamic Vinaigrette.   Meanwhile I saw the table next to us was served soup, and that sounded good, so I asked the waitress to add the Miso soup.   After all was delivered it was honestly very delicious!  The Goat Cheese was SO creamy and with the tangy vinaigrette and other added items in the salad it was such a good meal!    Now for the bad news...I guess it depends on the person but I thought for the portion sizes, It was a little pricey.  At first a $10 salad didn't seem like a big deal to me based on my experience on salads at other establishments, but honestly this was more like the size of a side salad.  I know the ingredients are "Organic" and "Fresh" but where do we draw lines?  Mind you, I am not complaining about the portion size, because I agree we as Americans over-eat, however the comparability to the price was off.  I don't think I am a cheap, but I just question why we pay more for food that is healthy?  This never really made sense to me.  Just some "Food for thought".

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. True Food - Patio
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. True Food - Inside
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. True Food - Sign

bDSANwNhMcEMMJrWIG-S0A.text: I adore True Food Kitchen! I've been three times and I adore the food. My favorite dish to order is the Turkey Bolognese, the sauce is lovely and I really enjoy the brown rice penne. I am also a fan of the goat cheese and fig tarte as an appetizer, it's really good and just the right size. Last time I went there I tried the lemon tarte and let me tell you, it was delicious! The coconut cream was superb and the tarte wasn't too sweet, letting the lemon flavor shine through!   As with the food, I have only had good service at True Food Kitchen. The servers are well trained and always make dining there a pleasant experience!

2YE83oU6kY8WpZuDuAVM6w.text: Thank you, TFK for existing! I wanted to try everything on the menu but it just wasn't possible tonight! This is a place I could go back to every day until I try the entire menu.  I was pleasantly surprised. The food is so fresh and the flavors are great, not too salty, not overseasoned, just right. We started with the thai shrimp dumplings- small portion.  I considered ordering another.  I had the teriyaki chicken bowl and loved it.  My husband had the chicken sausage pizza.  He loved it.  We were pretty content after the entree but I just had to taste their desserts.  The almond oilve oil cake was so delish.  Light, fluffy.  A great summer dessert.  Now if they would only post that recipe.  The portions are perfect, service is great, staff is friendly and the kitchen coordinator was on top of his s*@t!  See you tomorrow, TFK :)

iD-vvz5f3kUqbyjR0oTC6w.text: The Nojito's are fantastic!  I find mojitos a bit too sweet but the nojitos never are.  I had the salmon sandwich with the kale salad and the sweet potato hash.  I've had the salmon before (fresh, thick, tender) and the kale salad (the kale is cooked but far from limp and comes sprinkled with what appears to be parmesan cheese and bread crumbs). Today, I also had the sweet potato hash (sweet potato and caramelized onions - yum!) and that plus the nojito are reason enough to go.  My friend had a chicken salad and a medicine man drink.  He wasn't wowed by the salad which consisted of your basic salad with chicken but he said he'd try the place again.   The place is pricey though.  The sandwich was around $15, and the nojito might have run $5?   Went at 12:30 on a weekday and the place was packed.  We had to wait about 15 minutes.  It's easier to get in right away at dinner.

bCLEDmUIczkxmA43pmZZNA.text: True Foods delivered again. We had an awful experience at The Mission a few nights and our group came back to True Food for lunch. We had an even better experience than last time. Jared, our server, made excellent recommendations and treated us so kindly and always with a smile. We had a problem with our soup and the manager came out, apologized sincerely, and another lady came out to apologize when our meal was taking a little longer to come out. The food was fantastic, and the chocolate cake dessert was mind blowing! Thank you so much, True Food. We loved the welcome and the food so much that we came back the next day to the same level of service from Mackenzie. I feel like the manager, Mark, really sets the awesome tone for this restaurant, as he touched our table with every visit and was out on the floor helping his staff every time we were there. He even read me my Facebook notifications off the phone I left there (like an idiot) when I called to check if they had it, haha! I cannot wait until they're in Bellevue, WA!  My favorite nibbles from True Food Kitchen during my week there were: The Mediterranean Quinoa Salad (refreshing!), the Tataki (drool), the Hangover Rx drink (only if you like coconut water, though!), the Seabass (drool), the spicy shrimp (drool), the matcha horchata (mega-drool), and the flourless chocolate cake (save. room. for. this.). As a Seattle-ite, I've got to give them props--their seafood is spot on!  Thanks guys. You'll see me again soon :)

ChAMtM2ghHPol9E2762l0Q.text: I LOVE this place!  I usually avoid any restaurants that have gluten free or veggie friendly menus since I'm as True as a carnivore as you can get.  However, this place has absolutely amazing food, service, and drinks.  It's a relaxing atmosphere with fresh, healthy food that doesn't sacrifice flavor or appetite.  Both alcoholic drinks and nonalcoholic drinks are equally superb!

FBsuDsw_pM_DK3-hmmv3mA.text: Love it, the food is great, the seating, the servers, quality of food is really fresh and light, they don't have anything that is greasy, their lasagna, I'm not a lasagna person if not made by my wife, but this True Foods lasagna is fabulous.   Love this place.

sJ-OZD6bOd_Q-LirjPqIBA.text: Very green food indeed and good taste. It took us about 10 minutes to wait until got a table. I ordered a Panang Curry with chicken and my wife ordered a Farmer's Market, For the kid we ordered a collection of carrot, apple, grape and chicken. All the veggies looks fresh and they are really are.   Drinks we ordered the cucumber refresher and carrot apple ginger tonic, very soft and fresh, even my kid can take a sip.   Although we cannot take every meal like this (imagine a whole week of veggies? No ...), but it really feels good having a meal you don't need to count the calories.

q_4Ddq4TSzXoiy-lP57ztA.text: This place is one of my top three favorite places to eat in Phoenix!  The yellow curry is the best I have had!  It is fresh and creamy with a good amount of spice.  You must try the lettuce wraps- they are meatless and taste better than P.F. Changs lettuce wraps (my meat-loving husband agrees!).  My husband also craves the steak from here as well.  The drink called the Medicine Man is so refreshing and leaves your body feeling wonderful.  This place may not be for your steak and potatoes type of person but if you want wholesome, natural, tasty food then please do yourself a favor and try True Food Kitchen.  Remember to get your parking token validated.  Menu selections barely ever change but the items they have are keepers.

UJICiPFR0ncNEtD9_FoHEg.text: This place is not good for vegetarians and don't really seem to want to work with you to make anything a healthy vegetarian option that's also tasty.  Beware! Most of their noodle dishes have fish sauce, chicken stock or the like. The server seemed annoyed that I even asked, and also said it wouldn't be possible to have a veggie protein in a salad. Their seitan was one note: salty. Better to try seasons 52 next door, which at least has some flavorful vegetarian options.

VQ47zDDltriacadakuxykg.text: I love True Food's philosophy. It uses organic ingredients for necessary ingredients such as the dirty dozen and not for the clean 15 and so on. I love having nicer restaurants where I can go on nice dates or grab delicious drinks and I especially love being able to take my non-vegan friends here.   My favorites here are all the vegan options! That's the hummus (no cheese), lettuce cups, TLT, teriyaki brown rice bowl, and mushroom pizza without cheese (my vegetarian husband says it tastes better without the cheese anyway).  Drinks are all great, and the chia seed pudding is just the best! You can't go wrong with any of the options at True Food!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. For brunch only: tofu scramble burrito. Possibly the best tofu scramble I&#39;ve had!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummus, no cheese
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TLT and mimosa

RZKL869kOHPGMamiQGP2Ww.text: I'm not a health nut. At all.  I primarily eat healthy but can cross the line from time to time and I'm definitely not someone who seeks out healthy places on purpose.  I need meat, cheese, and carbs. However, this place actually makes healthy food taste delicious.   I do love kale and really enjoyed the kale salad. It was crunchy, flavorful and very filling. that didn't stop me from having a pizza. I mean, I have to even out that healthy kale salad AND the pizza was organic and full of veggies, so it's okay.    If you have any dietary restrictions or have several friends who are on fad diets (you know the ones. Those who suddenly are 'gluten free' for no apparent reason).. take them here. You can still enjoy a delicious meal without having to be a pain in the butt!

8_0a1ew9DJPRTmqUW0qT5A.text: Vegans - tofu burrito, spring salad no cheese, tofu lettuce cups. Those are my faves  But everything is amazing try it all. I love this place. It's so fresh and dope and everyone who works at every location in the world is so fucking sweet.

UWEbTXZ6AhmzhF8Tcu-5tg.text: First time and we did it right. Tried many of the menu options.  I liked that the honey cucumber lemonade wasn't too sweet.  The guacamole was interesting as it included grapefruit.  My favorite of the four salads were the Tuscan kale salad and the the chicken salad.  Teriyaki quinoa bowl was tasty and flavorful. I really liked the the margarita pizza was very light and thin.  They lost a star for the customer service. I wish the waitress would've been more friendly and engaging, but it was obvious she just wanted to go home.  If I go back I would definitely get the chicken salad again along with the margarita pizza.  For dessert, the flan was definitely the best. Followed by the awesome flourless chocolate cake and the fresh key lime pie.

HwgKycnmPraQvCHO7JfLpg.text: Came with my dad who's an omni and we both got to enjoy a nice, fresh meal! For an appetizer we shared the kale guacamole and I think it's safe to say this is the one of the best guacs I've ever tasted! For a main, I ordered the T.L.T sandwich and for desert, my dad and I shared a slice of the vegan key lime pie! I've never had key lime pie before so this was pretty awesome to see that the one on the menu was vegan! Definitely recommend if you're vegan/vegetarian and want to find a place that's great to dine at with an omni or simply want to enjoy some great food!

C2jPunCXj83sgMdA14O23A.text: Very good atmosphere, food was quality and had excellent flavor. The only problem was the price, you have to pay extra for meat.

bbsSkBGPPkjYnnM3ESWzyQ.text: I love this place! I eat here atleast twice a week! The food is fabulous and there is something for everyone! My favorite is the ancient grains! So delicious! I highly  recommend this place.

MCJicfJyfunPANyMMHOnRg.text: Your chicken sausage pizza is so F***ing delicious. I haven't had the option of buying a lot from you guys but I look forward to it. Keep up the great service and great cooking.

XNlkf-0SDquk5V9HbnHdGQ.text: SOOOOooooooo good. We ate outside, there was plenty of seating inside but I read that it's noisy inside and it was a really nice day.  It's got all of the F-words. Fresh. Fun. Fantastic food. Friendly staff. Fizzy drink that was yummy. Fast service. Flabby- NOT how you felt when you left. For vegetarians and folks that eat meat, alike. Free parking on one side of the mall. Fix- what they'll do to your parking pass if you park on their side of the mall.  Fact: We will go back!

r0gd8rGtdL9B3aqarIqWbg.text: True Food serves up some bougie, and supposedly healthy, options.  Their dishes look and taste great.  I really enjoyed my tuna sliders with sweet potato hash and kale. However, portions are small and you'll get hungry again sooner than you should for the price you pay. Know this going in and you won't be disappointed. Nice to see cooks prepping your fresh veggies out in the open.  Our server started off doing a good job, but then disappeared somewhere so we had to flag down other servers.   Overall, this was a good place to try one time but it won't be on my list of regulars.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lD0-2tx25hztAbG8ebl50g.text: What I wouldn't give to have this restaurant that's just bursting with good healthy fresh food - packed with vegetables, no less - in my city.  Our party of 5 was seated at a king sized wooden tables, of which there are many. I remark on this because I'm from two cities where they cram us all in so that we're intimate with strangers. I realize I might not mind this too much. We pretty much had to shout across the table to each other, the tables are so large! I'd be more bugged by that if I wasn't so in love with the concept and food. Regardless, it's good to know that large groups can be accommodated (10 probably could have fit at our table!)  Our shared apps:  -crudite with dips (loved the black olive!)  I really *really* wish huge bowls of fresh, crunchy veggies would become an American restaurant trend, ruling over the damn bacon or *insert your unhealthy comfort food* trends that I'm positive only exist  thanks to a backfire that BS fat-free 90s food trend. Anyway, I fully accept such a trend probably won't happen anytime soon.   -herbed hummus (divine! It has a unique taste and excellent texture).  I ordered and did *not* share because it was so good I conveniently forgot:  -the mouthwatering Tuscan Kale salad (one of the best I've ever had in a restaurant)  -TLT with avocado (piles of freshness: lettuce, beautiful tomato, lush avocado and crispy tempeh SO plentiful, I should have stopped at one half but I couldn't stop!!)  Dessert? Oh, I would have tried, believe me, if half as good as all that preceded it, no doubt would have been incredible. But I was immobile by meal's end.  True Food is the healthiest franchise I've ever had the fortune of experiencing! Here's to hoping they branch out to New Orleans.

sDgLKwVk2P90Pd_cxbPKjg.text: True Food is a fantastic establishment with a variety of options for guests with food allergies which I greatly appreciate. The service was absolutely fantastic and the servers are genuinely so attentive and caring, especially Maddie, Adam, and Brent. I will always recommend this establishment to friends as it largely outshines the surrounding restaurants in every facet, drinks to dessert. Very happy I visited!

22vfLzKeerS8DaSdEEBdZQ.text: Great restaurant with healthy food, if you like healthy pizza this place make nice pizza..

FBhLn4gnu_aapYUxYruReg.text: first time here and i was impressed! my friend and i were promptly greeted and seated and given a run-down of the menu items and how each item was selected by Dr. Weil (i'm a huge fan of the anti-inflammatory diet).   we started with the hummus and were even brought a few pieces of extra pita since my friend is twice my size. the hummus was smooth and creamy and came topped with a little salad of cucumber, tomato, and olives.   i ordered the red chili shrimp. was told it was hot, but it wasn't too bad, so i asked for a side of their homemade "siracha" sauce. the noodles were soft but not soggy. the tidbits of greens and the shrimp were a delicious combination. i couldn't help but to wolf the whole thing down in a matter of minutes. my friend said his curry dish was fantastic and even placed a to-go order of the same for his wife.   very reasonably priced for middle class budget. friendly service and a beautiful dining area.

es8mYJhZjqIEOAEGNCuuAw.text: Finally had a chance to come here while in toqn for business.   It's so refreshing to find a restaurant catered to vegetarian and gluten free patrons and taste like home style meals.  The kale salad was tasty as was the turkey lasagna...but beware of the garlic use. I'm sensitive to garlic and both my plates were loaded.   The service waa great and our waiter (his name was either Todd or Tyler) knew the menu and sold my significant other on meals to dessert...and he was right on.    The ambiance is relaxing and inviting,  and you can watch the staff take good care at making sure all plates and silerware are clean.  I can't wait to come back on my next visit to try the inside out quinoa burger.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So excited for  a gluten free lasagna and beer!

dQ1FCGsieAS4FNzWMXXesA.text: Great atmosphere, and surprisingly you'll find here a great skinny margaritas. Bit on the pricey side, but you'll get a good quality, all-natural meal.

ggNIl_MtN1hAZEkWxaoWVw.text: Fantastic food! I didn't have much of an appetite so I just ordered the soup of the day, butternut squash. It was seasoned perfectly and tasted super fresh. I stole a little bit of my boyfriends kale salad which was phenomenal- probably one the best kale salads I've ever eaten. Friendly service as well. If we have enough time during our stay, we will definitely return!

BcE97dGj2ZVUfIJrA-b2Sw.text: I absolutely love the concept - fresh, healthy dishes you don't have to feel bad about consuming. Lots of vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options and plenty for meat eaters too - I think True Food can probably accommodate most people's dietary needs.  I saw a turkey burger on the menu and was sold - I love turkey burgers with all of my heart and had high hopes that the True Food one would be amazing. In fact, it was pretty "meh" - dry and definitely overcooked which gave me a sad. I do love that they happily let you split your side choice so I got 1/2 sweet potato hash (also "ok") and 1/2 kale salad (absolutely amazing).   I wish there were more options for unsweetened drinks - most of the tasty items included honey lemonade or sweetened tea. That said, a plain house iced tea was good & freshly brewed. Service was great - friendly, prompt and enthusiastic.   Although I was pretty disappointed with my burger, the rest of the menu looked amazing and I would have no problem returning to check some other items out.

hpDf3FhuwFINpDbh1Pp_xg.text: Interesting concept. Excellent service. Seating was uncomfortable. Expensive for what was served. Food wasn't bad. No happy hour menu. Parking is problematic. Location is ideal for an after dinner walk in the Biltmore shopping mall where the restaurant's located.

w9k3dCrPyi_UsEoYvnA4fg.text: I like True Food. I been to Santa Monica, Denver and both AZ locations. The problem with particular location is Juice. I order costume juice in tall glass with no ice and aways get it with ice. So I send it back and get the same juice in smaller glass with added water. I been here 3 times and every time the same story.   As far as food goes, it's very good and healthy in every location.  From now on I will skip this location.

4J1DA8u0O8FIgE-BKSymGA.text: OK.... We eat out a lot, and in a lot of places... So... it takes a good deal to really be unique.  Being a healthy eater I am constantly looking for good / good for you eating out options.  If you are the same, I highly recommend dropping into True Good Kitchen.  We went in on a Sunday evening so the wait was only about 10 minutes.  The staff was very friendly, and helpful, and the food was absolutely phenomenal.  I had the grass fed bison burger with kale salad and sweet potato hash.  It was the best bison and Kale I have ever had.  I typically do not do deserts but they had a Chia Coconut/banana pudding.  I was very delighted with the food and service we received.  If you are in the area, or in an area that has a True Food Kitchen this is a must.

YHzq_mlPwr4QMoTxjZ6vfA.text: Fresh, delicious and healthy food.  The menu has something for everyone and can accommodate various food preferences, making it great for groups.

xz05TbHApeR0Dt-2febmQg.text: I was here for a business lunch. Was in town for a meeting 2-3 weeks ago & it was a nice find. I had the fish taco plate & lemonade.  It's not something you find out in LA, so I thought it was quite interesting and lively.  I like how the restaurant is laid out.  The atmosphere was quite lively & it's hard to talk business, but aside from that, I'd come back again if I were ever in town.  I saw that they had another location in Scottsdale too.  Try it!

WhzoGvjvoLzP3BOGYqYQDQ.text: Good, fresh food with healthy ingredients & options. Lovely juices. Love their chia pudding. Their butternut squash pizza is fantastic. Their sea bass is good as long as you ask for the disgusting sauce on the side & don't eat that. Great salads. Nice, open kitchen & open air setting. There's almost always a long wait for a table, though.

2e-AKuJsPT_kF69tO3BM8Q.text: There's now one in Santa Monica, CA - yeah buddy!!!  YUM.

OrUhPBmKAL9MbRL_GfYSkA.text: I enjoy a variety of things on the menu, and I like the approach to eating healthfully.  Unlike some of the other Fox restaurants, I don't think this one is overpriced.  Where else can you get quinoa salad?  I'm not a vegetarian, but I eat many of the vegetarian options because they're so tasty.  The "TLT" (a fake BLT) is amazingly good.  And, of course, the hummus is one of the more unique takes on that dish you'll find anywhere.  The wine list is spartan, but that is a sacrifice you'll have to make for their good, healthful options.  Last, I know it isn't their fault, but be prepared to be annoyed with the Biltmore's ridiculous parking system.

foMbd1ogfYcDPOQ9GkhWDg.text: My family and I come to the Biltmore location quite often for many reasons. I have severe food allergies and True Food Kitchen is always so accommodating to all of my allergies. I can confidently say that True Food is the ONLY restaurant that I can fully depend on to make my food right every time. Not only is it geared perfectly to my allergies but it is absolutely delicious. The chefs definitely know what they're doing in the kitchen. Secondly, the service in all areas of True Food at the Biltmore are excellent. The greeters and the hosts at the door are always so welcoming. It's refreshing to walk into an establishment with such smiling faces. Additionally, Ari (the manager) greets us every time we are in there like we are family. She is always smiling and out on the floor helping every one out...seems like a really great manager. However, what we truly look forward to most is coming to visit ANDREW. With his quick wit, kind heart and superb service, it is always a treat. Andrew was our first server here, and from then on we were hooked! He was so accommodating and knowledgeable about the menu and the concept that True Food Kitchen prides itself on, we instantly felt at home. He is one of the best servers we have had the pleasure of being with!

4tdiWM9NdjCm6ZLLpTIJ7Q.text: Dear True Food executive chef, Spices and flavor are organic too!  The food was good, it was just bland. I ordered an iced green tea, got black tea.  Whatever, I still drank it since it arrived while I was in the restroom and couldn't immediately send it back and I was thirsty. We shared a hummus appetizer which was really good and obviously very fresh.  Even better when the onions, feta, olives were included in my scoop. Next up was what sounded very delicious, the soup du jour: saffron potato.  I added quite a bit of pepper to it so it had some flavor.  It wasn't bad by any means.  I ate two spoonfuls that had saffron in them and those were tasty bites.  I really wished there would have been more saffron in my cup of saffron soup. I ordered the chicken sausage pizza.  The marinara sauce was sweet and I don't like sweet marinara.  I gave half my pizza to other diners to try.  It needed something like onions or peppers to compliment the taste of the sweet marinara and mild chicken sausage. One of the other diners ordered the chicken with asparagus which was very moist and tender, mainly because it was cooked and served with the skin on.   Overall, it was ok.  I'm not going to request to go here ever.  If someone is having a dinner or lunch here, I'd probably meet up with them later.   I think this place is fantastic for people that eat healthy or have sensitive stomachs.  It's not really the ideal restaurant for people who think of dining out as a possible adventure.

UZ64lXolENGMc9Wsb1BdbA.text: I loved my first True Foods experience. All of the food is local, seasonal and fresh! There are not many places to go these days that offers nothing but "True foods", so I will be a loyal patron. I had the Kale Tuscan Salad with Cucumber Honey Lemonade. The salad was perfect and large and the lemonade was out of this world. The staff was very friendly and helpful!

wMw5LA9Xx8pzaODukCLY0w.text: This is one of my big favorites in the valley! Have been here a lot of times and will not get tired of coming back! =)  Refreshing and organic food, lovely ambiance...=) We fell in love with this place after our very first trip in their location in Biltmore. There was quite a wait but it was well worth it. If you are looking for a new refreshing taste with choices for vegan and gluten allergic people, this is the place to be! The concept does not stay away from making their food delicious while using the freshest and most organic ingredients. I love bragging this place both to our local and out-of-towner friends. I've tried a variety of what they have to offer in the menu but my favorites are the Tuscan Kale and Chicken Chopped Salad, all types of pizza esp the one with goat cheese and the spaghetti squash casserole which is very light and healthy! For dessert, the flourless chocolate cake is just amazing! =) Service is fast and efficient. Pricing is fair plus they offer half order to some of the selection in the menu.   Great place for lunch and dinner! Will have to try their breakfast menu soon! =)

0UmR9GltEHMVwXMWF7wv2g.text: Healthy food...small portions..good hummus and pita but spicy shrimp noodles were not spicy at all...chicken sausage pizza was pretty good and ziti was well made...

v5dwvHm6XThPgSSFDg6hmw.text: I ordered the Harvest Chopped Salad and Banana, Espresso, Pistachio, and Date Muffin. The salad had the best combination of fresh fruits, creamy goat cheese, and dressing. I would not complain if I ate one of those every day! The muffin was so delicious, what a combination of flavors! The only down side for me is that it was quite pricey. Don't get me wrong, the food was mouth-watering, but I wouldn't want to spend that much money on a regular basis.

X5TOyea1K4Q63ibIDhwRnQ.text: Pretty mixed I'd say, had the green tea soba dish, it was pretty flavorful but the vegetables, snowpeas and green beans mostly, were waaaaay undercooked. With only a small amount of these really thin soba noodles, it was like chewing through hunks of wood, and too much cilantro, every so often you'd just chomp down on an entire sprig of it it seemed. Still tasted pretty good though, just needs some refining.   The juice drink I had was really interesting and I liked it quite a bit. It was agave and Ginger, which gave it a nice bite but was still very refreshing and light feeling.  Overall it was not a bad experience, the atmosphere was nice (with the right company) and the wait-staff seemed helpful.  But for the price I would expect a little more concentration on their cooking not just the ingredients...

9ygddJYdPCf3SR1tvbzdiQ.text: Service is excellent, quick, and efficient. The noise level precludes serious business discussions. The food is good and they present a unique variety of unusual choices; however, I am allergic to MSG and I reacted to something in the Herb Spiced Hummus - why do restaurants still use that . . . ?

LrnGGaKxlDcc1SiMkNGknA.text: Very light, fresh and yummy food!  We had the watermelon salad, the corn ravioli, sweet potato hash and sundried tomato pizza. Everything was delicious!! The drinks were great too- both the cucumber and Ginger. I wish they had their restaurant in Boston too!!!  I was impressed with their vegetarian options!

ZbiJ2UG50sFon4uFR_Y2Ew.text: Brilliant!  The drinks and food are amazing.  Staff is knowledgeable, quick and happy to be of service. Atmosphere is terrific too.

bwNXpKh9MNwoSX--X6LZ9Q.text: I tried this place for the first time yesterday.  I  loved the food and the environment!  This is the only real healthy food restaurant that I know of in Phoenix.  It was a great experience!

9FYxUebM49fMYxG7UuBafQ.text: Wish there were a few of these in San Diego. Great fresh food and wonderful atmosphere. The pesto olive pizza is one of my favorites, I usually add the chicken sausage to it. The kale salad is great as well. Had tempeh here for the first time and it's good too. I feel like you can't go wrong with their menu. The porter beer was incredible and their refreshing drinks are awesome. My favorite are the Ginger and the pineapple with coconut water ones. The teriyaki bowl with tofu is a hit and so if the curry bowl. It can be packed midday for lunch but not as much in the evening. The kitchen is open and they make a lot of their food steps away from you. I love this place! I can't wait to return to Phx to have it again.

G0LRWzLYE2yCVzIunq6NRg.text: My wife and I went to True Food Kitchen tonight for the first time; I'd been wanting to try it since it opened and we finally had some time alone to give it a go. All I have to say is -- WOW!  The food is so unique and interesting at  TFK. All of the menu items are organic or locally grown (or at least locally sourced) and the menu was created with Dr. Andrew Weil. But this is not your father's hippie health food.  We shared a shrimp dumpling dish as an appetizer, which was delicious. For dinner my wife had a curry noodle with shrimp dish that was light and just a tad tangy from the curry. I'm usually not a curry person but this was just enough curry to add flavor without being overpowering.  I had a pizza with shrimp, caramelized onions, sweet red peppers and goat cheese. It was amazing...one of the best pizza dishes I've ever had. I'm a huge California Pizza Kitchen fan and I'd put this up against any of my favorites at CPK.  For dessert we shared an apple-cranberry crumble with non-dairy maple ice cream in top. It was sort of like a sweet granola with huge chunks of baked apples, soft cranberries and this amazing ice cream that was so good it was hard to believe it wasn't actually ice cream. Delicious.  We're definitely going back to True Food Kitchen!

V5WndKlTRL84xjHEcZzulA.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Thank you, True Foods, for giving me a healthy eating option.

Huw3CFlnmi5RqPdXVShbCg.text: Great food, service has been oddly bad the last 2 times I've been there.  We had to correct our check because the server couldn't figure it out and we didn't have time to wait another 15 minutes for them to sort it out.  I'd avoid this place.

RVGh-RZq-UEZRi-uWwcR0A.text: Spaghetti squash and add chicken!! I hate squash of any sort but the guy next to me ordered it and it smelled tasty. I dont regret ordering it.. amazing!!!! The service is attentive and the menu is large enough that you have many options. I will give this Sam Fox restaurant five stars

KRTlmgypijr0-0edCRaw7g.text: Oh, Lord, do I wish this place was in Chicago!  They serve beautiful healthy, whole food dishes in a very stylish modern setting with an open kitchen.  There is truly something for everyone - vegans, vegetarians, and carnivores.  I had the TLT which is tehmpeh, lettuce and tomato with avocado on whole grain bread.  It was rich, delicious and flavorful.  The sweet potato hash was amazing.  We were lucky to get a table outside to dine under warm, blue Arizona skies.  The restaurant is beautiful, the food is healthy and amazing.  Please come to Chicago, and bring those blue skies with you.

eVxnD-tilxMyscfTuMsbMQ.text: First time trying True Food Kitchen. Very hip and trendy place. Food is impressive in its freshness, simplicity and flavor.  Lots of vegetable/organic options to choose from.  Good place to meet new clients for a quick lunch.  Will try again.

jtau1NBwjblvaD6Hnqx_cw.text: Crudites, steak street tacos & the cucumber refresher - always perfect. The service is great and the decor is fun. It is nice to have healthy, enjoyable options that still offer great flavor.

isr89NbcK36tIk3IMlkRLg.text: Very good. Felt full and not "gross". Only reason it didn't get 4 stars is because my meal wasn't my favorite. I got the teryacki chicken bowl and the rice was saturated in sauce. Just a little too much for me. Still very good.

e1qHhh3rmpB8EGtkO7uDDw.text: Buttersquash pizza, spaghetti squash spaghetti, and medicine man teas...we sat outside it was a bit chilly would've loved to have had one of those warmer things by us...our waiter was great...the rest of the menu looked tantalizing and healthy all in all We had fun!

5UqI0ogPY3oc5L4nuKyfRw.text: I love True Food. The mint drinks, the layout, and the menu. I also like the friendly staff and overall good feel of the place.   I was just there last week celebrating a career change with my mother and we got there at a high volume time. A table opened up quickly, but there is one thing I will never understand and that is why the bus boys or waiters, DON'T clean the WHOLE table. I watched the guy do a quick rub down and there were still lettuce pieces on the table... Why? In my mind I was thinking, "Please wipe up the lettuce! The lettuce!"  Sadly, no.  Also, his rag was so wet that I didn't want to put anything down so we asked our hostess for a second wipe down. The same guy walked back over to redo the table and said, " You need another wipe down, huh?" As if it was strange.  Oh well! But the mushroom pizza was amazing and my kale salad was exactly what I needed.  Love the place but don't like rag wet tables!

093AeWcZau4WAHhCcS4qIA.text: This place is really over-hyped.  We had the edmame dumplings (not sure of the exact spelling !) for starters.  We got four bland flat dumplings filled with some paste and floating in soy I think.  It was really tasteless. Then I asked the server for his recommendation.  He asked us to go for the chicken chopped salad.  The salad was really ordinary. . Lots of cheese blocks..and it was 14$ !!!  I think this restaurant tries too hard to be like the 'hipster' places in san Francisco.  Disappointed !

sdtDTGFQv0QxxeLBeyPSTQ.text: Hey, I'm a hipster: I need my martini. So I bypassed the health-smoothies on the left side of the menu that were the focus of the waiter's spiel. They did look appealing I guess. But I wasn't in the mood for a spa experience. So the martini came without olives. As did the kale and mushroom pizza on whole wheat crust. But both tasted great. Even my kid thought enough of the kale pizza to eat half of it. He's four, and roasted kale is usually a hard sell. Anyway, quick service, pleasant surroundings. Family-friendly enough to make me feel comfortable with my kid (despite the occasional stares of couples who probably have Childfree.org stickers on their BMW's, where the man is tallying stock options and the woman is trying to silence the wails of her empty and yearning womb. Of course I'm used to that.) Anyway, I liked the place. I'll be back. I don't think I like it as much as I liked Coffee Plantation when it was in the same spot 15 years ago. But never mind this old fart. Sawgrass smoothies are where it's at today!

UEvs2Kuqgb92bt5BHGrxPA.text: Being a vegetarian, I find that there are many options for me here, which is nice. The edamame dumplings are delicious (although it only comes with 4!) and the kale salad is very good as well! Almost everything I've tried is tasty and the service isn't bad. The biggest problem is the small portions for such high prices!

UEmhwNTcQvt0evX2OY2mhw.text: Ate here last night. Food was poor at best.  Don't let the concept fool you, it's no good...

w1mE7b5GNz_XccolZAdVeQ.text: I have eaten here a handful of times and every time I have a good dinning experience.  However, last time I was there they were out of 5 of the juices that I ordered.  (Guess it wasn't my day)  Besides that the food was great and service was super.  Great atmosphere, great spacing and great concept.  Super happy to have this located right down the street!

GuD_ZF8XzGoKXLnQFe3jTg.text: Our service was fantastic, but hard to overlook our burned gluten free pizzas. Manager on duty came over when our server noticed our distaste, but failed to introduce herself or resolve any issues. Frankly, disappointment after spending 24 dollars on 2 pizzas, not to mention drinks, salads, and dessert. Won't be coming back and certainly not recommending it to any of my friends or family. I wanted to love this place, but a little poor customer service goes a long way.

u3Gq9bJrojk34Jj4TqIERw.text: Oh, True Food. I want to love you.  But you make me feel like I'm eating in a cafeteria. WIth such a contemporary menu and a staff full of bright shiny faces this restaurant is just a contradiction in form... the menu and ambience just don't match.  My advice is to sit at the bar. The drinks are well served by pleasant bartenders and do their job, the stools are comfortable, and from that locale you get to skip the experience of having dinner with a room full of strangers right at your elbow.

HqmNC2aAjverzewi3mb63Q.text: Awesome, healthy place to eat. Most things can be made gluten-free, if thats important to you. The staff are nice and friendly. Foods a bit overpriced to be sure, but it is high quality! The Bison Burger was FRIKKIN SWEET

ojAdWlTpwvHmMFplud6Nzg.text: I love this place. I eat here regularly. I usually get the Kale Crunch salad but I arrived today and it's off the menu. Bring it back!!  Other favorites are the hummus, edamame dumplings, spaghetti squash casserole, turkey burger and bison burger. But, I have to say that everything I've had here has been exceptional. Nice wine selection, too!

j0oT9dhKkuLnLL7R32plqQ.text: We were here visiting the Phoenix/Tucson areas and it happened to be Valentines day so we stopped in for a nice dinner.   It was a nice start to a wonderful weekend. I had the Salmon and my husband ordered the steak street tacos.    What a romantic and delicious meal we had that night.  The  salmon was melt in your mouth good. My husband doesn't usually care for salmon and even he loved it.   He  loved his steak tacos too.    Gobbled them right up.  For dessert we had a dessert trio and that was also very good. Service was excellent as usual.  We have been to the Newport Beach location and have always enjoyed True Food Kitchen.

cT7GP9_NnT1HZ6tam0M-FA.text: I could eat here everyday. I have never had a bad experience here. There is never a wait and the service couldn't get any better!

uqmFSCftFCl6wbaURNNDuA.text: Some of the best healthy food I've had! Place has a nice atmosphere in a great walking shopping plaza. Loved my quinoa burger, veggie appetizer and smoothie.

2vwqefXizDpS2D64bj23xw.text: This place has been on my list for awhile now and today I finally decided to check it out - I'm glad I did! I was craving a burger but I didn't want fast food and I didn't want to cook anything myself so I placed a take-out order for their grass-fed beef burger with a side of kale salad. The burger was amazing! Definitely one of the best I've had, especially considering the wholesome ingredients. My only complaint would be that it was a little overdone - I asked for it medium-rare and it was definitely medium-well (overcooked burgers are a pet peeve of mine). The kale salad was tasty as well. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grass-Fed Beef Burger with Kale Salad

H82kGlHoNNpa-1_u0Ug6UA.text: I love finding great eateries like this while away from my home turf. The food is so fresh and tasty. I prefer organic food whenever possible and they offer it here. The restaurant is very popular and looks like a very hip place to be after work. I was here for lunch on a Saturday and it was full, made a reservation for my friends and I and were seated within 10 minutes. The noise level is in the high range here.  Food is fabulous. Prices a bit on the high side but worth it. Located in an upscale shopping center within a business district. Validated 2 hour parking in the nearby lot at this writing.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Refreshing pomegranate drink
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interior design
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tacos

T4llUwXRG-NCjJoHGlTiBg.text: The food is creative and delicious. If you like going out to eat and want something that's not completely unhealthy I'd go here. You can tell they use fresh ingredients and don't cook with an overload of oil. All the staff here has been friendly each time I've been there. Went tonight and had the TLT & shiitake lettuce wraps.

XMEyavn1As3ukKDKGfupvg.text: The food is amazing but head to the Quarter location for way better service.  Last Sunday, I roll through my girlfriend after a weekend seminar and we're starving.  1. There's a huge line out the door to get seated and they're at 30% capacity. 2. We get seated, order a drink and it takes over 15 minutes to get a beer. 3. Our waitress disappears, so we have to order from a random. 4. They bring me the Grass-Fed burger, ordered incorrectly. 5. I gave them the token to validate and they forget to do it. 6. No apologies, no 20% off, no "hey, we messed up tonight."  Overall, a terrible experience and as big True Food fans, we were beyond disappointed.

JBIanBYKQAMFds4B8Dx2Iw.text: Excellent service and food.  I had the vegan pesto pizza with vegan ricotta.  Delicious

_bb2ODSJlFR-NDtFqfydIg.text: I have been waiting a long time to try True Food Kitchen. I tried Lyfe Kitchen a year ago in Denver and felt a bit under whelmed with the experience.   This expirence was much of the same. Don't get me wrong. The place is beautiful with big windows, plants and fresh food all around. I loved the open kitchen and watching the food prep go on right next to us.   The waitstaff was very, very friendly. But very, very slow. We were really hungry after hiking and really needed food and drinks to replenish. We did a lot of waiting which made us a bit hangry. It also seemed more like a fast casual place than a full service type ambiance so we really just wanted to eat and run, which is what most people around us were doing. We also noticed how people who arrived after us received their food before us which was irritating.   We tried their juices which were fresh and tasty. They also had a nice presentation. But again, took 15 minutes to come out. Then we had the soup of the day which was a Thai Curry chicken soup. It was amazing. It was spicy and the flavor was spot on. We then had a fall vegetable salad that I felt was very tasty for what it was. My husband didn't agree and he wasn't too happy with it. I'd definitely give it another try since I love whole, fresh foods. I'd come here if there were one close to me  and try other stuff since it seems like all the options may not be consistent. I love that there are chefs out there creating unique and flavorful plant based dishes. Hopefully this trend will continue to spread!

jkF1w6SYTXrf2CUeNn3Aug.text: Who doesn't love True Food Kitchen?  First time at the location and it did not disappoint.  I tried the ancient grains bowl with chicken which was a hearty and delicious meal.  The desserts and drinks are also a standout.  Everything here is made from scratch.  Unique flavors and delicious.

_JRp45S6xhm3SrH1QenLKg.text: Fresh, healthy food and great service in a bright, open space.  The servings aren't large and the prices are high for the portion size, but everything is interesting, genuinely healthy and delicious.  Love this place!  I've come here for breakfast in smaller and larger groups (2-6) and the service is always on point.  The market scramble is lovely (not heavy with oil like a lot of breakfasts, yet quite filling), as are the Quinoa Johnny Cakes (they just taste like fluffy, delicious pancakes - get the yogurt on the side to make sure you like it as a topping).  The also have wonderful lunch/dinner options! A few favorites include the shitake tofu lettuce wraps (wow! flavor) and the new seared spicy tuna wrap (my friend tasted it and said, "Woah!  I didn't know tuna could be this good!"), the red chili shrimp and the spaghetti squash casserole (this one is a little smaller, so get an appetizer if you're hungry).  The regular drinks, like the Cucumber Refresher, are absolutely delicious, but the Juby True juices are quite hit-or-miss, according to a few juice-loving friends.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half the ahi tuna wrap. It&#39;s got flavor out the wazoo!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We split the watermelon and heirloom tomato salad w goat cheese &amp; basil (this is half) -  sublime is an understatement!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large, light, flavorful pancake with phenomenal banana flavor. I&#39;ll get the yogurt on the side next time.

8dwsQqc6XTZV2uXzUD2Tng.text: The charred cauliflower with dates, mint, and pistachio was delicious. Also enjoyed the Kale guac and steak tacos very much. The spaghetti squash bake was good but not worth going out of your way for.   I think we got there at the beginning of a dinner rush and had a fairly new server. He did a good job but the timeliness was hit or miss.   There are plenty of vegetarian and vegan and gluten free options. They are accustomed to handling food allergies.

v_9YbZtBcC411_YTwsLcow.text: I've always been a fan of this place. I was a frequent visitor of their Santa Monica location in California. I've never ordered something that I didn't like.  This time around, I split their new Roasted Vegetable Board with my cousin. It was so good! Came with a green goddess dressing & hummus. Couldn't decide which was better.  We also split a quinoa burger (see photos). It was a great healthy choice. The kale on the side was so flavorful (maybe rubbed with lemon & garlic?) and the sweet potatoes were good.  AWESOME DRINKS: spontaneous happiness & cucumber citrus margarita   This is a great lunch spot and I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Quinoa burger w/kale and sweet potatoes
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted vegetable board

gucV65cHSjUZe9YjMc6E9Q.text: A friend of mine recommended eating here. I was not disappointed.  Cool fun atmosphere,  friendly service,  creative menu. The food was very good.   I look forward to eating here again the next time I'm in Phoenix.

PCeaK8ubX9IDeYXeQkjPaQ.text: Early Saturday morning, July 14, to end my fabulous Sedona/Phoenix visit I decided to live dangerously and try . . . TRUE Food Kitchen located in Biltmore Fashion Park .  This healthy eating is definitely NOT me. OMG!!!  ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!!!! My initial thought was type of eating would not satisfy my idea of a 'good' breakfast so my backup plan was to drive across the street to Over Easy; how WRONG was I!  I started w/t watermelon lemonade added the Smashed Avocado Toast w/my egg over medium PLUS an order of the fennel chicken sausage (after one bite of the fennel chicken sausage, I have decided to give up pork sausage and bacon).  E-V-E-R-Y-T-H-I-N-G was SUPER delicious!   In between bites of my Smoked Avocado Toast (they use Dave's Killer Seeded Bread) and sips of the fragrant watermelon lemonade, I had questions upon questions for my server Chandler. The Manager, Desiree 'Dez' stopped by to check on me at which time I asked the question 'when are you coming to Chicago?'  Dez, smiled and said Oh, we are already in Chicago.'  Duh, so embarrassing.  Dez, suggested I save room for dessert.  THEY HAVE DESSERT!!  And boy do they have desserts, the flourless chocolate cake w/ ice cream - simply fabulous, and the ice cream is NOT made from SOY! I have to end this BUT I co-workers and I will be spending some time at TRUE's Chicago location.

pk5aBind-zkqdDibN3gSkA.text: Cannot go wrong with this place especially if you have dietary restrictions. On my birthday I did a triathlon and came here with family after to celebrate. The service was exceptional and they brought out a complimentary vegan dessert. I would recommend the Teriyaki Bowl for a good nutritious lunch that keeps you energized through out the day.The management here knows how to keep customers happy/returning.

KkDodJCBtjpcJtKVesgpiQ.text: A very pleasant atmosphere.  Sited in an upscale shopping area it is a good pick if you are interested in so-called healthy dining.  The menu is good with options for all tastes unless you think fine dining is found at Applebee's. Pricing is very reasonable for this area. Wait staff was good and the person greeting us at the door did not flinch or seem peeved when I rejected the table near the door she attempted to foist upon us. (All restaurant staff know to fill the less desirable tables first.).

sKntVmof-xcRkJmBEFGH9A.text: True Food Biltmore what has happened to you?   Let's start with the super unfriendly, uncaring hostess who doesn't smile or wishes one a pleasant meal.  Then the waiter Adam who after taking the order is missing through out the dinner only to pop up at the end with the check. Never came back to ask if we needed change or a thank you or a goodbye even though he was standing 3 feet from us.   What a disappointment. This place has really gone down hill.  We use to frequent it often but haven't been in almost a year. We were overdue for a visit.  Won't find any of the regular folks who use to work there. It seems like a Temp Agency has taken over staffing and its just a bunch of temps running it. Just a real disappointment. Plus the food simply isn't up to par anymore. And what's with the "spring menu"??... it's almost August!    Treated our friends to a birthday dinner and now wish we had gone elsewhere. We feel awful. We stopped going to the Scottsdale location a couple of years ago. We are now done with the Biltmore location and probably done with them period.  Ps - Wish we had read all the current bad reviews

hNVAsbUHhDKSgsrndJKR2A.text: Wonderful food! As a vegan, it's refreshing to go to a restaurant that has several plant-based options. The food was always fresh and tasty.  However, certain dishes had too much oil (in my opinion).  I tried the Butternut Squash pizza which was delicious, but it was doused in oil.  The Sweet Potato Hash also was very oily and burnt sometimes.  Everything else I tried was fabulous.  The Ancient Grains Bowl is the best dish on the menu! Friendly staff and great outdoor seating.  I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ancient Grains Bowl
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Margherita Pizza with the Almond Ricotta instead of Mozzarella.  So yummy!
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Butternut Squash Pizza

FYzhXwa_LUB9GMGpROxDFA.text: The turkey burger was the best turkey burger in the entire world.  On the other hand some of our dishes were not better than three-stars-worthy: brussels sprouts app was overcooked and the kale guacamole was a small, low, half-mixed pile of large avo chunks and kale shreds with some ingredients we couldn't identify, accompanied by a disproportionately large pile of unappealing pita chips. The spaghetti squash casserole was like something you'd make at home when you don't know what else to make, only it was half as much as you'd eat at home. The inside out quinoa burger fell apart immediately, turned into a mess on the plate, and was just eaten with a fork.  The server was precious, not in a good way, and no matter what exchange she had with the table, she'd end the interaction by putting her hand down dramatically on the table and saying "Mmmkay, let me know if there's anything else I can bring for the table." The first time or two it was mildly weird but she did the same thing four or five times, robotically, no matter what stage of the meal we were at, and it just left the whole interaction feeling programmed and impersonal.

LOvcYzLdiNv7Wg1BtDNC_g.text: Spot on delicious! Super fresh food. Try the grapefruit martini to start. We had sea bass over the top sweet and moist, cooked to perfection with ancient grains and broccoli ingredients. Edemami dumplings were tender and tasty. Burnt cauliflower was to die for, and last but not least were the desserts. We had squash pie with coconut cream whipped cream and dark graham cracker crust and flourless chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.   Go, go now! Not inexpensive, but worth every bit of it.  The only thing keeping it back from a 5 Star was the level of service. It was haphazard and inattentive although the food came out hot and quickly

-ZzkgWvoMfMHV6k-8lo7GQ.text: Love True Food Kitchen (have been to the ones in LA and Houston as well). Food is consistent with the other locations - great quality ingredients, good portions, affordable pricing.   Personally, I felt the service was only ok. It felt staffed by teenagers who were keen but not very experienced. The hostess also had a bit of attitude. However the food made us forget everything else.

Tb1WOWnqAGXF6Kj6CBrecQ.text: We enjoyed the food. Staff was very helpful. Nice environment.  Great food selections.

Y8koXXWkoXwaiFdzmwgGvQ.text: I just love the healthy menus here! Gluten free and vegan options are always a plus. My favorite thing on the menu is the spaghetti squash caserol. I have dreams about it! You can make any of their specialty juices into a cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1B1cD-dF6geq02slFanQaQ.text: True Food at Phoenix Biltmore is a fabulous location. The restaurant is casual and cute. I booked a table through open table for my moms birthday on a Saturday night. I needed to call and adjust the party size and the restaurant was very accommodating.   Per their open table notes, I requested a table inside. We ended up in a small private room, I imagine is perfect for business conferences or more "intimate" parties. Our server was fantastic though I don't recall her name - petite, light brown gal with short curly hair and maybe some freckles? Wish I could mention her name so she could get the credit she deserves!!  She was attentive despite probably having a full section in addition to the side room. She was very knowledgeable about the menu and knew options for different dietary restrictions. My mom was able to enjoy herself on a Keto diet here. They offer plenty vegan, vegetarian, and gluten free dishes. I highly recommend giving them a try. Even if you think vegan food is weird, you're bound to enjoy the vegan pesto pizza, teriyaki bowl, or another perfectly prepared vegan dish. Delicious flavors, fresh ingredients. Their drinks are also prepared with fresh juices. Nice ambience. We were taken care of well for our occasion! Would definitely come back.

7bJBzLJCr_aL4umqrdi4fQ.text: I really like the spaghetti casserole made out of squash. They basically cut the squash with something like a vegetti, and then make the veggi-pasta into a casserole with tomato sauce topped with cheese. Delicious and super simple.  I've had it in the restaurant, which was a fantastic experience. The drinks were also great.    However, I'm deleting a star, because when I ordered it at work delivered, it was small, cold, and very lonely looking in the big take out container. We pay the same price to get it to go, without making dirty plates, without taking up real estate. I think Take-out should be at least as good as in the restaurant, if not better. Oh well. It's still healthier than 90% of the crappy pre-prepared, processed sysco food at all the other restaurants.

J29FbXQZNUmZRY77dzV7Ww.text: If you are on a diet, looking for healthy food, or just want some great food True Food Kitchen is the spot.  Everything there is scratch made and fresh.  The restaurant its self is very modern and open which I love.  Their menu constantly changes which is good because that means there menu is changing with the seasons of the food so the food is fresh.  When I go there I always start of with a Kale Aid drink.  The Kale Aid is kale, ginger, apple, celery, cucumber, lemon, tastes very refreshing.  Then the must go to is Ancient Grains Bowl with Chicken.  The bowl consists of miso glazed sweet potato, turmeric, charred onion, snow pea, grilled portobello, avocado, hemp seed.  This bowl is packed with flavor and it doesnt look much but it will fill you up (That is the hemp seed).  With the Anchient Grains Bowl I recommend getting the Charred Cauliflower which consists of harissa tahini, medjool date, dill, mint, pistachio.  It really is a great pairing to the Ancient Grains Bowl.  This place has it all for everyone unless you are just looking for a dirty cheat meal then this is not the place  but still a great place to have a healthy hearty meal.  The restaurant is very pricey though so watch out the bill will shot up quick.  The food is always fresh and made from scratch so that is why it is expensive.  Good clean food is always pricey.  So, all in all this is not a False Kitchen everything you hear about this place is TRUE!  BrandonFitFoodie

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ancient Grains Bowl Charred Cauliflower Kale Aid

P1M86jYZqFlD8zgvIXgnKQ.text: Had a wonderful lunch here with 4 other ladies who've all grown up together.  We had a reservation and were sat promptly even after switching from the patio to inside.  Our server was wonderful and knew we had a lot of catching up to do so he was very patient and did not hover interrupting us.  My Chopped Salad with grilled chicken was so delicious and filling I'm already wanting to order it again.  We all had a wonderful time!  Parking is easy in the lot right near the restaurant and they validate your parking chip inside the restaurant.  Well done!

Qb3D_zeoTGtrT_b1gGg24A.text: Open air restaurant. Love the layout of seeing the kitchen and big windows. Got the heirloom tomato pizza and it was amazing. The almond ricotta was really yummy and a great cheese substitution. The server was really friendly, kept checking in on us and gave me vegan suggestions she liked when I asked. I food came out pretty quickly. The pizza was messy to eat because nothing is really holding the toppings to the crust. So the tomatoes kept sliding off. The almond ricotta comes in mounds so you need to spread it out a bit (unless you like it really concentrated). The pizza dough and olive oil/herb blend they used were fantastic. Great flavor. I've been putting off coming here because wasn't sure about the vegan options I saw on the menu but really glad I tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Heirloom Tomato Pizza, the almond ricotta is

pk-sBTnyrobDHYLpB42jpw.text: True Food is a long time favorite that doesn't often disappoint. I usually go to the Scottsdale Quarter location, which is far busier, but the Biltmore location is a nice slower-paced restaurant with a relaxing vibe.   I always get the veggie crudites. The tzatziki and olive dips are just amazing and it is a perfect light appetizer that supplements a healthy meal. I usually opt for the grilled chicken salad but decided to go for the Tuscan kale salad and added protein. I was quite happy with my choice and enjoyed my lunch very much (and felt good after).  I have been with friends/family who have not been happy with their orders but the wait staff has always been kind enough to work through a solution. I personally have never had a bad experience with my order here. I love True Food for lunch and am glad to have the option of the Biltmore location for a more relaxed vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KMoo5oY_Y8anQqrzRZLY4Q.text: We had a group and we booked the clear glass private room in the back to celebrate a graduation lunch.  We ended up with a few extra people and they were totally flexible and accommodating.  We had had support from management and a good server.  Everyone liked their food and there was something different for everyone.  There was just one meal that was ok, the steak tacos, the beans were bland.  We appreciate the service and good meal.

kPmjnQzj1UhzWHVaothlaA.text: Wasn't sure how much I'd like this place. I was walking around with others when I HAD to eat something. True Food was the closest food place. I didn't know what exactly to expect.   I got the summer fish tacos. Very good. I don't know what was in it other than fish... but for being something new it was a pleasant surprise and taste.  The Hummus was amazing! There's so much hummus with such little pita bread. Thankfully staff was more than happy to bring us more pita. That alone was very satisfying. Next time I'm craving CLEAN fresh food I'll stop by again

y50ruGT1gZV_ZIG_RxWEBg.text: Tasty, energizing food!  Liked this place enough to visit twice in one week. Right off the bat: Servers are extremely friendly and efficient. Also important to know, if you are very hungry, i would recommend ordering a few things.  That being said, the food tastes amazing and you will feel good eating it.   First trip: Ancient grains bowl with chicken. Not too filling but hit the spot and i could taste everything so well. Get it  Second trip: inside out Quinoa burger. Again very tasty but didn't fill me up. Should have ordered something else.   Overall: Definitely try his place! Only criticism, could get pricey to be full and satisfied.   Savor the flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Quinoa burger with half kale, half hash. Easy to customize.
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Full Quinoa burger meal with the hash and kale.

UTP98aD02jNkCCxPXDNO8Q.text: My FAV restaurant!! OMG love the Crudites and Dip!! Quinoa Sandwich!  Enjoyed the patio and the service was prompt and kind!

KA6xNtCC1InLf4M3P2y8xA.text: This restaurant was amazing. Delicious food, amazing staff.......a phenomenal manager. I ate at the bar and watched the manager help all the employees and just go above and beyond. I have never been so impressed. I showed up maybe five minutes after they opened at 11 and by noon every table  in the place was full including the outdoor seating. My food was amazing, my drink was delicious. I would recommend this place to everyone. If you haven't eaten at True food kitchen you haven't lived.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JOpe4EOOb_ausPk-rThkjg.text: I love the food here!  To bad I can only get here when I'm in the Phoenix area ....so I always try to make it a reason to build in lunch when we are going through.   They have fresh and organic ingredients and many plant based options

LZ7gjqK5wQ-een3w3fx0PA.text: True Food Kitchen is one of my favorite restaurants, as seen by my past review. It isn't close to our house, and for us, it is considered a treat because we don't eat out much. So I am disappointed to leave this updated review, and even more disappointed about our recent experience. On Thursday we went to this location and were excited to find out that they have a "Paleo" menu now. I was finally able to try the spaghetti squash casserole with the modifications. It was absolutely phenomenal and my husband agreed!  But the watermelon and heirloom tomato appetizer was not good at all, super bland, and for the price, extremely disappointing. I am not one to complain though, so I just let it go. On Saturday it was my birthday and I wasn't feeling that great and my husband offered to drive and get me True Food Kitchen (like I said we are not close). Since we were celebrating and I knew it would be a long time until I ate here again, I decided to try something else in addition to the spaghetti squash casserole. So we both got the Good Earth Cobb Salad and added chicken (and had the salad with Paleo modifications). Well the salads were ok, but the chicken that was added on was a couple slices of chicken breast. Unfortunately, the prices were not listed on the paleo menu and now I know that those salads cost $18 each. I am extremely disappointed that we were charged so much for a salad that was so minuscule and lackluster. I am the first person to understand that quality food costs more, but this is just greed and I am very disappointed. True Food, you can do better!

xHXIybe9rpw2wNwDrOo_kQ.text: Wow! This place is definitely worth going to!
