Real ingredients and a tasteful menu with plenty of options and even lots of gluten-free options for my mother-in-law who has celiacs. We went for brunch and I told my husband he had to take me back several times so I could try more food. The cocktails are quite delicious and they even have a wide variety of clever non-alcoholic drinks. They can get super crowded so I suggest reservations. Bon Appetit

HO4VDFc5zVry95q8VlU3CQ.text: I got the Poke. The rice was way too much..for 20$ not a good balance. And its not about the $ its about the value

ISJdF9gwosqldCtrM3R5fg.text: Amazing food! Gorgeous atmosphere. Wonderful service! Up beat clean unique fresh quality food. Healthy made tasty! LOTS of amazing Vegan options but still a variety on the menu for your meat eater peeps.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ltAhAzSqvW_wvTknCquDWA.text: Absolutely loved this place! So delicious and healthy! Great choices! And great location too

507huLWUIvzMg3DNVjovNg.text: Healthy options here...it's True....foods kitchen!  I love their Seabass entree. I haven't had the spaghetti squash casserole in a long time, but I remember liking it at the time. Their pizza is yummy too!  Restaurant week came by not too long ago and I felt like going here twice because the first time was that good!   So on a weekday and the weekend, I basically ate the same thing.   First course:  Shitaki lettuce cups (tofu, jicama, Thai basil, cashew, sambal) & hummus - both very flavorful, tofu mix tasted hearty for a vegan appetizer  Wild caught albacore tataki w/avocado, jalapeno, yuzu ponzu - this was presented and tasted sharp and salty in a good way  Second course:  Scottish Steelhead Salmon w/smoked onion farro, arugula, corn, roasted beets, pumpkin seeds - I loved this entree! Salmon was cooked medium ish medium rare with a soft pink flesh center. The combo is genius! Flavor, colors and textures were perfect!   Dessert:  flourless chocolate cake w/vanilla ice cream, caramel, cocoa nibs - decadent chocolate but balances well with the vanilla and the nibs give it a solid crunch The chia seed pudding came with bananas and toasted coconut - a nice and light dessert if you don't want something heavy  I also got the refreshing seasonal watermelon drink!   Battle of weekday vs weekend:  Weekday: I enjoyed the albacore tataki this day maybe because it had more avocado, heartier and bigger bowl of shitaki tofu app, great service  Weekend: the shitaki lettuce cups just tasted a bit more overcooked and didn't seem as big in portion as the weekday.  Refill was available on the watermelon refresher as it was not on the weekday. The forever nightmare - friend had the grass-fed steak tacos. Good stuff right? Until she got to the middle of the second taco. A dark think piece of short hair. Hard not to gag, but so sad the rest of that taco went to waste. So sad. And sad I have to envision that hair because I love tacos!  Winner = Starboy weekday  Loser = weekend weak end

hwYaKEittrp3qIGhF9qSMw.text: This place has gone down hill. From the food to the service it's really not good anymore.  So I ordered a margarita pizza add goat cheese and after we ordered we were informed that we have a new server. I'm totally cool with that. The pizza came out with only goat cheese no mozzarella. Once again I'm cool I understand mistakes happen so I told them and when the pizza came back they added the mozzarella and I couldn't believe the brought out this pizza it was so burnt I wish I had pictures. So I told them and 15 minutes later my new pizza how I ordered it arrived. Did a manager come by and apologize? Nope! Did they offer to bring me something while I waited for my food and everyone was eating? Nope! Did they do the right thing and take it off the check? Nope! $80 tab couldn't eat dinner with my family should have probably made things right. I won't be back anytime soon. Plus we boxed up my sons pizza and they accidentally threw the box away so they made him a new pizza. Why did it have the gluten free crust I have zero idea. Just completely dropped the ball tonight. Incompetent manager and staff!

WxOt9U5g6_-Yxx0vzNmZdQ.text: I've been attempting to be healthy for the last few weeks (ugh) so I ended up here after a long day of school with a gf. Their patio is well shaded and with the misters on we were comfortable even in Phoenix in June. Our server was prompt in greeting us and offering a refresher and tea. I ordered the Sparkling Antioxidant Tea { organic iced green tea | pomegranate | lemon} and it was just as refreshing as it sounds! For lunch I ordered the Ancient Grains bowl (vegan). It comprised of miso glazed sweet potato, turmeric, charred onion, snow pea, grilled portobello, avocado, red quinoa, and hemp seed. The miso glaze on the sweet potatoes was to die for! And everything else complimented the bowl perfectly. It was a great mix of flavors and very filling. I'm sure I will be frequenting this and other True Food Kitchen locations in pursuit of my summer (2019!) body!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Lv-7tL0xpHzPUeheB33k6A.text: As of this review (September 2017), there are currently a whopping 23 True Food locations across eleven states - which often has me surprised that the millennial crowd isn't more quick to dismiss TFK as an evil chain. But at the same time, it almost seems to be tailored made for Yelp, as users generally seem to rave about places that cater towards the vegan/vegetarian/anti-gluten crowd. And believe me, True Food is definitely one of those places that seems to be targeting all of the people that simultaneously developed food allergies around 2009. Not that there's anything wrong with that, of course.  TFK has been on our bookmark list for years. We've passed by this particular Biltmore location many times, but have always put off going there for various reasons. For one, it looks like the kind of place I'd eat at if I just had a coronary bypass and forced to drastically modify my diet. Additionally, as I've mentioned in practically every Fox concept restaurant I've ever tried - I just can't bring myself to look past the whole hip-corporate vibe that just feels so damned sterile and uninspiring.  But when the mood is right and if I choose my menu items very carefully, Fox Concepts can actually deliver a decent meal. And this is one of those instances where I'm willing to openly admit that the food here is actually respectable.  Although the menu isn't really my style, there are thankfully some options for people like myself who still eat meat and don't count calories. The menu appears to be seasonal for summer (even though it's now Fall). I'm guessing they have several main staples that are permanent, while rotating out other items that are only available at certain times of the year.  I ordered myself a honey lemonade and my girlfriend and I split some of their kale guacamole. The lemonade was a bit weaker than I like - although I didn't really expect to find the diabetic coma-level lemonade that can be obtained at a place like Matt's Big Breakfast. The guac was just okay, but a bit too new-age for my taste buds. Neither one of us were impressed with the chips.  For my main entree, I ordered the grass-fed burger which had a nice flax seed bun. Meat was good quality and my girlfriend and I both agreed that it was actually superior to the burgers served at the nearby Fox-owned Zinburger, which is kind of funny. Mine came with kale salad and some sweet potato hash. The hash was dry and bland, while the kale was fine, but not really my style.  My girlfriend ordered the steak tacos, which naturally, also get the grass-fed buzzword status. Joking aside, the tacos were also good quality, having great-tasting meat and including some avocado, greek yogurt, and cilantro. They're full-size tacos (two) and come with a small bowl of decent beans.  For dessert, I found most of their choices a bit lame, but given the way the menu is developed, I kind of expected this. We opted for the chia seed pudding, which included coconut and banana. Neither one of us had had tried chia seed pudding before, so I'll at least give them some credit for exposing us to something different. It's an overall light dessert that still tasted satisfying on the level of a smoothie.  The question is: Would we ever come back?  Honestly, some day, we probably will. Although I maintain that this food isn't really something I'd regularly crave, I can easily see why it's very popular with all the urban locals. Out of all of the Fox Concepts restaurants we've tried, this is easily one of the better ones out there.  I'd definitely recommend it, but it appears that we're basically the last people in Phoenix to actually try it.

Great Upscale Fast-Casual Restaurant in AZ True Foods is in an upscale mall/area in Phoenix. I came here during lunch on a Friday and they were very busy, so prepare for a wait during lunch time. The place was decorated well and the employees were very nice. I ordered the curried cauliflower soup and the hummus platter. It was very good, especially the soup. The food is definitely good and that explains their prices as well; those two items cost $20 together.

3xdrTOm_PpJHpRjIbdkOUQ.text: True Food is one of my absolute favorites!!! They offer fantastic food you don't have to feel guilty about eating!! My go-to is always their bowls, Ancient Grain is the Best!! Their sweet potato hash is also to die for! The inside out Quinoa Burger is amazing as well! I've never had anything quite like it! If you enjoy quinoa definitely give it a try!! Last week I had the opportunity to try their soup of the day, which was a Thai Curry! Wow! It was perfectly spicy and filling! Last but obviously not least... True Food's cocktails are soooo delicious and beautiful! Wild Orchid is one of the best! It comes with a gorgeous flower garnish!

02XwZBkbrPV9sT-toJp4RA.text: while i cannot deny that True food kitchen offers quality food with fresh and healthy ingredients (with calorie information printed neatly on the menu), i think the food lacks a little UMPH and depth of flavor. the restaurant itself is brightly lit, neatly organized, and very clean; service is quick and not overbearing with a casual vibe; the layout is beautiful - HUGE open kitchen, bar seating, and plenty of tables (including a semi private area in the back). I've been here on two occasions - once for solo dinner (had the spicy panang curry with chicken) and once for a team lunch (seasonal salad with chicken). the food arrives quickly so it was perfect for both occasions.  i think the price tag to food yumminess ration leaves room for improvement..

uD5A3sPl9NuIHYnXIqf_TQ.text: Let me start by saying I am a big fan of True Food Kitchen.  I've been a frequent customer at both locations.  I love the food, the philosophy, the ambience and usually the service.  I've never written a review, but after my most recent experience I wanted to share some observations.  The last 2 visits our charred cauliflower has been comped because it's taken so long to come out of the kitchen (20-25 minutes) it came after our entrees.  There is inconsistency in how the charred cauliflower dish comes out (some have more/less nuts/dates, more/less harissa sauce, more/less dill), which I don't really mind because its all delicious. But they may want to work on consistency of preparation of this dish.  Our most recent visit was 1/11/2019 (a slow Monday) and we were sitting at the bar, so I'm not really sure why it took so long to notice our app was going on 25 minutes and still not ready?  We also ordered the ramen and a salad and that took even longer to come out.  On a Monday.    This is my observation for the TFK managers to pay attention to:  We sat at the bar and watched the steady stream of take-out pick ups, and shared space at the bar with Uber eats and Door Dash drivers who were in and out non-stop. There were several staff dedicated to prepping all the to-go bags. I get it that this is a new and profitable segment of your business, but please don't privilege the take-out and delivery drivers at the expense of your live, in person guests sitting at your bar wanting both your food and the experience of being out.  We are important paying guests too.  And our bill includes alcohol, which is where you and your servers make the most money, so keep an eye on the speed of processing our orders as well.  Thank you!!

087w5ZiLTWbHb-jNI0ISYg.text: I have eaten here for years and the food is reliably delicious and fresh.  I try to experience one of everything here -- drink, appetizer, meal, dessert -- even if you're splitting with someone just to taste it!  Desserts are rich and not too sweet which I love.  Menu changes slightly by season.  Great for kids as they have a separate menu.

TDOzfcY2d6MlcnvzCMifug.text: This is a solid spot for a healthy and delicious meal. I had dinner with some friends on a Friday night, the place was packed but not bursting at the seems. The service is very fast and the wait staff is friendly. We were pondering a bottle of Cannonau from Italy that the waitress was not very familiar with, she asked the bartender about the flavor profile and reported back to us. We ended up sending the bottle back because the wine was really terrible and might have turned. We got a new bottle of Pinot noir from Oregon which was way better. This restaurant really stands out when it comes to food being prepared in an unfussy manner and flavor profiles that pack a punch. My favorite dish here is the edamame dumplings with dashi and truffle oil.  I literally need a moment to compose myself after biting in to a dumpling because it's that good. The edamame filling is texturally pleasing and hearty, it's creamy and has a edamame taste that is not too overpowering. The dashi and truffle oils compliments the earthy edamame flavor enough to curl your toes. I have ordered this dish many of times and it is always pleasing to the palate. The other dishes are also very good. I ordered the striped bass as my main course, the grill lines on that perfectly crisp skin was divine. The savory and hint of sweet flavor was well balanced and worked very well in the that dish.

I ordered tulsi tea for my beverage and was surprised that it cost four dollars for a tea bag in a mug, so I'll go for the apple soda next time instead--it was a real hit!

The bar was also able to make a great Moscow Mule, a beverage not regularly on the menu. My friend got the fish tacos and I got the grilled chicken salad. We also got he kale guacamole which was not bad at all. The kale wasn't overpowering which I liked. It's a good place to go to if you are looking for a clean eating option. 9Q5wqdRSDF2VX4ecxEmmjw.text: How do they do it?  How do they make simple ingredients taste so dang good!!  This place has become my go-to-fav!  The menu has choices for a variety of pallets. They use fresh, local organic ingredients.  On our first visit my daughter ordered a quinoa burger, I won't lie I had my doubts but it was great!  The meal came with a kale salad the dressing was superb. I ordered the tri tip street tacos the meat was tender and extremely flavorful.  I hear breakfasts' here are really good too, this review will definitely have a part 2!

8zwci5pRjyVcL2POICbDBQ.text: After 9 days on the road from Florida to Phoenix, we were in desperate need of some vegetables. Boyfriend had the inside out quinoa burger with half and half kale salad and sweet potato hash which was delicious. I had the turkey burger with half kale salad and sweet potato hash.   The meal was delicious, by far the best kale salad I have ever had. But my sweet potatoes were a tad undercooked. I also ordered the citrus skinny margarita which was awesome, fruity with the right amount of Anejo tequila.  At the end we ordered the flourless chocolate cake and the gluten free key lime pie. We absolutely loved the flourless chocolate cake. It came with vanilla ice cream, caramel and cocoa nibs which added a nice bit of crunch and a balance of flavors. but I still missed my graham cracker crust. Overall, it was a really good meal. Service was super friendly & attentive. Would definitely return.

xHef_H89frFY59Njum1Xqg.text: We ordered takeout and got the following:   Butternut Squash pizza (smoked onion, organic kale, vegan almond ricotta, dried cranberry)  House-Made Chicken Sausage pizza (organic tomato, roasted fennel, scamorza)  Ancient Grains bowl (miso glazed sweet potato, turmeric, charred onion, snow pea, grilled portobello, avocado, hemp seed)  Grass-Fed Burger (umami mushroom, caramelized onion, arugula, Parmesan, mayonnaise, flax seed bun) with side of Sweet Potato Hash   The Butternut Squash pizza was amazing - was very impressed by the vegan almond ricotta. House-Made Chicken was average, as was the burger and Sweet Potato Hash (bit dry). The bowl was mediocre and small on the portion side. Wish the glazed sweet potatoes were cooked a bit more. Overall, an okay experience. Maybe better if we dined in.

IwAQkM2AVwwFDf9G5tAmnQ.text: I guess everything was good enough. The service was pretty decent but we got seated right by a busy walk way when there was plenty of open tables away from foot traffic. All the male servers on the shift looked creepily alike, I guess they hire a type. It was kinda funny. Parking is always a pain at the Biltmore but at least I didn't lose my token! They do validate.

NX_AHh5fG4Ne4xh-JxTMyQ.text: Excellent food with knowledgeable wait staff. Great experience. I had one of my all time favorite dishes Cashew Pad Thai and it was outstanding.  We started with hummus and pita. The glute free pita was even better than their regular pita.  Wine recommendations by our waitress were perfect.   Clean True food - Something good for everyone.

jTdWrzLf8xo_BgOiY_OEog.text: Seriously, BOMBASSFOOD!! Not really much else to say then if you're looking for a yummy/ healthy spot then this is the place...

IFkJ5N8IsSkhfre_9vrnSg.text: I had an unbelievably delicious AND healthy meal tonight at True Food Kitchen: SUSTAINABLE STEELHEAD* Smoked Onion Tabbouleh, Arugula, Golden Beet & Cilantro Pumpkin Seed Pesto. I'm new to eating healthy and cooking healthy. I'd love to get the recipe for this meal...are you listening True Foods?   I like scrumptious or spicy food over bland. The lemon whatever they tossed the arugula in was unexpectedly yummy and addicting. The trout was moist, delicious and pretty! :-) The tabbouleh was plentiful and made me full by the time I finished scooping up every morsel. I'm now officially glad there's a True Foods closer by at the Biltmore.   The first time I went to a True Foods, I had a salad that looked like they just arranged all the prettiest raw veggies from the farmer's market they could find and crammed them into a bowl. It looked like art but it also felt like I was just eating from the produce section. It was boring. It had no taste. But I care more about healthy eating now than I did that first visit.   If other items on their menu are this tasty, True Foods and I are going to become close.   I recommend restaurants to my high end matchmaking clients all the time. I like that you can go for a walk after dinner and hold hands window shopping or go for an after dinner drink at one of the many nice places at both TF locales... Biltmore Fashion Park and Scottsdale Quarter.

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. unbelievably delicious AND healthy @TrueFoods: SUSTAINABLE STEELHEAD Trout Smoked Onion Tabbouleh Arugula Golden Beet &amp; Pesto

DCluG8-Yq-G-uaoExY98KA.text: What an amazing experience at True Food. The food was exceptional. The red curry shrimp...OMG to die for. It was my husband's birthday and I couldn't of been happier with  the service. Our waitress was so nice and so component at explaining the menu to us. The avocado and kale dip appetizer was superb. We couldn't  wait for dessert .... Of course they out did themselves with the chocolate flourless cake which was amazing.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to add a few healthy options to their palette.

8wq16qtfdNws96keZ4ACww.text: Love this place! bought chicken pita and quinoa burger they were delicious! I would say that chicken pita and needs to be a little bit more easy to eat but otherwise really delicious

XtLKvy-7pqZ14m7t1nZl1A.text: I wrote a review about True Foods a couple of months ago and it wasn't in their favor. I received a very nice email from them advising that my review was appreciated and while I didn't have a great experience, they would certainly like me to give their establishment another shot. After all, they pride their restaurant in great customer service and excellent food quality and they want their guest to return. I was provided a gift card to try it again and today was the day for me to see if my last experience was a fluke or if my experience was not uncommon.  Since I was by myself, I sat at the bar and was greeted by a friendly smile and immediate service. Already a better experience. I ordered the same thing as last time, grass-fed beef with no mayo nor bun and a kale salad without breadcrumbs. My food swiftly came out, but when I bit into the medium burger their was an abundance of char. Since I know that some restaurants like to char their burgers I asked the bartender if this was the way the burger was supposed to be cooked. It was cooked medium, as I asked, it was just charred on the outside. He immediately took my plate, apologized and advised he would get me a new dish. That was not my intention, but the proactivity and eagerness to please his customer was apparent. Within a short time a manager, named Desiree, approached me with my new order and graciously thanked me for my patience and apologized for how my previous burger came out. When I placed my cards on the table to pay the tab, I was brought a check without an amount due. Desiree again approached me thanking me for coming in.  I can tell you that my experience today was one that I will always remember, in a positive way. It's not about them taking care of the tab, it's 100% about the fact that my bartender took ownership without me asking for my burger being sent back, the manager apologizing for the mistake, my second meal tasting absolutely amazing, and having an optimal customer experience. I will be back and hope that others will read this review and give True Foods a try.  Well done, True Foods! Thank you for an amazing customer experience and a delicious lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of True Food Kitchen - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Absolutely wonderful grass-fed burger with kale salad (no breadcrumbs).

4EnL4ljvTAgxCDO6vS9cGA.text: Absolutely blown away by the amazing customer service here! Scott is an amazing manager and this business truly has a business model that all businesses should take after!  I've eaten many different food items from here and have loved each bite! Excellent, healthy ingredients and excellent cooks!

6TqMgpf_B0MJNlCDacf69g.text: Tasty real food, what else can I say. Simple ingredients put together simply, but with studied exactness, produces quite a culinary experience. I have eaten here before on a whim and have thought enough of this place to keep it in my thoughts and return. I do not live in the area, or country for that matter, so when I am in this area, there are a lot of other untried options available. So why did I return?
